thine euerlaſting light thy god thy glory thy sunne ſhall neuer goe downe neither ſhall thy moone hid lord ſhall thine euerlaſting light dayes thy ſorrow ſhall ended aſſurance church ought conſidered death ſlew cruelly raigned three yeares tenne monethes eight dayes body suetonius rehearſeth ſecretly carried garden lamius halfe burnt couered litle earth age 24 yeares tirant prouoked god men againſt could otherwiſe end day caligula baniſhed herod tetrarch went rome perſwaſion herodias yeare 40 towne lion gaul died pouertie ſaid herodias harlot ſame yeare iewes endured great affliction one alexandria vpon occaſion caligula ordained iuriſdiction romanes ſhould builded vnto temple aultars ſhould worſhip god iewes alone reſiſted impietie many grecian alexandria wiſhed death vnto iewes therefore tooke occaſion make odious vnto emperour except obeyed ordinance came proofe iewes reſiſted ſtrongly ſedition ſuch many ſlaine ſides cauſe finally debated rome caligula peruerſe man made chaſe away philo iewe pleaded iewes cauſe ſaidnaucle behooueth v emperour hateth take courage neceſſarie god ſhould helpe humane ſuccours faileth caligula vſed ſay would god romane people one head iewes alſo greatly afflicted babilon chaldean seleucia siria two bretheren iewes two brother iewes baſe condition one named aſniens anileus robber theeues gathered together great number rakehell diſordered perſons artanabus ſeeing euill encreaſe thought good remedie late finally mooued proweſſe theſe two yoong men receiued amitie gaue gouernment kingdome babilon see ioſeph 18 booke laſt eternall kingdome bleſſed lifted vp aloft bright cloude receiued heauen ſitteth right hand power god muſt conſider aduancements encreaſe primitiue church made apoſtles diſciples faithfull may know yeare natiuitie chriſt 19 kingdome tiberius death steuen high prieſts ieruſalem ſtirred grieuous perſecutions againſt church saul alſo paul choſen perſecute faithfull conuerſion burnt falſe zeale 22 many martired others conſtrained retire themſelues country adiacent occaſioned goſpell ſpread abroad yeare fortie fiue natiuitie lord ieſus chriſt twelue yeares reſurrection third yeare caligula great perſecution ſtirred herode agrippa againſt chriſtians wherein iames brother iohn beheaded peter put priſon angell lorde drewe moſt miraculouſly soone lord reuenged death happened herode went ceſarea cauſe hee hadde enterpriſed warre againſt tyrrians sidonians preuented gaining chamberlaine blastus demaunding peace one day herode ſumptuouſly adorned ſate downe throne ſpake people made acclamation god himſelfe hadde ſpoken vnto herode incontinently ſtrooken angell lorde conſumed vermine died miſerably becauſe hee yeelded glorie vnto god ſo perſecution ceaſed heere ſecond mirrour god iudgement againſt ſuch oppreſſe church saint paul conuerſion returned fiue time ieruſalem laſt beeing hee recited hiſtorie miniſterie aſſembly elder church preaching greatly ſpread abroad neither ceaſed hee plant goſpell whereſoeuer went appeareth act preached rome ſpace two yeares although priſoner aſſembly faithfull epiſtle romanes witneſſeth philippe apoſtle preached samaria church retired thither death saint steuen azote church aſſembled thence went maritine townes peter apoſtle alſo preached goſpell many townes large ſeene hiſtorie act origine tome vpon geneſis ſaith ſeemeth peter came rome gouerned church twentie fiue yeares hardly ſhewe time time vnder emperour firſt saint peter rome came rome time ſay namely yeare fortie foure natiuitie lord ieſus ſay hee ruled church twentie fiue yeares hath likelihood may eaſily gathered epiſtle galath hee ieruſalem yeare 51 apoſtles great councell held let yeares numbred yeare thirtie fiue paul cōuerted adde ſeuenteen euen vntill councell come fiftie two could ſeuen yeares bee rome hee returned ſoone luke would haue concealed beene ſo neither found hiſtorie credit saint peter entred rome hee left place returne towne may plainely knowne saint peter rome time paul death ſo nie paul hauing occaſion make mention would haue forgotten saint peter hee hadde beene many wiſe good men haue handled matter large vnto referre nero endured till death commaundement tyrantcrime impoſed vpon chriſtians fire lightned towne rome none ſhould ſay act hee laide fault vppon chriſtians made die many kindes deathes called themſelues peeces others put ſome paled parke fought till ſlewe one others led • ands ſpend liues 14 day aprill foreſaid yeare titus laide ſiege ieruſalem feaſt eaſter yeare chriſt 73 vpon day reſpect ſolemnitie infinite people aſſembled 22 moneth hee made platformes rammes beganne beate towne 7 day may tooke firſt wall new towne called bezeth 12 day ſaid moneth ſecond wall taken baſe part townethe taking ieruſalem whence romanes bene chaſed 21 ſaid moneth hauing gotten 2 part towne gently inuited thē require peace ſeeing would cauſed platformes ſet vp againſt fort called antonia nie 3 wal iewes burnt new wall made ye roman enuironed towne hinder lewes flying ſeeking victualls firſt day iuly titus mooued compaſſiō people ſuffered endured ſo much hard obſtinacie ſome beganne beate antonia third wall ſixt day fell one part wall fortreſſe ſide iewes conueyance towne eight day moneth auguſt iewes repreſſed great outrage blowes arrowes heraulds ſent titus make harken vnto peace temple might haue bene ſpared temple taken force againſt edict defence titus burnt 20 day began batter high towne called citie dauid iewes againe refuſed peace ſeuenth day september high towne taken whereof temple fortreſſe antonia defence temple eight day ſaid moneth towne put fire bloud 24 day october titus celebrated day brother domitian natiuitie taritine towne ceſaria made paſtimes diuers ſorts wherein tenth part euils fearefull calamity miſerable nation enduredrom 10 let v ſtray fooliſh imagination thinke ſelues god ſpared naturall braunches ſhall become v let v behold benignitie ſeueritie god iuriſdiction king friend confederate romanes made ſeruants reduced prouinces aſcanius pedianus hiſtoriographer flouriſhed time 73 yeare age became blinde liued yet 12 yeares great honour earthquake ouerthrew three townes ciprus titus eleuenth emperour veſpaſians ſonne raigned two yeares twentie dayes hee liberall gentle eloquent greeke tongue hee vſed ſay none ought goe preſence prince ſad deſolate linus biſhop rome commaundement conſul saturnine beheaded vpon falſe accuſation art magickelinus naucler 2 yeare titus horrible thing happened campania called terra dilauoro land labour mount veſnue lookes toward sea naples coaſt hath comming great ſprings fire burſt ſunder top caſt ſo great flame burnt townes adiacent men therein came alſo rome litle time men ignorant happened campania great horrible calamites ſo much many opinion thing would ouerthrowne sunne would fall earth multitude aſhes ſmoake diſpearſed ayre yeare following titus went ſee calamitie come meane many thing burnt aſia leſſe aboue epheſus came great age ireneus ſaith ordeined biſhop apoſtles likely began miniſtery 2 3 traian ierome catalogue ſaith placed iohn euangeliſt dyed yeare 68 paſſion ieſus chriſt moſt ſay ireneus reciteth one day marcian encountred ſaid vnto take knowledge v policarp anſwered know thee firſt ſonne satan ireneus ſaith ſome haue heard ſay iohn diſciple ieſus went bathe waſh himſelfe ſeeing cerinthus hereticke therethe company heretickes daungerous went waſhing himſelfe ſaying let v flie hence leaſt houſe fall vpon v cerinthus enemy truth waſheth note diſciples apoſtles rule communicate falſifie truth goſpell whileſt policarpus rome withdrew many hereſies marcus aurelius antoninus verus brother antonius pius obtained empire 18 yeares lucius ʋerus ſonne lawe gaue himſelfe dice haunt stewes therfore ſent siria marcus aurelius chro emper laſt ſome ſay poiſoned ſome dyed apoplexe marcus aurelius antoninus raigned alone fourth perſecution nero ſtirred againſt chriſtians marcus aurelius fourth perſecution euſebius ſaith many euils happened italie great peſtilence warre earthquake invndations water multitude graſhoppers meane perſecutions continuall chriſtians affaire encreaſed day day doctrine apoſtles diſciples wherof yet many liue chriſtian religion tooke ſtrong roote thus bedeawed bloud martyr muſt forget ſentence iustine ſpoken colloquie trypheus hee ſaith thussoter men may day perceiue beleeue chriſt cannot aſtoniſhed turned backe let cut head let crucifie v let expoſe v beaſts fire torment ſo much men torment v ſo much number chriſtians encreaſe euen vine cut make fertile vine god hath planted sauiour ieſus people cannot multiply torment c melito biſhop sardis writ emperour faith chriſtian religion apollinaris biſhop hierapolis time theophilus biſhoppe antioche writ againſt martian denis biſhop corinthe iustus biſhoppe ʋienne martyre faith attalus blandina photin biſhop lion martyr alſo faith perſecution aſia end life policarpus time marcus antonius verus chiefe gouernours empire cauſed ſuch perſecution came euen chriſtians dwelt towne smyrna whereof policarpus biſhoppe beene long time burnt hauing ſerued church god three ſcore tenne yeares ſeuenth emperour ſay hee age foure ſcore ſixe yeares prayer policarpus death eccleciaſt hiſtory booke 4 bone taken fire laide sepulchre pionius martyre soter italian 13 popeanno dom 169 helde himſelfe fire vpon vaineglorie cataphrygesat time beganne cataphryges heretikes montanus priſcilla maximilla auguſtin vſed sacrifice childes blood mingled flowre breade childe whoſe blood drawne dyed held martyr liued great prieſt montanus phrygia towne called ardaba hee called himſelfe paraclet hee forbadde marriage inuented inſtituted faſtes againſt thoſe heretickes writte apollinaris hierapolitaine milciades apollonius appelles diſciple marcian whome theodotius called great hereticke put beginning god alſo chriſt appeared fantaſticke bodie tatianus follower encratites seuerians time theſe abſtained kindes fleſh drunke wine blamed marriage well fornication caſt epiſtles paul peter doctrine chriſtian libertie beganne time bee greatly obſcured little little errour tooke encreaſe although yet forbidding vſe good thinges godthe vſe thing indifferent yet hiſtorie alcibiades recited euſebius booke 5 chap 3 ſheweth little little men beganne place certaine religion ſeruices forged pleaſure alcibiades one martyres ſuffered death gaul vnder marcus antonius verus emperour alcibiades hee vſed liue ſo auſterely hee eate onely bread drunke water ſo much beeing priſon hee would vſe diet attalus romane man renowned amongſt martyr alſo impriſoned ſhewed alcibiades better way brought point hee vſed indifferently creature god without ſcruple thankeſgiuing eleutherius borne greece nicopolis anno domi 179 ruled rome 15 yeares hee made commaundement againſt hereſie seuerans raigned chriſtian ceremonie ſhould reiect ſort meates whereof accuſtomed vſe alſo none ſhould diſmiſſed office vnleſſe firſt hee accuſed conuinced crime biſhops ſhould finiſh nothing accuſation intended againſt biſhop without knowledge pope might determine sentence cauſes church people clarke may drawne cauſe biſhop cauſe ſuſpition might appeale chriſtian religion greatly augmented came farre greater ſuertie beforecommodus lucius naucle lucius king england countrey receiued faith many noble rome wiues child conuerted baptized ſaid lucius left kingdome went preach faith firſt france almaine hee martyred chroni euſeb smyrna aſia whereof policarpus biſhop ouerthrowne earthquake lawes touching faſts alſo breake marriage affirming holy ghoſt taught apoſtles himſelfe gift conferre grace holy ghoſt ſuch blaſphemies whereby hee looked come vnto ſome primacie romaine biſhoppes ecclips daylight ſeemed obſcuritie darke night alſo ſo terrible earthquake ſome whole townes ſwallowed ouerturne earth sapor king perſians gordian obteined many victory againſt perſians chaſed sapor king perſians euen antioch held perſians recouered care niſible meanes came paſſe eaſt brought ſubiect vnto romane empire iulius capitolin rehearſeth gordians life councell philadelphia confute berillus councell held vnder gordian philadelphia arabia origenes ouercame brought good wayphillip iulius phillippus arabian ſonne alſo called phillip ſucceeded gordian empirethe firſt chriſtian emperours chriſtians conuerted vnto faith pontian pontius romane senator baptized fabian hee mother seuera ſonne philip deſirous reſort company chriſtians fabian would admit vnto laſt vigiles eaſter refuſed accompliſhed whatſoeuer enioyned biſhop raigne philip heretickes arabia mainteined ſoules die body together ſhall riſe day iudgement origines went towards beeing ſent thither confounded day certaine anabaptistes ſay man dyeth ſoule ſleepeth vntil day iudgement execrable hereſie heretickes called helcheſciteshelcheſites heretickes euſebius ſaith lib 6 chap 38 elſecians epiphanius saint conqueſts probus emperour romane hiſtoriographers deſcribe carus ſucceeded yeare chriſt 284 aſſociated two ſonnes empire numerian carinus beganne new warre againſt perſians probus left imperfect ſent carinus gaules maintaine led numerian recouered warre meſopotamia hauing waſted region parthian got kingdome perſians see vopiſcus carus ſtrooken lightning dyed ſuddenly numerian great modeſtie giuen ſtudy eſpecially poeſie father lawe hauing laid ambuſhesnumerian ſlaine carinus ſlewe hee coach brother carinus man giuen wickednes defiled himſelfe bloud faithfull hauing empire alone theſe three raigned long time endured three whole yeares eutropius victor latus recite gouernment thoſe aforeſaid emperours brought ſome releaſe chriſtians ſo thing happened fauourable vnto themdiocleſian inſomuch ſome aduanced office gouernment vntill raigne diocleſian ſhall ſeene place caius biſhop rome dalmatia family diocleſian emperour damaſus euſebius ſaith ordained biſhop ſame yeare eutichian much adoo remained ten moneths biſhop attributed vnto decretall epiſtle wherein ſpeaketh meanly chriſt mediator iuſtification hee ſaith aſcend vnto dignitie biſhop men muſt goe degree eccleſiaſticall order firſt hee muſt portier lector c damaſus witneſſeth liued time diocleſian emperours perſecutions hid himſelfe dwelt vnder vaultes yet finally hee drawne death 12 yeare ſaid diocleſian gouerned church 15 yeares euſebius eleuen foure moneths damaſus lord hath beene ſaid gaue ſome releaſe church vntill kingdome diocleſian euſeb lib 8 cap 1 diocleſian emperour borne dalmatia ſecond yeare kingdome aſſociated empire maximiam herculean yeare brought vnder empire gaules bene occupied ruſtikes called bagaricles thence went affrike vanquiſhed gentian theſe two ſeeing affaire empire might better decided many named two ceſars gouerne vnder thē namely galerian conſtantinus father vnto conſtantine great euery imployed conquering loſt aboue recouer egipt achillas gotten yeare chriſt 298 eaſt alſo narſus gotten brought vnder yoake fiue prouinces beyond floud tigris reuolted romanes ſince traians time alſo britaine england ten yeares reuolt hauing chaſed away gareſius cranſſius againe alexandria thruſting themſelues company athanaſius hadde charge alexandria would admit arrius returned constantinople make complaint againſt athanaſius likewiſe hee ſought bring himſelfe force church alexander gouernment thereof oppoſed himſelf againſt ſaying author ſuch hereſiea tumult arrians perturber ſo many church ought bee receiued came great contention euſebians threatning would cauſe alexander bee baniſhed certaine dayes following arrians concluded introduce arrius force church alexander placing force armour pietie entred ouer night temple accompanied two houſehold teares church deliuer mee thy poore ſeruant preſent life next morning determination arrius enuironed great multitude euſebians ledde brought temple triumph come place called market place constantinople arles firſt counſell giuen young people meanes marry againe chance adulterie bee ſeperated wiues 5 gangia paphalagonia excommunicated anathematized ſuch condemned eate fleſh ſo offered vnto idol c item excommunicated ſuch iudged married prieſt ought excerciſe miniſterie becauſe marriage likewiſe ſuch abſtained miniſterie time vnder ſhadowe chaſtitie virginitie men began deſpiſe marriage gouerned church 23 yeares marianus 24 others giue 19 marcus ſucceeded gouerned romane church 2 yeares 8 moneths ierome damaſus ſaith romane father called priſcus ſay gaue biſhop oſtia priuiledge aboue others conſecrate biſhop rome right archipiſcopall pall called pallium would creed made councel nice ſhould ſung cleargie people reading goſpell platina bergomenſis polidorus builded temple adorned diuers gift preſents let faith examined haue written thereof sinodes cauſe athanaſius emperour conſtantine conſidering number accuſers athanaſius crime wherewith hee charged publiſhed sinode ceſaria palestine whereat athanaſius appearing doubted feare biſhop place euſebians cauſe hee cauſed councell nation aſſembled tyre calling athanaſius letter full indignation socrat li 1 chap 28 theodoret lib 1 chap 27 sozom lib 1 chap 25 athanaſius himſelfe ſecond apologie ſaid sinode found 60 biſhops moſt part orientalls athanaſius called sinode athanaſius came thither accompanied timotheus prieſt euſebians begin wicked part brought woman diſhoneſt life ſuborned faining haue vowed chaſtitie maintained athanaſius night would haue rauiſhed beeing preſſed anſwer accuſation ſpake word timothius perceiuing athanaſius held peace turned himſelfe towards woman ſaid vnto euer acquaintance thee euer lodge nigh thee woman cried poynting ſaid timothius finger ſhee ſaid thou force haſt violated mee calumniation beeing thus made knowne great confuſion inuented notwithſtanding iudges gouerned ſufficiently knew timothius athanaſius let ſaid woman goe ſauing good right athanaſius maintained leaſt ſhe ſhould haue named ſhe hyred impudent accuſation againe attempted againſt aduerſaries brought forth hand one named arſenius maintained haue beene murthered athanaſius hee demaunded amongſt knew arſenius queſtion many anſwered knewe well arſenius brought theyr preſence beeing againe asked arſenius whoſe hand cut confeſſed hee herevpon athanaſius diſcouering cloake ſhewed hee whole hand god giuen ſo liuely refutation made aduerſaries infamous refuge trouble sinode tumult ſedition theodoret li 1 cap 29 one ſaid aduerſaries called achab iohn got iudiciall ſeate eſcaped tumult socrat lib 1 chap 30 athanaſius ſeeing tumult fell great ſedition withdrew himſelfe sinode abſence condemned depoſed biſhopprick hee got constantinople ſhewed emperour iniuries sinode hadde done vnto ſought hee himſelfe would take knowledge cauſe emperour letter patent called againe biſhops sinode tyre constantinople might yeeld reaſon ſentence giuen againſt athanaſius sozomene lib 2 chap 28 ſayth euſebius theognes heretickes arriuing conſtantinople aſſuredly affirme emperour deuiſed againſt athanaſuis hyred witneſſes depoſed brought againſt athanaſius true emperour mooued rather deſire pacifie church thē accuſation aduerſaries baniſhed athanaſius gaul citie herers emperour certaine letter written people catholique church alexandria witneſſeth himſelf haue confined thither end bloudy enemy ſhould grieue touch ſacred head ſuch perſon theſe bee word meane thing neceſſary ſent athanaſius iulius firſt name ordained biſhop marc 25 yeare conſtantine chronicle hierome hee gouerned church 16 yeares hee ſon one rustike great combat maintaine quarels athanaſius faithfull doctor againſt arrians tripartite hiſtory ſaith councell nice time iulius poſſible biſhop ſome place howſoeuer plaine inough ſacrifice blaſphemie whereat emperour exceedingly grieued found meanes get rome come threatned death liberius manfully anſweredthe cōſtancy liberius ready endure rather chriſtians ſhould accounted arrians art thou ſaid emperour one wicked man troubleſt world word faith ſaid liberius dependeth vpon multitude baniſhed emperour conſtans berrea towne thrace hee bene two yeares called home ſaith theodoret reſtitution ſome accorded emperour requeſt many romanes weſterne biſhops ſame ſaith athanaſius alleadged epiſtle alſo liberius two yeares exile feared threatnings apprehenſion death ſealed condemnation athanaſius ruffin ſaith ſame hierome baleus ſaith writeth ambition liberius fell hereſie arrius fallen integritie faith finde ſome conſtitutions liberius namely make noiſes faſting time science church god alone ieſus chriſt dyed haue obſerued ſo many diſſentions altogether diſſipated waſted comming cauſe ſearched ſaith cauſe remembred place booke iudges written euery one whatſoeuer 8 chap 1 iohn caſſian collat father naucl coniuration made arrians councel sardis againſt two catholike biſhops eufrates ʋincentius cauſed whoore night time come chamber apoſtate people ſuddenly went millaine euſebius biſhop ʋerceil rhodamus wherevpon caſt church liberius lucifer metropolitane iles sardine oſius spaine ſent exile anno christi 361 ſaid oſius age many torment beating wound forced cōſent expoſition arrians thervnto ſubſcribe firſt volume councels tritenius ſaith oſius rich fearing either baniſhment loſſe good conſented arrians depoſe catholique biſhop called gregory fell downe chaire ſo died hereby aduertized nothing begin wel vnleſſe perſeuer vnto end vnder conſtantius many councels held namely tyre sardis millaine ſaid arimine syrmion pannonie nicea tharſe seleucia iſauria wherein faith father nice condemned felix borne rome ſonne one named anastaſis hauing bene deacon liberius thruſt place arrians hoping would conſent doctrine hee became true catholique greatly enuied word honor martyr enuy made aſſay mean torment hee would come execute iudgement iulian burnt deſire goe againſt perſians cruelly afflicted eaſt affected name partrike enterpriſed act laſt promiſed god returne expedition would yet commit greeuous thing againſt chriſtians ruffin lib 1 chap 36 doret lib 3 chap 21 euill ſhewed ſufficient witneſſe middeſt heate perſian warre hee tooke leiſure vomit ſeuen bookes againſt ieſus chriſt although contented himſelf write againſt chriſtians eutropius ſaith indeed expedition prepared skaffolde towne ieruſalem returne place biſhops monkes faithfull theſe place expoſe vnto beaſts baſile good doctor duty goe hither thither comfort exhort chriſtians publikely particularly meddle pollute thēſelues abhominatiōs gentilesiouinian deteſt yea gift honour emperour propoſed ſuch renounced chriſtianitie muſt forget prophetike anſwere schoolemaiſter antioche made libanius sophiſter iulian went againſt perſians libanius demaunded mocking chriſt thinkeſt thou doth carpenter ſonne time schoolemaiſter anſwered sophiſter creator al thing thou calledſt carpenter ſon make coffin encloſe iulian soone newes came iulia ſlaine behold end curſed apoſtate iulian horrible death iulian paſſed sea boſphore wintered antioche ſoone spring came paſſing hierapolis hee went meſopotamia paſſed floud hee fought againſt perſians receiued mortall wound caſting full handfull bloud ayre hee vttered blaſphemie againſt ieſus chriſt thou haſt ouercome ô gallelean end thou art vanquiſher hee loſt much bloud burning feuer hee called water midnight dranke colde expired yeare age 31 hauing gouerned empire ſpace yeare ſeuen moneths publike ioy antioche made death ſee tripartite hiſtorie lib 6 chap 48 iouinian iuuian borne hungarie created emperour great romanes died ſoone euill ſtomacke chamber wherein cold cauſed made great fire cole night liued 23 yeares raigned ſeuen moneths originall monkes monaſteries monaſtike life began firſt aegypt antonius macarus firſt moſt renowned author maner life incontinent diſperced paleſtine armenia paphlagonia sozomen li 3 chap 14 greatly maruelled world ſo many excellent doctor ſtraight admit manner life neuer inſtituted god onely allowed euen themſelues inſtituted ſo made new ſeruice god owne tradition ſeemeth beginning two kindes monkes ſome ſollititude others city companiestwo kindes monkes sozom li 3 ch 16 baſilius large writeth oeconomie lawes monkiſh life namely monke thing ought poſſeſſe nothing peaceable hee ought haue honeſt habit moderate voice word well diſpoſed take refection peaceably trauelleth ought eate ſame epiſtle ad eutychium ſpeaketh three ſort monkes egypt cenobite firſt called cenobite sanſos countrey language might ſay liuing common ſecond anacharites anachirites remoboth 3 chap 14 affirmeth thrace illirians europe yet monaſtike aſſemblies valentinian borne alſo hungarie made emperour ſouldiers principall towne bithinia anno 366 hee valens ſonnes gratian borne hungarie meane place fauour ʋalentinian choſen empire hee refuſed accepted made brother ʋalens pertaker countrey eaſt made ſonne gratian augustus time procopius vſurped empire diſcomfited valentinian chaſed away gothes barbarous people thrace saxon brought dutie obedience accuſtomed germanie beeing toſſed continuall trouble ſet reſt quietneſſe happie ſucceſſe theodoſius ʋalens choſen conſort empire firſt like pietie brother hee hadde alſo ſhewed vnder iulian hee infected arrian hereſie perſwaſion wife eudoxius biſhop conſtantinople arrian baptiſed life valentinian weſterne church peaceable agreeing decree councell nice valens could aduāce arrianiſme againſt ſuch called homouſiastes ſay true catholiques ſtirred great horrible perſecutions aboue antioche laodicea brother valentinian reprehended admoniſhed letter deſiſt zonoras writeth hereby ſtirred ſo much determined chaſe away baſilius biſhop ceſaria becauſe commaundement would communicate eudoxius lord ſent diſeaſe onely ſonne knowing god vengeance turned euill certaine dayes auditor baſiles sermon athanaſius procured good church 46 yeares ſuſtained many perſecutions great conſtancie patience died time death perſecution egipt alexandria mooued ʋalens hiſt trip lib 8 chap 7 damaſus spaniard ſome write bee rome ſonne one called antonius ſucceeded liberius election turbulent bloudie becauſe competitor hee called vrſin deacon romane church hereby may ſee firſt fruite rich church pretended donation conſtantine writing damaſus ſee suidas hierome epiſtle ad euſtochium tome 4 make mention damaſus virginitie ſaith hee read bookes pope damaſus compoſed verſe proſe valenshe reuerenced sinode nice condemned auxentius biſhop millan arrian theodor lib 4 chap 30 ſaith ambroſe hee fought ſtrongly againſt arrian heretikes expreſly condemning sabellius arrius eunomius macedonian photin marcellius hereſie apollinaris hierome writeth vnto often apologie againſt iouinian calleth damaſus ſingular man well inſtructed beeing accuſed two deacon namely concordius calitxtus hee defended cauſe full aſſembly biſhoppes abſolued accuſers proſcripted sabelli enu 7 lib 9 monkesthere many vertuous monkes time paulus pior iſidorus apſius pierius enagrius ammonius c hiſt trip lib 8 chap 10 one monkes ſaid monke laboured hand like theefe cruelly ſlaine valens becauſe would goe warre prophetike dreame anthonie age hundreth fiue yeares died time hee ſawe dreame ſwine deſtroyed plucked downe aultars feete awaked hee ſaid church ſhould bee diſſipated waſted whoremonger adulterer men diſguiſed p melancton noteth gothes perſecuted greatly catholiques againſt owne people burgonions gathered themſelues together number 80000 towards rhene afterward receiued faith paul diac towne arras countie artois 4 yeare ʋalentinian fell wooll heauen rayne hierome chronicle paul diac oroſius lib 7 herman gigas ſaith third yeare ʋalentinian lana ſome hiſtoriographers haue ſet downe manna wherefore yet day arras vnluckily worſhip manna heauenadolatrie arras hungarian caſt themſelues vpon weſt countrie great number arrians made burne drowne many faithfull catholique people hiſt trip lib 8 chap 2 hun caſt themſelues vpon weſterne part draue away gothes cōſtrained giue place paſſe beyond danubia came thrace thence pannonie ʋulphilas biſhop gothes sarmathia vulphilas hiſt trip lib 8 tranſlated bible gothike tongue vſe people ierome dalmatike people creatia lower pannonie church biſhops vſed ſcriptures tranſlated vulgar tongue auxentius arrian biſhop deceaſing milan fell great ſedition betwixt arrians catholiques electiō biſhop proconſul deputie ambroſe citizen rome hearing ſuch noiſethe electiō ambroſe reaſon office went haſtily church people aſſembled made many reaſons reduce people body carried buried constantinople aurel vict pomp death againe declared ſonne graiian emperour procopius tyrant vanquiſhed ʋalens taken hauing two feete bound vnto two tree let goe tore peeces naucle ʋalens gaue blowe vnto gouernour towne edeſſe meſapotamia becauſe hee chaſed away chriſtians daily aſſembled th temple thomas grieued put emperours commaundement execution cauſe ſuch multitude die wherefore ſecretly ſent thē word would aſſemble leauing counſell ſearing nothing emperours edict next morning aſſembled ſaid place accuſtomed doo prouoſt towne great company ſouldiers went ſaid temple put execution valens commaund hee encountred woman ranne litle childe aſſembly faithfull ſaid whether runneſt thou thither ſaid ſhe whether others haſte goe ſaid heegratian conſtancie faithfull haſt thou heard prouoſt goeth thither ſley findes vnderſtand ſaid ſhe therfore make ſo much haſte whither leadeſt thou litle childe may alſo receiue crowne martyrdome quoth ſhe ſaid prouoſt vnderſtood theſe thing courage chriſtians ran thither returned towards emperor valens ſhewed ſtorie ready endure death faith thought vnreaſonable ſley ſo great multitude people vpon theſe word ʋalens moderated anger socrat lib 1 cap 18 theo lib 4 cap 17 sozom lib 7 cap 18 affrates olde monke departed antioch ſent exile ʋalens ſeeing pallace ſaid whither goeſt thou goe ſaid pray thine empire thou ſhouldeſt haue done thy houſe ſaid valens yea anſwered affrates thou wouldeſt permit ſo chriſts ſheepe peace ʋalens end fought vnluckily againſt gothes ʋiſcoths hun scyths hauing paſſed danubia ran vpon hungaria epire theſſalia endammaging much countrey burning certaine townes ouercome flying wounded dart ſo fell horſe put litle ſtrawehouſe healed alanus victor purſued houſe whereinto went burnt none knowing retired thither reward tirannie crueltie againſt faithfullthe death valens came three yeares death brother hauing raigned fourteene yeares battaile beginning great warre romane empire ſustained gratian ſonne valentinian raigned eight yeares vncle valens three theodoſius 4 true kingdome began death valens yeare lord 380 hee reuoked exile catholique biſhoppes put backe arrians made valentinian litle brother father ſide companion empire hauing called theodoſius spaine hee gaue part eaſt empire eſtabliſhing rampart againſt gothes hun occupied thrace daceas hereditary countreys theodoſius handled hardly comming obtained great victorie againſt almaines cheriſhed much ſome thoſe barbarous nation hee cauſed come hyring gold owne ſouldiers bare euill inſomuch maximus choſen began true kingdome death gratian yeare 386 line traian alſo ſent emperor nerua help commonwealth theodoſius maintained amplified empire hee put flight hun gothes diuers battailes came farre empire hee alſo graunted peace perſians valentinian ſecond name brother aforeſaid gratian father ſide chaſed italie maximus iustin mother arrian wrought great trouble ambroſe fled eaſt towards theodoſius receiued gaue part empire hauing ſhewed fault becauſe rebelled againſt religion perſecuted catholiques fel perill valentinian ſtrangled ſeuen yeares ʋienna fraunce chamberlaines ſuggeſtion eugenius firſt hee gouernerned wiſely vertuoufly valiantly hee put flight enemy giles ſacked townes treuers coloigne hee retyred treuers alſo conquered orleans countrey along riuer loire vntill angiers brought countrey angiou vnder ſubiection tooke alſo cittie trect countrey along riuer rhene greatly encreaſed kingdome france vſed great ingratitude towardes baſin king lorraine called thoringe kindly entertained maintained time hee depriued kingdome hee receiued wife ſaide baſin tooke owne wife leo emperour firſt name grecian left ſucceſſor leo ariadne daughter zenon ſent baſalike warriour againſt genſericke king vandales constantinople great part italie perpetuall trouble vnder emperour raigned 17 yeares hilarie borne sardes biſhop rome ruled 7 yeares time full trouble theſe ordinance brother biſhop soiſſons simplicius tiburtin ſucceeded hilarie gouerned romane church 15 yeares ſome declared predeceſſor romane church chiefe principall builded many temple dedicated hee inſtituted father childerike kingdome going soiſons hee tooke force draue away siagre ſonne giles romaine occupied kingdome againſt childeric hath bene ſaid returne tooke melum chaſed away romanes amplified kingdome france hauing ſubiected city townes romanes held betwixt riuers rhene seine alſo ſuch betwixt seine loire hiſtories france ſay certaine battel againſt almaines ſtrait remembred admonition chiefe nobilitie called aſterius one secretarie vpon theſe matter embaſſador arriuing rome aided romanes tooke vigilius lead conſtantinople hee embarked people caſt ſtones theſe imprecation famine bee thee mortalitie thee thou haſt done thouſand miſchiefes romanes euill enough maieſt thou finde thou goeſt doo ſaid hee vnto mee haue well deſerued approached nigh vnto constantinople great multitude cleargie mette conducted towne theodora meane ceaſed ſollicite ʋigillius promiſe reſtore anthemius ʋigilius ſaide hee would rather endure thing whatſoeuer doo grieuouſly afflicted iniuried outraged drawne temple sophie euphemie vigilius byeth popedome deare whereinto hee fledde ſafetie refuge one put rope corde necke ledde ouer towne morning till night done hee put priſon fed bread water finally yeares raigne gaue great reuenewes church cauſed builded abbey denis france placed three aforeſaid body denis eleutherius ruſticus tombes couered fine gold enriched precious ſtones wold hardly beleeued great rich gold ſiluer precious ſtones townes good gaue ſaid church abbey denis yet poſſeſſe day founded alſo abbey amande nigh tournay endowed great reuenewes ſtudy gather whereſoeuer hee went take relickes enrich abbey denis ſo much cauſe hee called theefe relikestheefe relikes clouis firſt name truſt martine tour ſo bodie hilarie poitier ſo much hauing taken raſed ſaid towne ſtraunge death heraclius died newe ſtraunge diſeaſe namely purſes teſticles turned vpſide downe priuie member alwaies ſtiffe inſomuch whenſoeuer vttered vrine ſprinkled face table beene placed nauell platina exarche hee choſen maintained election ambitiouſly cleargie romane people ſeeing ſedition would cauſe effuſion bloud tooke counſell remedie wherefore choſe sergius reiecting two others ſaid sergius carried church laterane hauing broken gate caſt factious conſtrained theodorus paſcall ſalute sergius pope approoue election paſcal accuſed conuicted art magicke ſent monaſterie died obſtinate willibrot biſhoppe clement ſome emperour iustinian broke faith giuen sarraſins fought againſt wherein happie without neceſſitie brake peace father hadde made bulgarian entered one miſia hee put fire ſword iustinian diſloyall cruell bulgarian ceazed vppon paſſages ſtraights ſhut ſo well conſtrained doo would hee beeing returned conſtantinople ſo many euils chriſtians euerie one hated ſo conſpired came affrica childebert ſecond name 17 king france raigned 18 yeares hee founded abbey albane angiers lambert biſhop liege reuoked exile becauſe hee reprehended adulterie pippin hee cruelly ſlaine dodon brother adultereſſe ſaide dodon complices periſhed miſerably within yeare hubert ſucceeded biſhop liege hiſtories france abſimarus abſimarus otherwiſe called tiberius borne constantinople choſen naucler abb ʋrsp iohn pope ſixt name grecian ruled rome 3 yeares maner popesthe deuotion pope curious repaire church adorne aultars redeeme captiues papall treaſure write martyr vnder king lombardie defending right church faſci temp venetian time beganne haue duke hinder quarells diſorders ſuch gouernedthe firſt duke venice enuie lombard bare libertie repenting themſelues cauſed many firſt duke diligent adorne repaire church henceforth chiefeſt ſtudio pope papiſts iustinian hauing ſuccours bulgaria turkey came conſtantinople againe obtained empire raigned ſixe yeares cauſed ſet priſon leontius tiberius beeing bound chaines hee made tied tailes horſes ſo drawne ſtreetes brought againe troden vnder feete finally cauſed beheaded partner put diuers torment great vengeance vſed towards driue sarraſins spaine ſpake deafe siſinnius pope otherwiſe soſinus sirian ruled onely 20 dayessiſinnius tormented gout feete hand able eate died ſuddenly schiſme ſeuenththe 7 ſchiſme betwixt dioſcorus great combat papacie ſaid ſchiſme continued long time ſucceſſors famine rome ſpace three yeares ſharpe rude conſtantine pope sirian ruled rome ſeuen yeares greatly beloued euery oneconſtantine helped people much famine iuſtinian kiſſeth pope feete iuſtinian commaunded come conſtantinople hee arriued emperour embraced falling earth kiſſed feete demaunded pardon fault would pray god receiued eucharist renewed confirmed priuiledges romane church supp chron abb ʋrsp iuſtinian chaunged nothing life paſſed hee bare himſelfe otherwiſe towards romane sea wont doo maintained vnderſtanding felix archbiſhop rauenna would yeeld accuſtomed obedience pope ſend certaine breuiat wherein ſhould acknowledge obedience due certaine ſumme money emperour ſent captaine rauenna called theodorus reprehended felix ſent bound conſtantinople afterward ſent exile pontus eye put many citizen alſo rauenna exiled others put death good confiſcate towne taken force aboue ſaid naucl conſtantine admoniſhed iuſtinian attempt nothing againſt phillippicus exiled pontus wherevnto notwithſtanding hee obeyed ſent againſt people followed part phillippicus came conſtantinople iustinian declared abſolued innocent pope theſe benefites willing yeelde ſome pleaſure chriſtmas day aſſoone king come church put crowne head pronounced charlemaigne emperour romanes without aſpired receiue imperiall crowne romane people cryed ſaying life victorie thrice chriſtian charles alwaies auguſt crowned god great peaceable emperour whereas vſed call name patrician called emperour yeare raigned 23 ſaluation eight hundreth three hirene empreſſe conſtantinople charlemain hirene hearing beene done rome ſent three embaſſadors towards charlemaigne confirme peace charlemaigne ſide alſo ſent embaſſadors towards empreſſe greater confirmation peace demaunding marriage wherevnto ſhe conſented hinderance ambuſhes laid againſt ſhe would haue ſolde empire marriage ſtrangers nicephorus crowned emperournicephorus hirene chaſed away paſſed reſt life exile nicephorus ſent embaſſadors charlemaine diuiſion empire renew alliance vpon thoſe condition ſhould called auguſtes bretheren together one eaſt weſt italie ſide beyond naples accord diuiſion ſide beyond sipont namely ſtretcheth towards sea ſhould belong vnto greeke emperour reſt french emperour ʋenice ſhould middeſt limitte border betwixt thoſe two empire acknowledge maieſtie venetian ſhould ſubiect neither one ſhould vſe owne lawes friend whether peace warre ſay emperour coronation ſaid knowne pope enterpriſe would day haue entred church aduertiſement although ſucceſſiuely alwaies emperor conſtantinople kept romane empire vntill towne occupied turkes yet becauſe true brightneſſe maieſtie name tuition empire italie charlemaine ſucceſſors leaue nicephorus greeke emperours becauſe haue bene like theſe therefore leauing eaſt namely conſtantinople ſet downe order emperours weſt namely rome charlemain charlemaigne deliuered romane ſeate moleſtations forraine prince atchieued principally hee came italie ſay ſiege pauie hauing conſtrained didier laſt king lombard yeeld himſelfe hee got poſſeſſion lombardie ende ſhould moleſt italie hee droue away ſeditious perſons ſent didier captiue wife child towne liege paul diaconus hiſtoriographer secretarie ſaid didier ledde time charlemaigne made kingdome lombardie leauing townes italie theyr accuſtomed libertie ende hee might giue occaſion trouble vnto greeke emperour alliance scotland franceabout time acayus 65 king scot made firſt alliance king charlemaigne fraunce hath endured euer ſince yet preſent maintained betwixt theſe two nation bauiere conquired taſſilo duke bauiere moouing warre againſt charlelemaigne loſt countrey put monaſterie ſonne although hee charlemaignes kinſman yet faith violated hee vſed ſeueritie towardes nicephorus nicephorus raigned conſtantinople eight nine yeares romanes would acknowledge emperour wherevpon roſe great enuie hatred betwixt eaſt weſt schiſme betwixt eaſt west whatſoeuer agreement made ſtil enuie enmitie betwixt eaſt weſt emperours could ſuffer one yet diſſention hapned onely betwixt alſo betwixt eaſt weſt church wherof altogether pope cauſe intent withdrawe exempt himſelfe obedience held good charlemaigne inriched many church abbey biſhoppricks eſpecially almaine biſhoppricks magunce strasbourge colongne treuers giuing great priuileges briefly fewe renowmed church germanie two france hee endowed ſome good reuenewes iohannes scotus monke benet diſciple beda companion albin alcuin charlemaignes maiſter wrote vpon mathewe three bookes thing abb trit hinmarus biſhop rhemes monke deuis wrote two bookes life remy biſhop tritem charlemaigne laſt got vpper hand hungarian tooke great rich bene two hundreth yeares thing pill ſpoile nation without beeing pilled themſelues tamed bohemian hauing ouercome king called lechon ſo ende charlemaigne peaceable italie france almaine hungarie bohemia reiected galdrada ſtraight hee againe forſooke wife called galdrada could neuer ſeperated correction naucler iohn archbiſhop rauenna meaning maintaine auncient libertie rauenna conſtantine iuſtinian two emperor leo ſecond pope taken cited appeare rome becauſe hee appeared depriued dignitie ſaid archbiſhop went emperour beſought entreate pope licence goe rome defend cauſe without daunger pope graunted emperours requeſt archbiſhop admitted pleade cauſe many prelate confeſſed himſelfe giltie treaſon towards pope therefore demaunded mercy pardon preſent pope receiued grace vpon certaine condition namely full sinode ſhould purge himſelfe hereſie yeare ſhould goe rome ſhould ceaſe conſecrating biſhops although canonically elected vnleſſe authoritie pope graunted letter ſhould chaunge nothing eccleſiaſticall good without pope licence vnder paine excommunication biſhop strasburge called ratholdus otherwiſe radulphus ſent rome prieſt dioceſſe conuicted haue ſlaine mother vnto although enioyned hard penance yet pope permitted keepe wife auoyd daunger fornication see 33 queſt 2 chap latorem renamus annotation vpon tertullian ende pope nicholas made great haſte publiſh conſtitutions decree touching ſinglenes continencie clarkes could obtaine nothing therein biſhop alſo aſpurge almaigne called huldric greatly reſiſted ſaid decree writ epiſtle pop nicholas worthie wholy inſerted confound popiſh errour ſinglenes prieſts haue therefore tranſlated word word latin originall followeth one epiſtle huldric biſhop pope nicholas huldric biſhop name ſonne promiſeth beareth loue ſeruant feare nicholas lord father vigilant paſtor holy romane church father lord knew thy decree made vpon ſinglenes prieſts lately brought vnto mee farre diſcretion feare vexed ſadneſſe ſay feare becauſe commonly ſaid ſentence paſtor iuſt vniuſt feared alſo afraid weake auditor ſcripture ſildome obey iuſt ſentence yea often caſt vniuſt binde themſelues vpon commaundement vnto errour importable tranſgreſſion pleaſure paſtor ſide heauineſſe compaſſion moued ſee meanes member guarded head deteined ſo greeuous maladie thing greeuous worthie compaſſion towardes church biſhop seate vnto appertaineth examination church withdraweth himſelfe ſtraieth yea though neuer ſo little holy diſcretion aſſuredly thou art little way thou wouldeſt clarkes thou ſhouldeſt admoniſh keepe wherfore ô reuerend father ſhalbe part ſee whoſoeuer either hand mouth hath made vow continency afterward would forſake ſhould either compelled keep vowe elſe lawfull authoritie ſhould depoſed order iudge ye iudged paul ſaith art thou iudgeſt man ſeruant either hee ſtandeth falleth owne maiſter ſhall ſtand lord mightie make ſtand therefore let holineſſe ceaſe compell enforce thoſe ought admoniſh greeuouſnes tranſgreſſions committed thought vſe violence executing puniſhment deſire chriſt tranſgreſſions ſo puniſhed tranſgreſſors may repent liues alſo ſaying auguſtine would haue remember nilfiat nocendi cupiditate omnia autē charitate proficiendi nihil fiat crudelitèr nihil inhumaniter let nothing done charitie profiting neither let thing done cruelly vngently item ſame auguſtine written doth deſcribe vertues much partly ſee becauſe ignorant diſcretion although neglected part yet action life kept honeſtly diſpaire alſo ſoone amend litle lacke behinde therefore much grauitie ceaſe call haue profeſſed continency ſaith hee take let take ſaying theſe men turne ſay hee cannot take let accurſed fooliſh amongſt men thē biſhop archdeacon run themſelues headlong kinde luſt adultery inceſt doo thing men pſalmiſt becauſe pleaſe men confounded lord hath deſpiſed theſe men ought rather perſwade v aſhamed ſinne preſence thing naked diſcouered rather thē ſeeme pure neate preſence men theſe men therfore although ſinful wickednes deſerue counſell godlineſſe giuen yet forgetting humanitie ceaſe giue counſell authoritie god word ſeeketh men ſaluation ſaying thou hipocrite caſt firſt beame thine owne eye thou ſhalt ſee clearly plucke mote thy brother eye moreouer alſo deſire thee attend lord ſaith adulterous woman without ſinne let caſt firſt ſtone againſt though would ſay moſes bid alſo bid yet require competent miniſters executor lawe take heed adde therevnto take heed alſo pray ſelues ſcripture ſaith thou well conſider thy ſelfe thou wilt neuer defame detract gregoriusmoreouer alſo ſignified vnto v ſome ought like good ſhepheards giue liues lordes flocke yet puffed vp ſuch pride without reaſon ſeeme rent teare lord flocke whipping beating whoſe vnreaſonable doings gregorie bewailing thus quid fiat de onibus quando paſtores lupi fiuntſ ſhall become ſheep paſtours themſelues wolues ouercome exerciſeth crueltie ſhall iudge perſecutor hee gaue patiently backe ſtripes fruite germain called gille geffrey rotfrid king aſſigned dowrie countrey friſe vpon condition ſhould baptiſed notwithſtanding thoſe normains afterward afflicted france beſieged citie paris ſhall ſaid romanes pretended cardinall sergius choſen meane sergius conceiued mortall hatred againſt formoſus went france therefore great schiſme ninth cruell ſcandalousschiſme 9 endured long time ſhall pernitious man conſtituted popeiohn 18 called iohn 18 held ſeate 10 month gregorie retyred towards emperour bee reuenged iniurie done emperour ſore mooued outrage great power returned rome creſcentius vnderſtanding cōming truſting roman people cauſed caſtle de angelo fortified theſe thing emperor beſieged town romane people meet ſeditiō fight deſired pardō ye emperor opened gate vnto almains creſcentius pope iohn deſtitute councel retired fort ſaid caſtle treaſon promiſed aſſurance would demand pardon emperora true reward ambition came downe came ſurpriſed pope iohn eies put mēbers gebhard ruled two yeares three moneths naucler hee aſſembled councell florence againſt forncating simoniacke prieſtshe calleth married prieſt fornicatiors whereat hee depoſed many biſhoppes prelate stephen accuſed emperour henry fourth hereſie becauſe diminiſhed authoritie romane ſeate platina hauing heard church italie burgongne corrupted symonie ſent hildebrand roote cockle hildebrand hauing made commiſſion returned rome found pope ſicke thinking die cauſed churchman come vnto made ſweare ſhould neuer ſuffer ſit apoſtolike ſeate vnleſſe choſen conſent yet comming againe health came florence called councell died eight monethes nauclerus scottiſh monke called patermis almaine towne called paderbrune fire put abbey wherin yet though might would come chuſing rather burnt vow obedience ſhunne daunger going sigeb opinion obſtination vowes founded vpon ſuch example benet pope 10 name campania italie biſhop vileterne called mincius ruled rome 9 monethesbenet 10 romanes haue maliciouſly ſaid procured emperour henry others pope clement although wicked act done chaplaine office subdeacon haue left writing time many prodigious ſtraunge thing againſt nature appeared domeſticall bird hennes geeſe pigeon peacock fled mountain became wild greateſt part fiſhes well riuers sea died philip king france forſooke wife berthe daughter baudwin counte holland ſonne daughter chronicle king france relickes nicholas tranſported citie mirrhe towne bar whereof came famous idoll giueth name saint nicholas lorraine chaunges many duke country almaigne expreſſe many euils calamity inteſtine ciuil warre almaigne hath cauſed ſtirred pope onely amongſt greateſt prince ſlaine therin alſo change ſiegnories emperour henry enemy rodolphe deadthe calamity ciuil warre almaines haue empire death rodolphe alſo ſlaine battell saxon emperour henry gained alſo gebbard father lotharie emperour dyed warres briefly force almaigne wholy debilitated chaunged vnluckie warre pope vrbane 2 vrbane 2 name borne tuſcane called otho monke clugny vnder hildebrand cardinall oftie inthronized papacie againſt wil emperour ſuch inthronized victor namely harlot matilde norans lordes pouille ruled 12 yeares 4 moneths 19 dayes diſciple houſhold ſeruant hildebrand benno calleth deſpight turban ſchiſmaticke hereticke companion liberius arrian gregorie ſeuenth canonized hath bene ſaid ſaith hee feare poyſon errours might knowne manner sorcerer mingled hony therewith ſubtilly vnder intent deceiue hee added holy ſcriptures lye perſeuering errours hildebrand ſent hell apoſtate angel ʋrbain ſay ſome authours time perturber world rather whirlewinde tempeſts townes familiar hildebrand watered maintained cauſed grow pernicious ſeeds predeceſſors diſpearſed excommunicated guibert archbiſhop rauenna named clement third becauſe hee bene choſen emperour time thing great trouble well almaigne nation diſputations happening betwixt cleargy people becauſe vrbane would abſolue beene alexander recalled alexander france well receiued rome biſhop pauie put held emperours ſide frederic third time went italie againſt certaine rebelled came rome knowe cauſe thoſe pope alexander would great armie againſt rebells henry leon duke saxonie corrupted ſiluer thought left emperour returned saxonie company emperour required faile great need loſt time therefore hee conſtrained withdrawe italie returne almaine ſeruants apparell great difficultie behold pope world hath euer beene troubled yeare chriſt 1173 saladin ſlew lord calyphe raigned place chron euſeb yeare chriſt 1175 frederic fift time returned italie perſwaſion confeſſor conuerted armes againſt turkes paſſing hungarie came vnto conſtantinople occupied many townes place turkes philomenia iconium came armenia leſſe finally euen ieruſalem whileſt frederic thus buſied turke pope alexander confederate ceaſed thinke might deſtroy end hee ſhould returne victorious pope ſent souldan image emperour cauſed drawne liuely excellent painter letter gaue aduertiſement vnto souldan ſley deſtroy ſaid emperour treaſon euer hee pretended liue peace souldan hauing receiued ſaid pope letter emperours figure ſought meanes come purpoſe occaſion fell ſo ſoone finally emperour returned conqueſt ieraſalem armenia one day hotte hee withdrew wood fewe people chaplaine thinking daunger made people goe aſide hee chaplaine lighted horſes vnapparelled themſelues ſo refreſhed running ſtreame water hee ſurpriſed ambuſhes souldane laid carried wood vnto souldan people knowing nothing taking ſought next morning brute came vnto campe catalogue witneſſes truth biſhop place prelate carried keyes ſay would neither enter let others enter beganne murmure laie man ſecular man call ſhould handle declare vulgar tongue ſcripture make errours ſuperſtitions romane ſeate hid darkneſſe like happened time whē pope prieſts could endure martin luther ſhould reprehend indulgence cauſe ſearch made errours ſo diſcouered abhominable blaſphemies waldo gathered vulgar tongue many place auncient father waldo ſtrengtheneth himſelfe place doctor cōfirme ſtrengthen ſuch ſide authoritie holy ſcriptures alſo witneſſe doctor againſt aduerſaries likely true hiſtoriographers yea euen writing aduerſaries aſſembly endured certaine time may foure fiue yeares waldo taught towne lyon driuen exile baniſhment becauſe mightie friend ſo ſoone expoſed daungers afterward laide thus came appellation pope lion called waldois ſome lyoniſts ſome inſabbatati ſuch obſerued neither sabboth feaſt many like name make odious deteſtable ſhall ſhewed diſcourſe hiſtorie alexander vnderſtanding emperor marched come rome perceiuing himſelfe culpable treaſon done 7 yeare popedome fled rome habit coole came vnto venice remained monaſterie finally knowne led duke senate great ſolemnitie markes church emperor vnderſtanding yt alexander venice ſent embaſſadors demaund alexander venetian maintained pope emperor ſeeing ſent thither ſon otho army yet commanding fight againſt venetian comming otho led youth gaue battell loſt victory priſoner pope ſeeing wold agree emperor vnleſſe fiſt came venice receiued meanes wold offer frederic help ſon came venice pope would abſolue ye bond excommunicatiō vntill preſented himſelfe doore mark church whē come thither pope cōmanded preſence people caſt himſelf vpon ground demand pardon emperor proſtrating himſelfe vpon earth pope feete hee ſet foote vpon emperor neck preſſing downe ſaid written super aſpidem baſiliſcum ambulabis conculcabis leonem draconem ſay thou ſhalt goe vpon aſpe baſilike tread vnder thy foot lyon dragō emperor taking ill part contumely anſwered ſaid vnto thee vnto peter pope ſtepping againe vpon neck anſwered peter emperour fearing peril hid danger held peace ſo abſolued accord made betwixt vpō condition emperour ſhould hold alexander true legitimate pope ſhould reſtore romane church vſurped takē war theſe thing ended emperor ſon departed frō venice ſo ceaſed ye ſchiſme pope gaue many priuiledges order chartreux canonized barnard body three king call tranſported millaine colongne biſhop ſaid place sabell eun 9 lib 5 order carmalites began timecarmalits willelmin order willelmins hermirs faſc temp time henry ſecond king england ſeeing power biſhops cleargie great england oathes made pope alienate themſelues force realme ſuch mean weakned renewed auncient right called dignity kingdome aboue ſaith biſhops prelate ſhal ſweare loyall faithful vnto king publike vtilitie kingdome thomas becket archbiſhop cā terburie gaue oath king repented himſelfe thereof vnlawfull oath demanded therfore pope abſolution king grieued ſuch periurie baniſhed fiue yeares france queſtiō long debated rome coſt much mony vpō embaſſadors going betweene one partie gratian cō piler decree ſent pope ſide petrus lombardus becket ſide king fearing apparent daungers ſide france glad quiet becket reſtored ſtil remaining contrary king vnwilling praiſe willingly hee helped many young people deſire profit good letter giuing ſiluer eccleſiaſtical benifices aboue ſuch preſſed pouertie venetian moleſt thē marqueſdome ancone venetian greatly hee writ certaine problem following therein ariſtotle canon rule phiſicke treaſure poore certaine epiſtles doctrine waldois waldo company driuen lyon one company drew towards lombardie multiplied greatly ſo much doctrine began diſpearced italie came euen sicilie patent frederic ſecond giuen againſt raigned witneſſeth recitall ſuch writ againſt likewiſe one reinerius liued writ litle time may gathered doctrine muſt beleeue ſcriptures onely concerneth ſaluation thing ought bee receiued god commaundeth v one onely mediator therefore muſt inuocate saint purgatorie men iuſtified chriſt goe eternall life ſuch beleeue goe eternall death neither third fourth place receiue allowe two sacrament baptiſme communion ſaid maſſes chiefly ſuch inuented dead abhominable damned therefore ought aboliſhed humane tradition ought reiected without holding neceſſarie ſaluation ſinging recitall officiall faſtings tyed certaine dayes ſuperfluous feaſts difference meates well degree order prieſts prieſts deacon romane ſeate babilon pope fountaine euils day marriage prieſts good neceſſarie church ſuch heare word god haue right knowledge thereof true church ieſus chriſt hath giuen keyes cauſe sheepe enter driue away wolues see briefly doctrine waldois enemy haue impugned owne witneſſe perſecuted time mathias illiricus catalogue gathered witneſſes truth ſaith hath conſultations certaine aduocates auignon alſo three archbiſhops narbone arles aix likewiſe biſhop alban roote waldois written paſt 300 yeares appeareth great number faithfull heere diſpearced throughout france may alſo collected conſultations ſaid archbiſhops number great perſecution cruell end thus found written ſo new france ignorant condemnation theſe heretikes waldois made long time ſo iuſtly thing ſo famous ſo publike hath coſt ſo great expences ſweats trauells catholique hath bene ſealed ſo many condemnation deathes thoſe wicked infidells called doubt appeareth butcherie time made faithfull crueltie credit power charles tooke vicariatſhip tuſcane filled italie vprores tumult warre end might prouide well buſineſſesthe kingdom sicilie redemanded pope perſwaded peter king arragon theſe old popiſh trickes redemaund kingdome sicilie ſhewing right heritage belonged vnto becauſe conſtance wife counſell pleaſed peter well fruite wrought counſell peter peter hauing gotten power puiſſant armie ſea came vnto sardeigne attended till ſome ſtirre sicilie treaſon siciliās sicilian hauing coniured againſt charles french aſſigned day ſley yea without hauing reſpect vnto sexe condition perſon ſo ſoone ſound bell ſhould bee heard euening ſhall bee ſaid heereafter cruell horrible acte executed time nicholas vnder martin fourth name ſucceſſor nicholas tranſported himſelfe dignitie senator rome clement fourth giuen vnto e foreſaid king charles exarchat rauenna brought vnder pope ordained perpetuall edict thence forth king prince ſhould dare demaund ſuch eſtate take ſuch charge vpon diſloyaltie pope came paſſe flammina towne bolongne ſelfe exarchate rauenna thing long time bene seignorie domination emperor reduced vnder puiſſance romiſh sinagogue beſides hee alone tooke vpon charge stella ſaith office senator church accuſtomed giue vnto king prince pope pleaſureshe inriched towne rome new edifice amongſt others builded houſe commodious peter parke hare conneys hee enuironed high walles wherein himſelfe often hunted reedified church peter paul fell age hee atchieued ended certaine houſe laterane long time bene commenced hee builded bottome top church called sanctum sanctorum ſet apoſtles keyes ſiluer chaines hypocrite ſung maſſe teares fell eye hee carried ſuch fauour vnto friar hee declared certaine doubtes rule sect decretall epiſtle made many ordinance profit vtilitie cleargie chriſtian people made many cardinalls order begging friar droue certaine notaires commaunding vnder paine excommunication place ſouer magiſtrates ſhould bee annalls yeare many reprooued hee made nephew called berthand pope inriched nephew count earle romagnole ſent latin cardinall iacobin nephew rather baſtard legate tuſcane platina stella others ſay loued owne much ſo much whatſoeuer hee got others hee gaue without reaſon meaſure tooke force certaine romane gentleman caſtles gaue friend amongſt others one called surien papal ſubtiltyafter euery ſet vp gibellins ſort mutinous rebellious people firſt eſtate end might maintaine tirannies placed florence place magiſtrates pleaſure many domages vnto pope alſo determined haue made two king houſe ʋrſini haue placed one tuſcane lombardie purpoſed put theſe thing effect towne called sutry pope death cauſe great good taken apoplexie died ſuddenly without ſpeaking yeare lord 1291 ſome 4 popedome although good complection ſeemed would haue liued much longer ſay death foretold one ſawe great invndation ouerflowing riuer tiber som ſay alſo engendred vpon concubine baſtarda monſtrous pope baſtard whoſe haire nailes like beares see iohn de noyan ſaith illuſtrations beda william durand ſubtill man made time booke intituled rationale diuinorum officiorum albert great biſhop ratisbone died time martin 4 namemartin 4 borne france towne tour named simon cardinal prieſt cecile ruled 2 yeares 8 monethes choſen french cardinalls greateſt number would crowned viterbe becauſe tooke towne interdicted rowte made againſt cardinalls ʋiterbe following one called richard hanniball captaine ſuch tooke part italian entered conclaue tooke cardinalls put priſon hauing onely diſpiſed alſo giuen chaſe houſe vrſins pope martin come old towne commonly called oruieto vſed ſolemnities created 8 cardinalls ſame day charles lewis brother made ki sicilie clement 4 might ſtrongeſt came vnto combat hee onely receiued courteouſly king charles comming towards alſo yeelded dignitie senator whereof depriued nicholas euery man found good ſeemed ſhould ſtirre vp great ſeditions towne ſeeing vrſins alreadie returned ſuch hanniballs faction chaſed away charles great aduerſarie ʋrſins hatred conceiued againſt nicholas yet martin ſubtillly caſting affaire great eſtimation mathew daquaſporta order bretheren friar cardinall biſhop port houſe vrſins pope martin publiſhed ſentence excommunication againſt peter king arragon ordeined army sea come sicilie againſt charles expoſed kingdome pray firſt could get declaring ſubiects abſolued oath fidelitie promiſed naming vſurper eccleſiaſticall good leuied armie againſt ſuch taken croiſado paſtime pope ſupporters ſtirre vp warre diſſention amongst prince world peter de arragon excōmunicated yet peter making account obtained kingdome sicilie helpe paleologus emperour conſtantinople alſo excommunicated making account promiſed councell lion aboue french ſlaine houre sicilie moreouer sicilian able longer beare pride whoredomes french perſwaſion iohn prochita coniured againſt charles ſlew ſound bell without hauing regard sexe thence came prouerbe one wiſheth death many may ſay euenſong sicilie hath beene touched litle beſides martin amongſt act worthy pope graunted romanes might chuſe two senator nobilitie excommunicated paleologus emperour greece made warre againſt forley graunted many priuiledges vnto begging friar hee knew like horſes prepared vnto battle ſtill munite fortifie tirannie taking ordinarie refection captaines caſulanus reciteth yeare lord 1285 taken ſecret malladie hee died hauing ſaid hee endured much griefe although phiſitians founde ſigne death buried peruſe author thomas cooper one learned followeth abridgement chronicle haue left writing firſt yeare popedome hee tooke prouerbe bread potte martin ſucceeded concubine predecoſſor concubine predeceſſor nicholas feare ſuch accident ſhould happen vnto vnto namely childe ſhould like vnto beare commanded beares bene painted pallace pope houſe vrſins ſhould defaced cleane taken away becauſe knew well figure thing vpon woman think conceiue child oftentimes certaine imprinted appeares well pope herein expert tooke heed ſuch monſter ſhewed world ſanctetie pope ſingleneſſe giles rome biſhop bourges egidius de rom diſciple thomas daquin liued time phillip le bell 45 king france nauarre pallace paris raigned father phillip third yeare 1225 pallace ſumptuouſly builded ile sene maketh euguerrant de marigni king councellor preſident de finance charge thereof pallace court auentine builded new houſe incited many others like excommunicated peter king arragon peter arragon excōmunicated occupied kingdome sicilie againſt charles confirmed interdict publiſhed againſt predeceſſor martin becauſe hee would permit pope ſeate ſhould enioy region florentine luke obtained ſiluer rodolphe emperour libertie commonwealthes florentine gaue 6000 skutes luquets 12000 skutes venice ducatsthe venetian alſo obtained licence forge ducat gold venice geneuois got themſelues franchis libertie chro emp tom 2 emperor noted couetouſneſſe childe called rodolphe martired berne iewes whereby berne put iewes death therefore emperour rodolphe aſſembled thirtie thouſand ſouldiers beſieged berne profited nothing aboue ſaid colledge collet paris founded iohn collet prieſt cardinall cecilie legate france borne beauoiſin ſaith sea hiſtories mooued maruellous warre againſt guy feltron occupied townes flaminia ouercomming hee annexed vnto ſeignorie rome countrey pope confirmed sect auguſtines yet receiued paris many impugned becauſe well allowed councell lateran graunted many priuiledges beſides hee would carmes leauing coloured apparell barres ſhould take white habitthe carmes created cardinalls ſorts monkes profit kingdome abaddon end might lighthorſes prepared battaile might haue teeth like lyon tailes like scorpion wherewith might hurt men platina ſayeth loued alike plat cor abb ingratefull good ſaith iohn marie predeceſſors receiued france note deuelliſh arrogancy roſe vp ſuch pride againſt king phillip hard thing beleeue ſent ſignifie vnto king maner commaundement biſhop appaine legate incontinently without delay ſhould prepare himſelfe go beyond ſea vnto thing king could well harken great warres hee againſt flemmings legate ſeeing could obtaine anſwere according appetite began vſe great menace ſaying obey pope would depriue kingdome two rigorous word king beeing much grieued cauſed ſaid legate detained priſoner theſe thing came notice proud pope hee diſpatched archdeacon narbone letter commaund forbidding king caſe ſhould entermeddle take ſubſidie vpon land reuenewes church thing king phillip le bel bene conſtrained doo becauſe great warres ſuſtained good defence kingdome moreouer king contumacie detained priſoner embaſſador againſt common right nation kingdome france deuolued fallen romane church obey commaundements defence pope aſſemble councell prelate barrons france citie paris ſaide councell king ſit reciting outrage iniuries receiued pope boniface vttered ambitiouſly wickedly came pope demaunded eccleſiaſticall lord vpon foundation reuenewes church benefice turned towards prince baron knight ſaid vnto noble vaſſalls hold king anſwered one voyce held land good vnder king hand king replied ſaid yet ſee force tirannie boniface practiſeth realme france ſubiect vnto romane church vſurpeth title emperour almaine hauing three time ſaid duke albert auſtrich ſaith himſelfe emperour lord world token thereof hee hath newly giuen empire duke albert yea euen title crowne france theſe thing thus propoſed brought deliberation king interiected appellation pope generall councell ordained publike edict vpon great pain none ſhould bee ſo hardie drawe tranſport gold ſiluer kingdome affaire romane court cauſed guard bridge porte paſſages ſide boniface eight ſought eccleſiaſticall cenſors enmitie betwixt emperour king yet cautellous ſubtill ſpirit therefore pleaſed boniface exceedingly incontinently come vnto papaltie hee ſought pacifie italie therefore went peruſe hee fell ſicke deceaſed buried iacobins certaine abbeſſe preſented vnto poyſoned figges whereof died prooued leander affirmeth died poyſon ſeate emptie yeare yeare chriſt 1304 phillip le bel king france founded honour lewis abbey poiſy hee placed peloponeſus epirus dalmacia great part illyria pannonia finally hungaria yeare chriſt 1306 firſt league swiſſers made three canton namely suit vry ʋnderuald naucler peter caſiodore italian noble man well inſtructed pietie time hee writ vnto enghſh men carrie importable yoake romane antechriſt ſhewing extortion extreame ſeruitude england pope time multiplied epiſtle beginneth cui comparabo te c ſaluation deliuerance yoake captiuitie receiue price reward libertie scribe phariſies placed themſelues moyſes chaire c followeth ſhal compare theemat 23 2 ſhal ſay thou art like thou daughter ieruſalem ſhall equall thee thou virgin daughter sion thy ruine great sea thou art become ſollitarie without ſollace day ouerwhelmed wilh heauineſſe thou art deliuered hand whence thou canſt relieue thy ſelfe without aide ſome one lift theee vp scribe phariſies beeing ſet vpon moyſes chaire ſaythe chaire moyſes romane prince thy enemy vpon thy head enlarging philacteries deſiring inrich themſelues marrowe thy bone impoſe heauie inſupportable burthen vpon ſhoulders thee thy miniſters bring thee vnmeaſurably vnder charge paying tribure thou euer haſt bene free let occaſion matter maruelling ceaſe thy mother rule ouer people hauing eſpowſed ſubiect hath appointed thee father others hath eleuated thee biſhop rome paternall act ſheweth himſelfe ſuch one true hee ſpreadeth skirtes ſheweth experience thy mother husband often bringeth memorie heart ſentence prophet take thee great volume write therein touchſtone maner men haſt • thee ſpoile diſpatch thee pilling ſpoiling apoſtle ſaid euery high prieſt beeing taken men conſtituted men thing concerning god doth ſhewe men muſt occupie themſelues ſpoiles rapine impoſe cenſors annuall rent deſtroy men end might offer gift ſacrifices ſinnes might haue compaſſion ignorant ſinners alſo read peter fiſher whoſe ſucceſſor ſaith reſurrection ieſus chriſtiohn 212 returned fiſhing againe apoſtles could take nothing left ſide ſhip commaundement ieſus chriſt turned himſelfe towards right hand drew net ground full fiſh profitable exerciſe miniſterie church right part miſterie diuell vanquiſhed great number ſoules brought ieſus chriſtthe right ſide left kingdome ſurely ſo labour taken left hand ſhip therein faith ſtaggereth heuineſſe ruleth men finde ſeeke beleeue one man ſerue god mammon together pleaſe ſticke reuelations fleſh bloud offer chriſt gift preſents ſuch appertaine vnto himgood ſheepheards taken form ſheepfold pſal 817 without doubt ſheepheard watcheth edifying flocke prepareth way roaring lyon ſeeketh euery way may deuour behold ſay ſtraunge vnheard deedes called thy fatherthe office prieſts ouerthrowne taketh ſheepfoldes good ſheepheards place ſetteth nephewes parent others ignorant letter dumbe deafe vnderſtand bleating ſheepe neither care byting wolues like hireling carrie away fleece reape others harueſts hand alſo ſerue pottes backes turne away burthen hereby plainely appeareth prieſts office left ſeruice due vnto god ſubtracted cuſtome giue almes aboliſhed thing holy deuotion king prince chriſtans aboliſhed thing ought found ſtrange iudgement euery onethe pope oppoſed againſt ieſus chriſt whereas ieſus chriſt commaunded pay tribute vnto king himſelfe peter man againſt whoſe vicar ſaith hath caſt backe himsſelfe kingdomes iudgements world ſeekes ſubiect vnder domination king prince vnder title ſtile becauſe hath ſet downe writing attributeth vnto himſelfe nay doth thee ô daughter behold draweth thee whatſoeuer thinketh good yet hee holdeth himſelfe contented take thee tenth part thy ground euen firſt fruites benefice thy miniſters end well himſelfe ſuch bloud might conſtitute new patrimonie good holy will founder moreouer wage pope currier compariſon pope nabuchodonozer alreadie impoſeth execrable thing wage currier ſendeth england carrie away onely victualls thee thine alſo rent skinnes fleſh like dogges meriteth compared nabuchodonozor deſtroyed temple ſpoiled veſſells gold doth alſo ſpoiled miniſters houſe god depriued neceſſarie ſeruice doth much ſurely condition ſlaine ſword better condition ſuch thing bitten hunger firſt ſtraight dead conſumed ſtirrilitie earth let ſuch paſſe thy way ô daughter haue compaſſion thee ſorrowe like thineier chap 1 ſame 12 alreadie becauſe thy great dolour teares thou haſt ſhead thy face blacker coales ſo much thou art knowne ſtreetes thy father hath ſet thee clowdie darke place hath made thee drunke wormewood gall lord ſee affliction thy peoplea true deſcription pope harken vnto ſobbings come downe heart man harder heart phaua • would ſuffer thy people ſhould goe • libertie onely force thy hand afflicted plagueth onely vpon earth alſo death death deuoureth good chriſtians vnder colour died without making teſtaments church england doth ſufficienly know french men caſting eye concupiſcence vpon kingdome ſought time paſt haue reduced vnder theyr power▪ feared grape take heed vnto lord word propheſie ieremie put back ſuch enterpriſes ſaith thus thou ſheepheard haſt disperſed people ier 2230 put thē habitation behold viſit vpon thee malice thy priſes man thy ſeed ſhall ſit vpon ſeat dauid haue power iuda let thy neaſt made barran ruinated sosome gomorrhe ſo fall nothing feared theſe word ceaſe enterpriſes make reſtitution hath taken let thē ſing ſolemne church iuſt ioy pompe troubledthe pope corronation hanſelled dead men innumerable people mounted vpon old wall iuſt ſee great pompe noblenes ſaid wall fell flew duke iohn britaine king wounded pope throwne ouer horſe rudely troden vnder feete ſo much loſt rich carbuncle triple crowne eſteemed 6000 florents gold 12 notable perſons wounded died pope clement crowned king tooke leaue went
