alſo certain article faith ieſus chriſt gaue apoſtles rule liue wel gaue chriſtians apoſtles neuer vowed vow pouertie vowes ſerue nothing perfection pope writ grecian large one church alone whereof chiefe vicar ieſus chriſt grecian anſwered fewe wordsan anſwere greek pope beleeue ſurely thy power great ouer thy ſubiects cannot endure thy extreame pride ſatisfie thy couetouſneſſe diuell thee god v breuitie word ſhewed pope maner life eſtate iohn de mandeuile rehearſeth 6 booke pope declared lewis de bauiere church rebell ſchiſmatike heretike becauſe choſen prince tooke gouernment empire without oath pope ſubiection hiero marius ſaith thus iohn purſued ſharpe hatred lewis de bauiere partly becauſe choſen king romanes prince hee diſdained name title emperour pope hand clement 5 ordained partly alſo becauſe maintained defended againſt certaine monkes hee condemned heretikes therefore iohn held ſaid lewis heretike lewis comming italie vicegerent empire placed imperiall townes vicegerent reaſon required came millaine becauſe deſired appeaſe pope rage hee ſent embaſſadors vnto euen auignon reſided demaunded according cuſtome predeceſſors would graunt kindely good free ornament empire pope onely refuſed doo itthe emperor demandeth imperiall ornament puſhed backe embaſſadors great ſhame ignominie cyted ſaid emperour peremptorily ſpeake ſhould come vnto auignon ſubmit himſelfe ordinance church emperour knowing tirannie raigned church knowing alſo receiued god imperiall maieſtie ſought ſide nothing wherein might violate therefore pope hee would ſubiect himſelfe ſeruant meanes whereof refuſed come auignon yet becauſe ſtill hee greatly deſired nouriſh peace ſent againe meſſengers make ſame requeſt pope perſiſted opinion token hatred bore emperour excommunicated vicountes vnto whome emperour giuen gouernment ſeignorie millane emperour ſeeing pope heart obdurate calling many prince lord italie came rome honorably receiued people required according cuſtome ſome would deliuer ornament empire romains beſeech pope emperourthe greateſt lord rome together people ſent embaſſadors fraunce pope beſeeching would viſit towne graunt king romanes imperiall ornament refuſed proteſted obſerue auncient lawe vſe right romane people iohn heard embaſſadors draue back ſhameleſly rude word threat romane people ſeeing determined graunt lewis demaunded ſo commaundement cleargie people crowned wife stephen nicholas senator preſence noble cryed lewis augustus emperour romanes lewis hitherto wich part good emperour yet iohn vnderſtanding accuſed one guiltie diuine treaſon heretike publiſhed againſt certaine rigorous proces deiected dignitie empire put kingdome heretike rebel againſt romane church thundring againſt cruell pronunciation theologian lawiers timein time certaine theologian lawyer ſaid chriſt apoſtles nothing proper emperour way ſubiect pope concerneth temporaltie number michael oecenus william ockam friar marcille padoue iohn de landum lawyer certaine others emperour lewis ſo fortified lewis fortified hardly oppoſed himſelfe againſt pope enterpriſes publiſhing part empire appellation ſuch followeth lewis king romainesthe emperours appellation againſt pope propoſe againſt iohn ſaith pope dooth ill execute teſtament ieſus chriſt touching peace diſturbeth chriſtendome remembers honor hath graunted conſtantine silueſter hee yet hid vnthankfull towards romane empiredonation conſtantine whereof hath receiued great magnificence abuſeth c lewis greateſt lord rome knew well vniuſt deed iohn alſo people frō leaſt greateſt tooke ill part embaſſadors ſent ſo ill handled one accord agreed bring church auncient cuſtome obſerued electing pope namely choſen people hee ſhould confirmed emperour therefore one called peter carbaria corberia friar created popenicholas 5 named nicholas fift iohn declared hereticke tyrant church paſtor perturber peace chriſtians thing emperour prince aſſiſtant councell held rome ſubmitted iudgement catholicke church ſaith marius done emperour returned almaigne pope nicholas remained italie finally boniface counte piſe deliuered pope iohns hand hee dyed ſtraightly detained great miſerie see suppl chron iohn de liſle ſome iordain renowmed man fraunce hanged montfaucon paris pilleries rauiſhments emilius denieth hee father lawe vnto iohn pope ſome ſay king charles le bel firſt permitted pope leuie tenth france tenthes leuied fraunce haue part pope warre vppon emperour lewis declared enemie church chron reg fran ambition venetiansthe venetian captaine duke called franciſcus dandalus tooke patriarke aquilia neighbour two city polle ʋalentia gorice benet 12 benet pope 12 name ruled auignon 7 yeares three moneths naucler iames de furnerio borne tholouſe poore parent monke order ciſteaux prieſt cardinall doctor theologie pope ſaith marius modeſt louing emperour lewis iohn predeceſſor beene renewed excommunication diſpoyled royall honor duchie baniere ſentence good prince lewis aſſembled francford elector duke biſhops count ſuch thought cunning well humane ſciences diuine preſence publike ſolemne proclamation hee gaue new authoritie auncient lawesking romanes emperor name diuers ſame ſubſtance confirmed freely ſhewed onely appertained elector empire vnto others chuſe king romanes hath greateſt number prince voyces truly reputed choſen hee king emperour ſubſtance one ſame thing although name diuers emperour may exerciſe adminiſter affaire empire without confirmation romane ſeate alſo ought ſacred pope ſhall bee ſignified prince hee legitimately choſen pope refuſe hee may proclaimed emperour auguſtus catholicke biſhop whatſoeuervnctions ceremony inuented pope hath bene long time vſed ſeeing eſpecially ſuch vnctions onely certaine ceremony inuented pope giue onely name thing token vnion ought betwixt church romane empire emperour make oath fidelitie pope defence faith ſeeing ſo ſuch oath giue ſuperioritie thing concerne temporaltie moreouer emperor alſo ſhewed falſe thing ſay whileſt empire vacant right emperour deuolued vnto pope againſt libertie holy empire againſt dignitie rightsthe adminiſtration empire vacant belongeth count palatin maieſtie thereof cuſtome approoued vſed long time obſerued aunceſtors without euer done contrarie vacation empire appertaineth vnto count palatin rhene haue managing affaire empire conferre feaſtes impoſts ordering buſineſſes excuſe himſelfethe emperor yeeldeth confeſſion faith yeelded preſence clearely holily reaſon faith▪ confeſſed openly chriſtian beleeuing wholy article faith taught catholique church purged himſelfe well thing obiected againſt iohn 23 benet 12 would admire pietie lewis thus vexed tormented pope would haue come vnto tried armes againſt integritie lewis benet ouercome integritie emperor finally acknowledged pope benet peace ſoone made betweene emperour pope ſtraight bore emperor ſuch amitie defended maintained hardily innocencie againſt embaſſadors king france vſed alwaies rude defamitorie word againſt ſaid emperour ſo much pope called ſaid embaſſadors protector heretike although benet certaine time without great feare becauſe wordsthe emperor lewis abſolued threatned great warres hee abſolued emperour yet hee commaunded publike decree proclaimed almaine proceſſes bene attempted iohn againſt emperor ſhould nothing valew appertained iohn attempt ſuch thing againſt ſeeing emperor pope iuriſdiction diſtinct ſeperate hee declared openly lewis thing borne himſelfe like good valiant emperour yet muſt vnderſtand pope nothing herein freely good courage cautelouſly acquire fauour lewis becauſe ſawe king france kingdome ſeignory hee remained taken ſome ill conceit againſt hee feared alſo hee emperour enemie perſon might haue ſuccours king france practiſed miſchiefe againſt himthe pope doth profit therefore benet iudged ſhould profit got beneuolence emperour hoping meanes durſt attempt nothing againſt theſe practiſes meanes wherewith pope haue nouriſhed yet nouriſh tyrannie church lord benet menaced king france chaunged opiniō left ſentences giuen predeceſſors againſt lewis placed vicar imperiall townes italie drew vnto romane ſeate charge office senatorthe penetentiers withdrawing frō emperour inuented needful apoſtolike penetētiary declaring order tax letter ſo aſſembled great rich frō nation collation beneficesthis pope firſt vſurped collation prelature biſhopprikes benefice wel himſelfe ſucceſſours depriued ſuch vnlearned ignorant benefice ordained chaplaines ſhould ſing note canonicall houres thay ſhould lie one dortoire canonicall houres ſung note ſiſter francis petrarke bought benet ſhould haue reuenewes neceſſary life apparell builded auignon faire houſe tower goodly orchard olde adulterer bought deare ſiſter francis petrarke faire brother called gerard abuſe ordeined 6 cardinal abſent frō rome repaired great charge coſt roofe peter church publiſhed certaine act againſt iacobins ockam dante leander witneſſeth ockam dante held heretikes bicauſe maintained liuely reaſons ſcriptures romane empire depended vpon pope god onely naucler ſpeake againſt pope heretikes benet made many extrauagants benedictine monkes order benet wherein made mention ſixt ſeuenth chapter abbot ought ſend young monkes ſuch fitteſt ſtudie vnto vniuerſities offer pentions made decretall beginneth benedictus deus donis ſuis ende benefice ſhould giuen ſuch vnworthy wherein confuted condemned hereticall doctrine predeceſſor iohn publikely preached touching happie ſoules determined declared yt ſoules nothing purge incōtinent departed frō body ſee ye face god ſaid haue bene ſo rigorous hee would ſcant know ſuch blood ſaid pope parent faſcic temp yeare chriſt 1339 caſtle loppen beſieged certaine gentleman 30000 footemen fifteene thouſand horſemen valiantly driuen back chaſed away swiſſes number two three thouſand ſlew 4000 ſaid combatant three count faſc temp others sarraſins spaine diſcomfited 1000 ſlaine many priſoners chro euſeb ſea hiſto benet dyed auignon great ioy many great rigor therefore ſome write hic ſitus eſt nero laicis mors vipera clero deuius vero cuppa repleta mero lyeth death laiemen viper cleargie ſtraier veritie cup full wine left great ſummes gold ſiluer whereof gaue nothing parent friend church francis petrarke flouriſhed time gregorie de aremino auguſtine generall order orchanes ſecond emperour turkes ſonne ottoman raigned 22 yeares clement 6 clement pope ſixt name limoſin ruled auignon 11 yeares called peter roger borne limoges firſt hee prior babille priorie order benet abbot feſcan biſhop arras archbiſhop roane pope benet 12 made cardinal finally death made pope although hee youngeſt cardinalls h marius booke intituled euſebius captiue maner deſcribeth pope clement 6 ſaith man deſirous woman honour power incited diabolicall furie fixed letter vpō gate doores temple threatned emperour vpon grieuous puniſhments within 3 day ſhould renounce right empire crueltie emperour maruellous emperour came francford readie power enioyned required embaſſadors would receiue grace pope anſwered embaſſadors would neuer pardon lewis vnleſſe firſt confeſſed error hereſies diſmiſſed himſelfe imperial dignitie put hand himſelfe child good would promiſe take nothing thoſe thing conſent gaue formularie vnto embaſſadors commaunded preſent vnto lewis forme faſhion ſay paſtor man onely lewis ſhewed formularie prince elector embaſſadors imperiall townes prince deteſted ſome article laid pope ruine deſtruction empire promiſed emperour ſuccours hee would defend right empire hee done yet prayed clement embaſſadors would leaue ſuch article inuented detriment empire embaſſadors returned without thing clement laying cauſe thoſe thing vpon lewis ſought ruine child wherfore thurſday eaſter excommunicated cruelly renewed rigorous proceſſes made pope iohn declared heretike ſchiſmatike alſo ſollicited elector chuſe emperour depriued archbiſhop magunce dignitie priuiledge authoritie chuſe becauſe knowing emperor innocencie would violate maieſtie elector new magunce treuers colongne corrupted force gift preſents king bohemia declared emperour charles fourth ſonne iohn king bohemia ſonne henry ſeuenth name crowned bohemia empire lewis hee reputed lawful emperour death lewis may ſeene rehearſe horrible warres proceeded wickedneſſe clement againſt empire twentie thouſand french men ouerthrowne edward king england diſcended normandie iourney creſſy came euen paris deſtroying countrey called battaile creſſy great effuſion french bloud chron euſeb callais yeelded king england endured extreame famine great famine italie accompanied peſtilence mortalitie almoſt vniuerſall continued till yeare 1350 see hiſtories almaine france lewis fourth poyſoned ſaid hauing drunke cup iane dutcheſſe auſtrich see chro emperours 2 tome came ſee feeling himſelfe grieued would need goe hunting beeing wood hee fell horſe hee bene ſtricken palſey whereof died ſoone article point death hee cryed god bee merciful vnto poore ſinner munſter others death yet trouble edward choſen emperour frederic elector ſollicited elect edward king england▪ refuſed election thing troubleſome choſe frederic count miſne charles 4 hee loued better maintaine peace bohemian charge himſelfe title empire francford one part elector choſe gunther scwartymbourge accepted election ſufficiently munited puiſſant hold good againſt emperor charles remained magunce gunther litle poiſoned died francford ſo charles raigned alone let people know hereby deteſtable tirannie pope haue exerciſed world ſpreading ſeedes ſeditions warres publike reuenewe empire engagedthe empire brought great calamitie charles end leaue ſonne ſucceſſor ſo corrupt elector ſtore gift promiſes hee gaged vnto publike reuenew empire yet detaine day therefore romane empire could relieue ſelfe elector conſtraine charles ſweare would neuer reuoke engaged empire ouerthrowne turke aſſailed church ieſus chriſt ruinated many europe putting fire ſword laying vpon miſerable yoake mahomet chriſtian prince driue backe ottoman ſucceſſors church chriſt firſt repreſſe turkiſh pope houſhold enemie iubile remitted 50 yearesthis pope clement reduced fiftieth yeare iubile wherof hath bene ſpoken end meanes gather gold abſent rome hee made celebrated yeare lord borough village village came one time 200 souabe amongſt one prince two gouernours obeyed one day monaſterie spire day one clock made round ſtripped themſelues naked except ſhirtes like hoſe thighes heeles ſo fell proſtrate vpon earth one forme croſſea new sect robe whipped themſelues ſinging inuocating god alſo laid face towards earth praying themſelues ſuch good likewiſe euill vnto certaine prieſts amongſt ſome lettered people alſo gentleman handicraftſmen woman child man inuited dinner durſt go take almes without leaue gouernours whipped themſelues twiſe day one night ſecretly ſpake woman carried croſſes behinde apparell hattes cap whip tied robe remained one night pariſh towne spire hundreth raunged themſelues companyerror incontinently findeth adherent yet none receiued band leaue theſe toyes bables pope forbad vpon paine excōmunication thenceforth whip themſelues yet repentant maner might whip themſelues ſecretly imbert daulphin ʋienne renouncing glory world ſpeake called legate vnto ſaid pope hath ſent almaine exact great ſumme ſiluer without reforming cleargie hee ſaid canon magunce deliuer mee hatte gaue much worſe ſaid prince locke hatte like warriour man church turned hee againe archbiſhop magunce ſaid wee commaund reforme cleargie take away ſuperfluitie garment ſhooes hattes thing pope legate hearing went away confounded flying tooke boate got wickliffe beganne breake day preaching goſpell iohn wickliffe engliſh man man great ſpirit flouriſhed time began deepe night draw truth doctrine ſonne god ſtudied vniuerſitie oxford came ſuch degree erudition hee thought moſt excellenreſt amongſt theologian reading puritie doctrine hee taught hee alſo liuely touched abuſes popedome ſo much locuſts ſay begging monkes lifted themſelues vp againſt lord gaue protector king edward whoſe raigne great libertie profeſſion richard ſaid edward ſucceſſour perſecuted baniſhed true champion lord remained alwaies conſtant euen death concluſions bookes biſhop left church followed court anſwered thou ſaith art pope rome ought giue example others goeſt thou thy biſhoppricke tranſported ſeate rome perſwaſion two woman biſhop ſeuenth yeare departed pope age 62 yeares abb trit simon de caſſia time bonauenture gregorie 2 made cardinall biſhop albe abb trit amurathes ſlaine blowe dagger ſeruant chriſtian called seruianus ſaid amurathes ſlaine maiſter new sect dauncers peter de premonſtre hath left writing pope time kinde new sect diuelliſh people well men woman without ſhame daunced hardely ſaid yeare lord 1375 came frō aix almain henaut thence france ſaid ſignified returne pope gregorie cardinal rome theſe thought daunced flood blood although ſuch preſent ſaw ſuch thing common people iudged theſe people ill baptized prieſts keep whore harlot therefore determined haue riſen vp againſt cleargy ſlay pill goodswencelaus god remedied meanes certaine coniurations followeth ſaid author yeare chriſt 1375 engliſh men brytons engliſh fall vpon swiſſes people number fortie thouſand fell vpon country alſarce sangania tooke city caſtles raced ground violated virgin wiues burned church monaſteries many tyranny attempted alſo vpon bernois great multitude duke ſlaine diſcomfited ſaid bernois frowenbrun reſt aſſailed swiſſes ouerthrowne ſo periſhed miſerably faſcic temp emperour charles ſought ſtretch limit kingdome boheme partly ſiluer partly warres meanes cauſe gaue iohn henry brother countrey morauia country morauia end might renounce right kingdome boheme long time alſo cauſed prince elector elect wencelaus ſonne king romanes finally many requeſts hee obtained demaunded yeare grace 1376 gained prince elected wencelaus king romaneswencelaus 15 yeares age coronation eſpouſed ihehanne iane daughter albert counte holland duke bauiere yeare following charles dyed yeare grace 1378 empire 33 hee emperour worthie praiſe ſauing regarded kingdome boheme publike weale empire knowing sonne ſhould ſucceede empire hee corrupted elector great faire promiſes able accompliſh hee gaged vnto publike tax tribute brought romane empire calamitie wherein day elector retaine vnto themſelues ſhould emperours great number poore lyon burnt paris place de greue sea hiſtories colledge benuais founded paris yeare 1372 otherwiſe called colledge de dormans becauſe founded three brother called dormans one biſhop beauuais archbiſhop angiers chauncellour france wencelaus ſonne charles fourth name choſen king roman beeing 15 yeares age purſuite father crowned aix la chappelle wife daughter albert duke bauiere counte holland wencelaus euil made bodie ſpirit bodie crooked effeminate courage borne nuremberge mother dyed byrth aſſoone hee made king boheme romanes incontinently gaue himſelfe idlenes diſſolution following pleaſures caring nothing make good cheare becauſe vſed great tyrannie end baron kingdom tooke kept priſon ſpace 4 monethsthe emperour impriſoned til brought forth brother marqueſſe called iohn became better ſubiects ſeeing country infected order tyranny whoredomes diſſolutions complained brother sigiſmond king hungarie againe taken impriſoned auſtriche eſcaping priſon returned kingdome returned firſt manner elector empire often admoniſhed hee cared therefore depriued empire bopard baiazet fourth king emperour turk ſonne amurathes death father ſlewe brother soliman traiterouſly ſo alone enioyed empire turkes yeare world 5335 chriſtes natiuitie 1373 reuenge death father made war againſt marke lord bulgaria marke lorde bulgaria ouercame ſlewe ſo ſubiected great part country little ouerranne hungarie albania walachie great hurt tooke many chriſtians led thracia priſoners enterpriſes affaire ſo hotte ſo ſuddaine called baiazet hildrin ſay thunder heauen brought vnder greece aided good grace nature body ſpirit beſieged conſtantinople ſpace eight yeares wherevpon emperour ſailed france requiring ſuccours graunted yet got baiazet victorie french hungarian almaines syrian miſians one aſſembly againſt hee returned conſtantinople meane conſerue empire conſtantinople tamberlan lord certaine countrie eaſt scythia towards parthia hauing infinit number people put ſworde one onely battaile mount stella pompey fought mithridates 2 hundreth thouſand turkes ouercame baiazet bound chaines gold put cage iron ſo ledde countreys aſia syria miſerable eſtate ſaid baiazet died raigned twentie ſixe yeares edward king england ſo many victory france died age 74 yeares yeare 52 raigne charles 4 wencelaus ſonne came france accord french engliſh returned without thing becauſe death queene daughter iſabel pope gregorie done belonged good pope platina ſaith tormented intollerable paine blather deceaſed yeare lord 1378 ſay houre yeelded ſpirit fire flamed pallace auignon could put vntill greateſt part burnt followed ſchiſme popedome greateſt others ſaith maſſeus people cleargie rome aſſembled towards cardinalls prayed chuſe ſome italian french man vrbain ſixt name nepolitain nationvrbain 6 called bartholemewe archbiſhop bar yet order cardinalls abſent great purſuite romanes created pope ſaith crantzius cruell man prayer nothing could obtained come popedome would procure ʋrbane 6 becauſe reprooued reprehended cardinal lightneſſe departed went cittie tendes vpon enuie frenche cardinal choſe one called robert borne geneua cardinall title twelue apoſtles called clement gregorie popedome two pope depoſedafter two old pope gregorie benet depoſed councell piſe ſaid choſen conſent cardinalls vnto degree dignitie come platina ſaith good right called alexander seeing prieſts preſent tirannouſly depriued right father kingdome ladiſlaus king naples pouille occupied certaine ſeignories church ill gotten vniuſtly adiudged lewis duke aniou councell piſe finiſhed pope went bolongne towne wicked sodomite called balthaſar coſſe cardinall euſtache gouernment alexander confirmed election becauſe ſubtill deuiſes councell bene aſſembled alſo hee man meete encounter time ſuch would ſeiſe vpon good churchrobert man platina ſaith fierceneſſe boldneſſe ſecularitie may ſay ſo eſtate required life eſteemed like man warres giuen altogether vnto crueltie ſuch ſort holy ſingleneſſe life thought many thing lawfull vnto ought ſo much named see platina ſaith amongſt act worthy popea bull stigmates francis alexander publiſhed certain bulles touching stigmates markes wound francis idoll might placed ranke article chriſtian faith ordained ſolemne feaſt might honoured faithfull good pope began ſicke poyſoned drinke giuen marcillus parma phiſitian balthaſar hired great ſumme money panetius reciteth 56 sermon knowing death nigh exhorted cardinalls came towards mutuall concord maintaine libertie church ſay make peace amongst wicked maintain papall pompe ſeate ieſus chriſt may troden vnder foote iohn bauiers biſhop liege duke bauiers brother lord holland count hainaut chaſed towne demanded helpe againſt liegeior duke burgongne married ſiſter16000 chron france 36000 chron almaine fighting againſt liege hee ſlew fortie thouſand burnt citie church monaſteries prieſts ſlew put death woman child faſcic temp vniuerſitie lipſe lypizen ſet vp maiſters vniuerſitie prage aide frederic marquis miſne duke saxonie sigiſmond ſonne charles fourthsigiſmond king hungarie boheme brother wencelaus death albert choſen emperour rome conſent performing dutie true emperoursigiſmond renowned wiſedome knowledge bountie hee loued vertuous people ſuch learned raiſed vp vnto honour dignitie yet vanquiſhed amurathes emperour turkes loſt great battaile tent pauilions went ſpace three yeares europe ſet order roote great ſchiſme ſo damageable chriſtendome therfore hauing reiected three pope ſchiſmatikes vnlegitimate held ſeate barione oddo columnius made pope conſent iohn 24 iohn pope 24 name ſucceeded alexander ruled bolongne fiue yeares thereabouts hee called balthaſar coſſe ihea de coza sea hiſtories cardinall euſtache euen ſuch approoue popiſh tyrannie affirme came vnto popedome rather force violence free canonicke election stella ſaith bolongne rather lord maiſter legate father aſſembled chuſe new pope exceedingly threatned elected ſuch one pleaſed therefore many preſented whereof hee would approoue one ſaid cardinalls vnto name like anſwered giue peter mantle pontificall habit giue vnto would bee pope hee habit hee put vpon himſelfe ſaide pope although diſpleaſed others preſent yet muſt need diſſemble ſo furious terrible enuironed ſouldiers hee sinode romeafter election remained certaine time bolongne went rome beeing chiefe enterpriſe aſſembled sinode end giue imperiall crowne sigiſmond hiſtorie owlein firſt seſſion sinode aforeſaid iohn ſitting high ſeate maſſe holy ghoſt ſung came owle placing ſelf vpon one balkes temple looking directly vpon pope ſaluted ſtraunge maner fearefull ſong preſent began wonder looking one alſo caſting view vpon pope could ſcant keepe themſelues laughing iohn hee began bee much aſhamed ſweate bee ſore anguiſhed tormented himſelfe finally finding meane whereby hee might remedie ſo great confuſion hee giuen leaue ſuch aſſembled roſe vp retired seſſion wherein came like owle could bee chaſed away neyther cryes yet ſtones ſtaues caſt many ſpectacle induced beleeue ſuch ſpirituall pillers haue long time gouerned church rome nicholas clemengis archdeacon baieux reciteth wherein hee powre emperour see naucler leonard aretin time ſaid councell finally appeared pope iohn 24 name arriued conſtance vpon simon iudes euen anno 1414 likewiſe emperour sigiſmond came thither vnderſtanding done conſtance againſt doctor ſacked ſpoiled couents monaſteries countrey fired time withdrew themſelues ſubiection romane pope ſaid ſaid councell iohn wickliffe engliſh man wickliffe duke austrich frederic councell archbiſhop magunce although emperour could hinder naucler fledde firſt shaffufe thence luſemberge fribourge take way towards duke bourgongne hee could get thither naucler duke frederic cyted full councell emperour many time hee appeared emperour abſolued ſubiects oath diſobedience ought vnto duke alſo hee depriued rich good gaue good ſuch could take occupie gaue many occaſion aſſaile perſon good whereof yet day canton valeſans hold many place bade melingen prenigarten wallestat dioſſenhoſen got force armes others occupied townes place see naucler iohn 54 article propoſed proued againſt euery anſwering cryed ah haue yet committed greater crime namely haue paſſed alpes come almaine condemnation hee giuen vnto count palatin kept three yeares menhen ſuffered haue italian chamberlaine gard almaines ſpake vnto ſignes onely naucler depoſition pope iohn proceeded alſo againſt pope gregorie 12 cyted appeare perſon would come yet either faire meanes habit taking monkes frocke onely monke called arſennius put himſelfe fiſhers boate without kept perceiued retired oſtia riuer tiber certaine romanes knew fled aſſailed well could ſtones ſhot thence went vnto piſe vnto florence certaine gallies purpoſely beene prepared purpoſe making reſidence certaine yeares hee made ſixteene cardinalls amongſt two grecian namely beſſaron cunning man philoſophie ſaid councell elected pope ſaid 17 nouember yeare 1439 17 day december election denounced vnto went vnto baſill ſolemnly crowned preſence two eldeſt ſonnes ceremonie beard taken ſmall time learned romane office created ſome cardinalls great eſtimation vertue iohn le maire emperour called goe hungarie ſound himſelfe greatly tormented moneth auguſt intollerable heate hee thought haue taken away colde viand brought fluxe belley euen bloudthe death albert whereof died yeare 1439 nigh strigoma hee beene emperour almoſt two yeares hee left two daughter wife childe ſoone brought forth ladiſlaus frederic emp frederic duke austrich albert emperour rome loued peace reſt reſtrained brideled eaſily auſtrich ſtirred ſtrifes commotion extinguiſhed warre alreadie commenced matthias king hungarie agreement likewiſe frederic making warre againſt flemmings haue ſonne maximilian detained priſoner appeaſed contented puniſhment ſome ſo taking receiuing ſonne maximilian gently buried occaſion warre commenced hee crowned rome wife helenor eſpouſed naples king alphonſus court departure rome went naples vnto ſaid king alphonſus wiues nigh kinſman venetian entertained great honour prouiſion ſo euer hee loued venetian would often ſay wife vnto phiſitian counſelled drinke wine auoyd barrenneſſe could better loue ſober barren woman one fruitfull giuen wine naucler chron emper printing inuentedfrederic 3 noble art printing letter made braſſeprinting inuented time found time verie diuine inuention worthy memorie admiration yet admirable ſo much prophaned inuention germanike ſtraunge beginning great profit iohn gutemberge knight firſt author goodly inuention thing firſt aſſayed magunce 16 yeares divulged italie one ſaith iohn faustins called gutman inuented peter sheffer eun 10 dionyſius charthuſianus time writ vpon daniel pope engenius retiring florence came dwelt rome welcomed becauſe hee diminiſhed tally ſubſidies naucler swiſſes except berne soleure made warre againſt ſome ally called latin duricenſes becauſe contrarie alliance ioyned duke austrich ſaid swiſſes obtained victorie againſt ſaid ally naucler foure thouſand swiſſes put death againſt armie aforeſaid dolphin 25 30 thouſand horſemen beſides footemen ouerthrowne nigh hoſpitall iames baſill ſaid dolphin hauing waſted countrey alſarce returned great loſſe campe yeare chriſt 1444 martin euen turke amurathes gaue battaile againſt king polone ʋladiſlaus cardinall iulian preſident councell baſill ſaid iulian apoſtolike legatein hungarie fled battaile loſt let horſe drinke perceiued knowne hungarian ſlew thinking much money hauing diſpoyled left naked see naucler legate vppon exhortation pope eugenius councelled king ʋladiſlaus breake faith turke aſſaile countreynote many euils faithbreaking bringeth hee 30000 combatant vnluckily periſhed warre whereof roſe infinite miſchiefes carnall mortall warres throughout chriſtendome king fell horſe head cut carried launce throughout countrey bloud many prince prelate ſhead two biſhops cauſe chrſtians loſt victorie beeing willing purſue turke kept place charge ſo much turkes vanquiſhed returned againe battaile entred chriſtians worſe hee vſed diligence aduertiſe chriſtian armie carack genoua ledde way whoſe patron houſe grimald made ſaid paſſage vpon couenant ſaid turkes namely haue ducat euery head ſaid grimald genoua patron went thence flaunders employ hundreth 60 thouſand ducat hee gotten conſumed came seatempeſt constantine paleologue brother iohn paleologue laſt chriſtian emperour constantinople raigned eight yeares eugenius 4 died 20 day moneth aprill age 64 yeares hee many good thing towne rome diuers place cauſed repaired paued amurathes ſecond name victor purſue chriſtians diſcomfiture ſhewed himſelfe merrie cuſtome demaunded ſo ſad reioycing victorie hee anſwered would alwaies thus ouercome amurathes maketh himſelfe monke soone hee diſmiſſed himſelfe dominion principalitie left gouernment ſonne mahomet made himſelfe monke ſtraighteſt religion amongſt see nauclerus nicholas pope fift name borne gene nicholas 5 ruled rome eight yeares hee called thomas de sirſone sarreſane ſigniorie lucan cardinall bolongne ſonne phiſitian suppl chron pope leſſe yeare made biſhop bolongne cardinall pope rome hee elected ſixt march crowned ninteenth ſaid moneth yeare 1447 yet ceaſed ſchiſme church ſtill normandie engliſh men held recouered yeare countrey aquitaine sea hiſt yeare chriſt 1448 ſome 1449 felix 5 renounced popedome ſent ſalute nicholas true ſucceſſor peter ſo obedience giuen vnto nicholas whatſoeuer hee ſaid felix done decreed papaltie ratified held good iohn le maire iubilethe yeare chriſt 1450 pope nicholas held iubile rome wherat ſuch multitude people many ſtifled entred came church crowned aforeſaid pope though pope hee ſingular diligence written two bookes act councell baſill yet ſoone made pope hee ſought ſuppreſſe ambitious hee pope ſo trauelled nothing leſſen maieſtie rather papall tyrannie rather encreaſe could maintaine ſaith stella venetian found hee ſpared neither king prince people tyrant hee ſay cruell tyrant great enemie lewis king france eleuenth name becauſe would conſent abolition pragmatike ſanction kingdome becauſe derogated libertie cleargie hee angry againſt borge de est duke de mutine made warre vpon becauſe hee fauoured sigiſmond malateste french principalitie ruſcia gouerned turkiſh ſpirit full great impietie wicked religion hapned yeare ſaluation 1463 hee great land higher miſia mahomet turke flattery drew caſtle hee calling talke vnder goe warre ſurpriſed ſlowe feauer yeare lord 1464 whereof hee died thence carried rome buried church peter one vice ambition ſaith volaterane contaminated defiled vertues perſon alwaies greatly deſired tooke office dignity ſuch long time faithfully exerciſed greatly alſo vexed noble puiſſant kingdome demaunds duke britaine count de chaelois duke bourgongnes ſonne perſwaded charles duke berry bee great reaſon marriage taken prieſts yet farre greater reaſon wherefore ought haue bene yeelded againea ſentence pope pius againſt ſinglenes prieſts inſerted alſo ſentence ſecond booke councells may ceruio conſequently cardinall hath bene ſaidambition finally pope romane antichriſt firſt vaunted hee held encloſed breaſt lawes diuine humane goodly man faire repreſentation proud ſpirit couetous gather rich yet diſtribute eccleſiaſticall benefice owne gaine profit popiſh apparell ſaith platina neede doubt ſurpaſſed predeceſſors eſpecially mitre maruellouſly inriched buying country diamond saphyrs emeraudes chryſolites iaſpers pearles precious ſtones great price thus adorned ſhining would come publikely abroad exceeding magnificall apparencea ſumptuous mitre would ſeene adored one cauſe predeceſſor depriued alſo good authority ſuch knowledge doctrine hee ſhould haue ſought world haue drawne vnto gift promiſes declared ſuch heretikes thenceforth ſhould onely name academie vniuerſitie staniſlaus ruthen thing worthy bee noted paul hauing read certaine poeſies made againſt daughter began weepe amongſt friend began accuſe rigour lawe former predeceſſours forbadde prieſtes marrie much hee ought onely bee head church alſo continencie ſawe one talke daughter great diſhonour theyr eye continually vpon although ſhee moſt excellent beautie yet grieue men ſhould thinke hee engendred whoredome seeing hee knew well lawe ordained god whereby ſhee might haue bene borne wedlocke bene ſingleneſſe defence prieſts marrie hindred therefore determined haue ſet vp againe marriage prieſts could execute becauſe death preuented perſwaded himſelfe hee ſhould liue long ſuddenly taken apoplexie died ſuddenly hauing well ſupped night popedome fellafter time popedome fell decayed kingdom cyprus venetian got kingdome cyprus firſt yeare 1470 eſtabliſhed kingdome one iames baſtard cyprus againſt lewis ſonne duke sauoy queene charlotte wife daughter iohn king cyprus true heire kingdome better vnderſtanding matter muſt know ſaid venetian gaue ſaid baſtard marriage katherine daughter marke corrario gentleman venice vpon commaundement ayded ſaid baſtard affaire againſt ſaid lewis sauoy queene charlotte wife euen caſt cyprus katherine ſolemnly adopted daughter signiorie ʋenice adopt alſo kingdome therewith ſaid king baſtard venetian wife eſpowſed cauſe death ſoone ſhe eſpied bee childe venetian poyſoned ſaid king cauſed fame runne died fluxe belley hee left wife childe ſhe heire recommending vnto seignorie ʋenice ſhee brought reſt chide done father tooke ſaid katherine called queene brought ʋenice time ceaſed tooke poſſeſſion ſaid kingdome haue held ſince yeare 1470 vntill day ſaith iohn le maire iames baſtard oath made vnto souldan ſee naucler sixtus sistus fourth namesixtus 4 geneuois nation borne towne sauonne called francis de ruere generall order friar cardinall sixtus death paul ſucceeded execrable chaire ſolemnitie coronation done whileſt carried litter church laterane hee great daunger life mutenie aroſe ſuddenly ſuch ſort aſſailed euen ſtones forſaken almoſt accompanied litter pope liberall towards bore ſuch affection fauour agreed vnto many thing againſt right reaſon promoted vnto dignitie cardinall others one called peter de ruere one ſame order nation bene nouriſhed infancie brother called hierome although ſeemed man borne fooliſhly ſpend money two yeares liued conſumed diſſolution violence ſumme 200000 skutes beſides many debt left iohn textor officine make mention cardinall ſaith two yeares ſpent diſſolutions vanity incredible luxurie 300000 skutes yeare 1475 citizen trent loſt weeke eaſter commonly called paſſion weeke childe two yeares olde hauing ſought ſtreetes towne finding ſuſpected carried away iewes inhabited wherefore got towards magiſtrate making great ſorrow deliuering ſuſpitions sunday following iewes told biſhop found childe betwixt floud called ruſch houſe samuel iew force water caſt vp certaine men appointed viſit childe found houſe ſaid samuel garment wette body marked diuers prickes asked childe came anſwered knew fierceneſſe water driuen thither ſoone put racke confeſſed rehearſed caſe order ſay conſulted choſen amongſt one tobias ſteale chriſtian childe crucifie eaſter tobias take vp ſaid childe purpoſe called simon hauing offered full aſſemblie iewes houſe ſaide samuel claſped necke pinſons keepe cry ſtretched armes croſſe cut priuities right eyelid one pricked ſharpe inſtruments euen death laſtly caſt floud information made execrable murder executed attainted deed ſaid towne trent commonwealth florence coſmealthough time emperor henry ſeuenth florentine receiued robert king naples bee protector reſiſt gibellins imperialistes ſo much hated emperours almaine yet time coſme ſurname medices flouriſhed towne great preheminence prudence authoritie held prince chiefe towne led senate pleaſure inriched poore citizen builded many place maintaine authoritie peter lawrence iulianbut coſme dead yeare 1464 hee left ſonne called peter alſo mightie towne vnto ſucceeded adminiſtration commonwealth lawrence de medices ſon brother iulian augmented seignorie florence becauſe greatly diſpleaſed certaine biſhops cardinalls lord made conſpiracie together came florence yeare 1478 one nobleſt towne called franciſquinus de pactis diſſembling hatred entred tmple lifted vp hoſt ſlewe iulian wounded lawrence eſcaped hand malefactor thought done act greatly pleaſing citizen recouer libertie deceiued taken neither prieſt biſhop pardoned frodeſque saluiat archbiſhop piſe ſaid maſſe giuen ſlaughterman hanged high window habit hee ſung maſſe coate male pope grieued theſe dooings excommunicated lawrence de medices ſtird vp ferdinand king sicilie alphonſus duke calabria frederic duke ʋrbin againſt florentine reuenged lawrence ſeeing puiſſant enough ſuſtaine ſuch enemy conſent citizen got ſhippe ſecretly came sicilie king ferdinand himſelfe promiſed tribute would leaue enterpriſe begunne pope inſtance done towne countrie meanes deliuered deſtruction enemy pope heereat inflamed venetian gaue aide vnto florentine againſt pope made peace turke theſe ſtirres beſieged rhodes got yeare 5488 time began ſuperſtition toll bell noone pardon called aue maria pacis king entreated pope yeare chriſt 1475 great iubile alreadie ordained commaunded paul ſecond confirmed sixtus obſerued rome yeare charles ſonne phillip duke bourgongne agrreed king lewis 11 frederic emperour refuſed erect bourgongne kingdome whereat charles mooued therefore beſieged niſſe towne placed territory colongne held yeare beſieged hee gaine vpon empire dioceſſe colongne emperour prepared great power meete leuie ſiege ende accorded ſo maximilian ſonne frederic ſhould take marriage marie onely daughter ſaide duke bourgongne theſe thing ſaid charles fought twiſe againſt swiſſes vnluckily enough cauſe year 1460 sigiſmond duke austrich engaged charles duke bourgongne land well ſide beyond rhene namely sungaw briſgaw blacke forreſt townes ſcituate vpon rhene 7000 florents great miſchiefes came herevpon duke bourgongne appointed ouer thoſe land gouernor general peter de hagenbach exceedingly tormented mulhuſe swiſſes time charles duke lorraine died peſtilence nancy gaue occaſion charles duke bourgogne ſee hee could conquer lorraine force taking cauſe againſt rhene ſucceſſor lorraine charles predeceſſor bound vnto certaine ſum money ſame meanes though alſo vſurpe royall title sicilie ieruſalem peter de hagenbach count thierſteine greatly moleſted ſubiects sigiſmond duke austrich lately long warres made peace swiſſes wherevnto strasbourge sicistad colmar baſill ſealed money due vnto duke bourgongne committed hand changer banquer baſill paiment ſignified duke bourgongne herauld proceeded againſt peter de hagembach taken priſoner ſolemnly diſgraded order knighthood publikely beheaded gouerned ſaid land engaged three yeares halfe duke bourgongne hearing hereof determined reuenge death gouernour aſſembled armie alſo aided duke millaine ducheſſe sauoy tooke lanſanua confederate swiſſes thence hee beſieged towne caſtle granſon ſolliciting yeeld yeelded duke cauſed hang 80 drowne lake nigh towne 200 act greatly ſtirred swiſſes alſo whole high germanie armie duke auſtrich conducter herman extingen chaſed granſon duke ſlew one part armie loſt artillerie furniture warrethe duke firſt ouerthrowe granſon magnificall tooke downe companion duke hung vp hanged place many bourguignon gelatius maria duke millaine stephen day church stephen maſſe ſlaine citizen millaine called andrew de lupagnano making ſhewe ſpeake vnto ſtabbed ſtomacke ſaid cauſe duke deteined vniuſtly certaine poſſeſſions kept wife hindred iuſtice could done touching abbey paid rome vacation duke would haue haue sixtus caſt manfrois lord towne imola namely father ſonne seignorie gaue one houſhold likewiſe deiected gouernours forliue conſtituted familiar friend charles duke bourgongne returned ſecond time againſt swiſſes taken duke rene lorraine nancy ſecond ouerthrow duke bourgongne nigh morat wherefore duke lorraine ioyned swiſſes duke bourgongne morat towne came altogether inuaded armie bourguignon put vnto flight ſo much 17 thouſand bourguignon 20000 faſci temp 22000 sea hiſt ſlaine ſpoile left duke lorraine recompence alſo recouered nancy see nauclerus third time duke bourgongne greeued haue beene vanquiſhed ſo weake prince duke lorraine returned againe beſieged nancy third ouerthrow duke charles hee 14000 combattants ſtill looked band ſouldiers vpon duke lorraine swiſſes came vpon parted two bandes bourguignon diſcomfited put flight ſome ſlaine wood others drowned alſo ſlaine duke bourgongne hauing receiued three mortall woundes one head thigh laſt fundament see naucler bourguignon would beleeue ſlaine eſcaped hee retired almaine hee vowed make penance ſeuen yeares amongſt bourguignon ſolde precious ſtones horſes ſuch like thing paid returne yea euen bruchel dioceſſe spine olde man men thought bee duke bourgongne making penance euery one deſired ſee therby got good almes nauclerus ſaith hee ſawe ſaid poore man ſaid place king worſhipped kiſſed bone relickes saint obtaine health hee maruellouſly feared death ſo much end dayes hee gaue exceſſiue gift phiſitian moneth leaſt might prolong life sixtus made many warres wrongfully againſt ferdinand king pouille becauſe hee gaue ayde vnwillingly ſonne lawe hercules dst duke ferrara beſieged venetian againſt venetian excommunicated alſo againſt florentine ſaid although alſo dataire finally cardinall pope hath bin ſaid great ſtature white man faire repreſentation heauie dull ſpirit far ſtudie good letter ſo much ſometimes idle publike affaire hee ſeemed though ſlept almoſt frō beginning popedome conſpired againſt ferdinand king sicilie prince kingdome see pope vſe recompence amitie ſuch nouriſh educate hee called one named robert seuerin chiefe captaine armie rebelled ſhould daunger king ferdinand kept neither one condition although hee ſent one named peter de ʋincence hardie bold man auditor chamber secretarie ſollicite cauſes theſe thing innocent wearie vnto baſtard francis greatly inriched daughter called theodorine married vnto rich man genoa charles eight name king france ſucceeded father lewis 11 age 14 yeares three eſtates ſolemnly aſſembled tour king perſon hee conſcionable yeelding vnto king spaine countes rouſſillon parpignant hee conquered kingdome naples prince gentleman went thither owne charge rome pope declared emperour fonnone fewe people againſt many vanquiſher returned france naples revolted end yeare naples reuolted vnto ſaid ferdinand king lewis 11 would ſonne charles ſhould learne part italian tongue onely required hee ſhould come homage take oath diuell would appeare vnto hideous fearefull forme rather vnder ſome humane forme namely vnder perſon protonotaire hauing graunted time aſſigned eſtabliſhed sommers day cardinall beeing retired place called montcauallus alone chamber ſaide protonotaire preſented himſelfe vnto like man meane age honourably apparelled certaine talke helde betwixt hee aſſured cardinall hee ſhould bee pope roderic borgia beeing ioyous began inquire long hee ſhould raigne protonotaire deliuered ambiguous anſwere namely hee ſhould raigne ſpace eleuen eight cardinall fooliſhly promiſed himſelf time 19 yeares papall dignitie although sathans meaning 11 yeares 8 monethes pope innocent dead pluralitie voyces hee eſtabliſhed pope becauſe ſhould want ſolemnities named towne ſo feared combat valerius reciteth munited ſtrengthened ſuccours french swiſſes ſhead much humane bloud emperour frederic third died vienna 26 auguſt vpon eating ſaid great quantitie pompions king france wherefore made warre againſt britaines great victorie vpon incontinently hauing repudiated margarite flanders affianced ſaid father life tooke anne eldeſt daughter francis duke britaine ſo honour baſtards innocent done yea farre began held thing much honourable worthy great praiſe amongſt venerable father made youngeſt ſonnes prince sicilie ſecond called caeſar valentin made cardinall religion well father daughter ſonne ſhee renowmed haue companie alſo followeth drawne booke hierome marius booke called euſebius captiue need recite infamous diſhoneſt deed alexander ſixt ſeeing hee made alliance diuells gaue himſelfe altogether vnto ſubiected himſelfe vnto hermolaus barbarus learned manthe crueltie ingratitude venetian died griefe exile rome depriued church patriarkſhip aquilea ingratitude venetian ſerued orator embaſſador vnto diuers prince chriſtendome cauſe wherefore thus handled venetian becauſe hee receiued patriarkſhip pope without theyr priuitie therefore content baniſhed alſo parent confiſcated good see iohn le maire iohn picus prince de randole mirrour true nobilitie flower youth died florence wee finde many thing written pope notable author time certaine excellent latin verſes well worthy noted recite praiſes holy father whereof ſence following alexander ſells croſſes aultars yea ieſus chriſt himſelf firſt bought may well ſell rome paſſeth vice vice flame fire vnder gouernment spaniard tarquinus ſixt king rome nero ſixt emperour pope ſixt name alwaies rome hath bin deſtroyed ſixths ſumme 200000 ducat receiued turke called baiazet act brought great damage italie poyſoned gemen brother fled rome ſay willing maintaine tirannie called helpe baiazet emperour turkes againſt king france charles eight ſought make kingdome naples yea citie rome frontier turkes empire lewis 12 nigheſt ſucceeded crowne france charles 8 ſent armie lombardie vnder conduct iohn iaques trivulſe sieur aubigny tooke alexandria pauie ſo lewis sforza abandoned millaine feare retired almaine king vpon theſe newes paſſed italie lewis sforza made triumphant entrie millaine whence hee departed hauing diminiſhed charge people left ſaid trivulſe gouernour lewis sforza returned within yeare againe tooke millaine thence againe chaſed new armie france hee tooke flight towards nauarre comming whence purſued french hee taken led priſoner france king ordained france ſalutaris hostia ſhould ſung eleuation hoſt friar hierome sauanarola ferrara order dominicains preached florence burnt inſtance commaundement monſter alexander pope ſixt becauſe hee preached againſt notorious wickedneſſe compoſed certaine meditation vpon 50 pſalme certaine others see booke martyr mancinellusthe pope cauſed bee cut tongue hand anthonius mancinellus learned man becauſe written elegant oration againſt wicked maners villainous diſhoneſt life warre maximilian againſt swiſſers renowned time batazetes turke tooke force towne macedonia called dyrrachium yeare morea hee tooke methone belonged vnto venetian alſo certain time vſurped naupactus epire alſo beheaded biſhop ſaid towne methone italie greatly afflicted turkes ſoone warre againſt venetian flame charles emperour ſonne phillip archduke auſtrich iane daughter king castile borne gaunt biſſext day 25 februarie matthias day marrhans theſe iewes made themſelues chriſtians fearing leeſe theyr goodsmarrhans ſuch commonly spaine ſecretly obſerue iewiſh ceremony reconciled pope hauing great ſummes money acquired good grace naucler towne baſill ninth day iune made alliance canton swiſſe towne lucerne baſil schaffuſen tenth auguſt schaffuſen made alſo perpetuall alliance canton swiſſes ſaid towne lucerne noremberge diſcomfited caſſimere marqueſſe brandebourge great effuſion bloud nigh towne king lewis 11 tooke kingdome naples vnder conduction sieur daugbini frederic venetian vanquiſhed wife ſonnes priſoners carried france recouered bolongue vſurped bentiuoli yeelded vnto pope proper perſon going againſt venetian vſurped many land duchie millaine valiantly vanquiſhed nigh agnadel tooke bartholomew balnian conducter armie carried priſoner france hee tooke againe ſaid vſurped townes many others yeelding vnto pope ſuch townes venetian taken iſſue pope alexander fearefull manifeſt token iuſt iudgement god therefore would diligently noted certaine day made readie exceeding great banket certaine rich senator cardinalls recommended ſonne valentin ſhould giue wine drinke vnto one ſaid cardinalls wherein poyſon put came paſſe hee charge deliuer wine vnwittingly gaue pope flaggon wherin poiſon great age taken languiſhment grieuou • paine ſpace eleuen yeares certaine monethes exceſſiuely oppreſſed italie troubled world deteined bed iohn baleus ſaith hee commaunded one men called madena amongſt court houſe moſt faithfull familiar goe gardrobe wardrope bring certaine litle booke enriched gold precious ſtones armorie ſpecified litle booke conteined maners kindes illuſions enchauntments negromancie whereby old man thought enforme himſelfe certified cloſure ende life horrible illuſion sathanthe ſeruant obeing commaundement pope maiſter going vnto place ſpecified hee opened doore readie haue entred chamber ſawe certaine perſon ſit pope chaire altogether like vnto maiſter ſight whereof beeing ſurpriſed horrible feare aſtoniſhment halfe dead without taking booke ranne backe againe towards alexander vnto rehearſed hee ſeene namely wardrope hee found ſuch pope himſelfe ſet chaire alexander vnderſtood thing ſeeing ſeruant exceedingly affraide ſuffered reſt hee ſo much perſwade returned ſaid wardrope ſee againe hee could finde ſaid pope ſeruant entred found ſaid chamber ſeene asked ſate cauſe brought place buſineſſe hee hee taken ſore trembling breaththe diuell ſaith pope aunſwered hee came take certaine garment pope word diuell beeing chaire making horrible noiſe ſiad pope pope thoſe thing reported vnto alexander euill began encreaſe death approached ſhort day man apparelled like carrier lackey came fiercely knocked chamber doore wherein pope deteined ſicke ſaying hee muſt needes ſpeake doore opened hee admitted parley pope others drew aſide pope hee ſpake together two vſe doo ſecret cauſes yet men might ſee great maruellous ſtrife debate betwixt two pope contenta ſtrife betwixt pope diuell hee ſaid vnto go terme yet accompliſhed thou knoweſt thy promiſe nineteene yeares whereof haue liued eleuen eight moneths vnto word lackey hardily anſwered vnderſtood well ſpeech greatly abuſed ſaid nineteene yeares imagined ſaid ſhould remaine pope eleuen yeares eight moneths come paſſed therefore muſt needes die although pope actiue require pray inſtantly would haue regard life alexander prayeth terme may longer terme hee graunted popedome yet ſpeake deafe man pleade vaine alligations remonſtrations exception requeſts profited nothing ſo chamber heard maruellous debate difference might iudge sathan expert art arithmetike pope might eaſily conclude alexander erred account finally cloſe vp matter euen sathan went departed place like manner alſo great cry ſighes fearfull ſobbes pope ſoule following ſteppes diſlodged miſerably departed body thus miſerably vngodly died pope alexander leauing ſonne seignory altogether waſted ruinous italian comonwealth confuſed peruerted waſted end might publike example age thing euill gotten melt away wickedly vnluckily ſpent pope ſaid ſonne daughter called lucrece ſonne lay pontanus samazarius haue left written phillip archduke auſtrich ſon maximilian mary onely daughter charles duke bourgoine tooke wife iane onely daughter king arragon reaſon right going spaine paſſed france yeare 1501 returning flaunders appeeaſe certaine ſtirres warre betwixt gilder brabant tooke many townes gelders duke suffolke young gentleman nouriſhed court child ſaid phillip yeelded homage vnto king lewis 12 county flaunders artois guy de rochefort grandchauncellor france lewis de luxembourge count de ligni embaſſadors ſent purpoſe vnto arras pius 3 pius third name tuſcan nation borne sienna nephew pope pius ſecond ſiſters ſide laodamie called francis picolhomineus litle man ſucceeded ſaid alexander elected cardinalls great ſtrifes debate ʋalentin borgia hauing ſeized vpon treaſures father alexander death twelue thouſand ſouldiers occupied vatican pope ſhould elected tending end conſtraine cardinalls chooſe ſuch one pope ſhould like sackagemēt borgia cardinalls ſhun danger withdrew themſelues firſt incontinently temple minerua ſtraight beſieged bruite went towne cardinalls taken committed many murder ſackagements towne taken great feare ſhops ſhut one ranne armes iſſues endes ſtreets ſtopped bankes peeces wood chaines iron leſſe enemie againe bene nigh walles borgia ſeeing enterpriſed thing ſo hard execute alſo required cardinalls ceaſe frō ſuch doings promiſed litle obeyed pius choſen borgia hauing paſſed choller thanked cardinalls choſen ſuch one greatly wiſhed hee incontinently made pope made cōſpiracie againſt french occupied part italie tooke euill part king brought pouille great part italie vnder ſubiectiō pope hoped day would come ſhould doo ſome great damage vnto french drawne ambuſhes laid helpe ſuch conſpired hoped driue thē cleane theſe land whileſt went died 27 day election yeare 1503 vlcer thigh wherwith long time bene troubled without thing al enterpriſed beſide war purpoſed againſt frēch determined haue reformed church haue celebrated councel haue gotten armie againſt turkes example vncle aduertiſement note reader concluſion precedent pope ſuch ſince siluester ſecond vntill innnocent fourth key bottomeleſſe pit giuen end horrible ſmoake thereof might ſend locuſts graſhoppers deuoure alldeuouring graſhoppers locuſts chriſtian region might worke ſecret iniquitie laſt innocent fourth vntill iulius ſecond name haue bene permitted nouriſh maintaine obſcure truth falſe doctrine lying myracles might ſeduce deceiue euen elect god poſſible great dragon sathan angell bottomeleſſe pit king theſe locuſts ſay mendicant friar maſſing prieſthood called abaddon ſignified much deſtroyer ſaccager exterminator rooter theſe infernall doctrine pope decree lombardike ſentences ordinarie queſtions determination quodlibet ſummes monaſticall predication ſuch bables haue drawne hell infinite number people ſince ſaid innocent fourthapoc 9 li 8 ſpace 260 yeares thoſe pope doctor ſignified pale horſe vpon ſat death well body ſoule followed hell moreouer theſe pope wicked perſons vſing inſatiable tirannie leeſe deſtroy euery day body true martyr truth god fire ſword water halter maner puniſhments becauſe would renounce ieſus chriſt obey theyr prince abaddon waining popedomebut hence forward ſince yeare lord 1503 vnder iulius ſecond ſucceſſors vntill laſt iudgement papacie dooth like decay power diuell hath deceiue antichriſt diminiſhed day day ſhall decay power hee hath exerciſe crueltie againſt elect god token pope fallthere haue bene many ſignes ruine fall popiſh kingdome time iulius iohn 24 maruellouſly troubled moleſted owle afore ſaid way constance fell charriot ignominiouſly depoſed concluded generall councell power ouer pope therefore time alſo paul ſecond affaire papacie haue gone ill haue alwaies paſt worſe worſe vnder gouernment alexander ſixt angell placed dungeon caſtle angelo ſtricken downe fearfull thunder fell tiber apoc 19 20 hardly perſon knoweth miſchiefes haue hapned ſince iulius ſecond vntill preſent according ſentence paul ieſus chriſt ſhal ſhortly deſtroy wicked antichriſt brightneſſe comming ſhall put aliue ſaith angell ſpeaking iohn poole burning fire brimſtone ſhall tormented euer iulius ſecond name borne gene nephew sixtus fourth bene named iulian reuerins title peter ad vincula choſen pope hee man quicke ſpirit ſubtill chiefly borne warre phillip willing againe paſſe spaine seatempeſt caſt vpon england well receiued king henry ſeuenth yet payed welcome redeemed departure deliuering ſaid king duke southfolke houſe white roſe thought nigheſt heiremale crowne england ſaid phillip bene taken guelders whither fled feare king henry iulius plucked away force excommunication many thing certaine chriſtian prince ſpace ſeuen yeares cauſe death infinite perſons yea tyrant becauſe victory obtained wherein hee reioyced hee ſhead ſo much humane bloud gaue vnto swiſſes title defender eccleſiaſticall libertiethe swiſſes honoured pope certaine number enſignes warre priuiledges cōfirmed bull golden ſword hatte ſtraightly beſieged rauenna rauenna occupied pope venetian occupied end hauing taken reduced obedience litle brauerie plucked hand certaine prince setina imola faience boulongne townes done without great effuſion bloud philibert eight duke sauoy ſucceeded father phillip yeare 1495 magnanimous vertuous prince full great beautie ſo much called philibert faire amiable alſo courteous euery one eſpowſed margarite emperor maximilians daughter hee done many thing worthy memorie died without leauing heire iſſuing wherfore charles brother ſucceeded ſaid duchie margarite witneſſe loue ſhe bare would neuer manie againe alwaies remained widow phillip returned spaine died yeare 1506 age 28 king lewis ſent phillip de rauestone gouernor gene towne reuolted yeare 1507 incontinently taken againe french iacobins friar bernethe yeare 1509 great contention betwixt two order begging friar ſay friar iacobins becauſe conception virgin mary cordeliers friar ſaid ſhe preuented grace holy ſpirit ſo ſhe nothing ſpotted originall ſinne iacobins affirmed contrary ſhe conceiued manner child adam priuiledge conceiued without ſinne onely reſerued ieſus chriſt yet ſaide holy virgin mother ſonne god ſanctified mother wombe purged originall ſpot iohn baptist ieremie certaine others eſpeciall priuiledge ſanctified came mother wombes ſaid iacobins made themſelues ſtrong prooue opinion reaſons holy ſcripture alſo enterpriſed make publike diſputations heidelberge touching conception virgin mary nothing executed afterward ſaid iacobins began prooue opinion euen people certaine falſe myracles viſions themſelues inuented theſe bad people deceiued lie turned owne head lay friar ſimple ideot enterpriſed ſeduce deceiue inchauntments ende reuealed knauery foure bretheren order taken berne vnto whō torture deliuered confeſſed matter diſgraded finally burnt fraudulent diabolicall machination forged maintaine opinion inchaunted ſuperſtitious charmes poore nouice great inſtance bernois haimo biſhop lanſanna dioceſſe berne tooke knowledge cauſe inquiſition made therof brought point diſgraded deliuered vnto ſecular arme burnt laſt day may meade nigh riuer ſide ar culpable deed eſcaped hand bernois king frederic naples cardinall de amboſe died time happened great malladie ſickneſſe france called coqueluehe pope iulius excommunicated king france iohn alebret king nauarre gaue kingdomes whomſoeuer could firſt occupie maſſeus 20 chapter chronicle reciteth king france perceiuing pope iulius venetian went ſomething againſt aſſembled councell towne tour moneth septemberif lawfull pope make warre propoſed queſtions following namely whether lawfull pope make warre againſt prince without cauſe reaſon ſuch prince defending himſelfe may aſſaile ſaid pope withdraw obedience anſwered lawfull pope ſo lawfull prince whereof enquired moreouer agreed pragmatike ſanctiō ſhould kept realme france pragmatike ſanction hee thundred excommunicatiōs ſhould make account becauſe ſhould vniuſt theſe thing king ſent iulius anſwere councell requiring either agree peace ſome place appoint generall councell diſpute ſaid queſtions large councell laterance begunne iulius thisthe councel laterane yeare 1512 leo ſucceſſor continued ſaid councell ende whereof 16 march 1517 horrible monſter died yeare following begun ſaid councell yeare 1513 hauing committed infinit number murder wickedneſſes vnheard died yeare 1513 21 februarie councell aſſembled rome ended battaile rauenna tooke towne againſt pope spaniard venetian gaston died aduauncing himſelfe ſmall company vpon enemy iulius practiſed emperour king england aſſaile king fraunce diuers place kingdome ferdinand king spaine tooke occupied againſt right vnder colour excommunication arrathame iulius kingdome nauarre king england beeing aſſured ſuccours flaunders diſcended calais king scotland iames fourth king france allie entered countrey loſt great battaile himſelfe ſlaine litle guien normandie whether ſent two army afterward french fought vpon sea two faire ship well furniſhed regent england cordelier france grapled one moſt part ſuch within either burnt drowned peace publiſhed betwixt king venetian engliſh men beſieged terwine iourney sporrs french fared ill townes terwine tornay taken engliſh anne de britaine wife king lewis 12 widowe charles eight dyed time leauing two daughter claudia afterward eſpowſed francis de ʋalois renee preſent widowe duke ferrara leo tenth name borne florence leo 10 houſe medices called iohn de medices cardinall title mary dominica beyond men expectation elected pope ſucceeded iulius hee beene diligently inſtructed good letter firſt youth learned ſchoolemaiſters amongſt others angelus politian man learned well greeke latin tongue cauſe loued ſo much men learning knowledge age thirteene yeares hee choſen cardinall innocent 8 30 age choſen pope rome leo owne nature debonaire gentle peaceable much gouerned ſuch enemy reſt cruell whoſe will many thing done diſloyally king lewis died firſt day ianuarie 1514 hauing raigned 17 yeares called father people title fewe king greateſt pleaſure pope leo delicately nouriſh himſelfe thing pleaſant fleſh ſuch delight would ſooneſt drawe men wicked concupiſcences tooke great pleaſures singer muſitians recreate ſpirit table hee dranke made good cheare hee bare irreconciliable hatred vnto goſpell kingdome god perſecured perſon luther many others one day cardinall bembo vttered certaine thing drawne goſpello execrable blaſphemie anſwered mocking hath euer ſufficiently bene knowne profit fable ieſus hath brought v company marchant gaue hereby ſufficiently knowne antichriſt paul called man ſinne ſonne perdition indulgenceshe ſpread abroad world certaine pardon indulgence full impietie yea ridiculous end heape vp ſiluer maintaine pleaſures nouriſh whore enrich baſtards heerein ſerued horrible ſignes wonder yeare 1521 time soliman emperor turkes tooke rhodes rhodes takē day chriſts natiuitie leo went chamber goe ſing maſſe breake day maner marble couer well couched laid fell ſaid doo earth c wanted one farthing leſſe ſaid tenne ſoules ſaid could profit nothing like marchandiſe diſpleaſed many good men began debate queſtion touching pope power whereof old biſhops neuer thundred great proceſſe againſt martin luther condemned heretike reiected communion faithfull ſtraight appealed vnto councell come leo commaunded bookes ſhould burnt rome ſide luther burnt wittemberge canon popiſh decretalls ſaying haue done ſo haue done thus farre maſſeus reſt hiſtorie may ſee sleidon baptista mantuanus exhorted ſaid leo doo office thus ſpeaking vnto fourth booke de fastis yet remaineth many thing thee doo great importance holy father great waightie thou muſt enterpriſe great courage amongſt others moſt worthy wherin thou ſhouldeſt employ thy ſelfe trauell therein firſt warre wherewith italie alreadie tyred field thereof bedeawed humane bloud romane court infected daungerous poiſon ſpreadeth ſelfe ouer nation laſtly faith oppreſſed ſides offered pillage vnto cruell barbarous nation theſe thing cry thee demaund ſuccours thee helpe commonwealth chriſt ſtaggereth faith ſick alreadie nigh death leo hauing gathered great ſumme ſiluer pardon ſold inriched parent banker liſted vp great dignity martin luther great theologian began preach true pure doctrine againſt hypocriſie papiſts thence forward popedome ceaſed litle litle fall ruine francis de ʋalois duke de angouleſme nigheſt meeteſt ſucceed crowne king 57 yeares death lewis 12 whoſe eldeſt daughter called claudia married selim hauing driuen away poyſoned olde father becauſe liued long emperor turkes grace force almaines nature hautie glorious hauing ſo great dominion victory hee pretended empire rome weſt appertained vnto ſaid true ſucceſſour conſtantine tranſported empire rome vnto conſtantinople ordinary reuenew ſixe million skutes ſome ſay ſeuen yeare whenſoeuer pleaſeth make warre gaineth thereby leeſeth becauſe great ſtore ſiluer taketh ſubiects hath treaſure precious ſtones aprill came againe 26 ſaid moneth ferdinand emperours yonger brother prince auſtrich tooke wife anne onely daughter ʋladiſlaus king hungarie boheme ſiſter lewis laſt king line hungarie luther appoſed noruege snede maximilian feare great tyrannie ill gouernment might fall ſome daughter perſon yeare fled zeland child wife iſabel emperours ſiſter brought vnto great neceſſitie may learne ſuch example feare god iudgements hee chastiſeth country king inſtruction charles duke bourbon conſtable france willingly departed partly drawne emperor faire promiſes turned himſelfe againſt french king great misfortune owne perſon france bookes phiſitian magician burnt rome ſome brought vnto adrian whereof hee made great account death founde amongſt ſecret paper ſome thought came popedome euil art paralip chron abb vrſp pope adrian like others perſecuted truth goſpell perſon luther oecolampadius died death ſuſpected poiſon september ſecond yeare popedome clement pope ſeueth name florentineclement 7 sect knight iohn ieruſalem prior de cappes ſucceeded adrian called iulius admoniſhed familiar cardinalls tooke name clement functius write nephew others ſonne leo others baſtard brother houſe medices zuric diſputation three dayes whether maſſe idolls ſhould aboliſhed 20 ianuarie following iourney swiſſes held lucerne zuric hated swiſſes wholy cōfirmed pope doctrine condemned goſpell swiſſes common complained zuric bourbon beſieged marceill vaine whence hee retired italie purſued french king tooke millaine winter beſieged pauie vppon teſin charles 5 anthonie duke lorraine ſharpely perſecuted ſuch bare fauour luther doctrine ende yeare certaine countreymen peaſants snabe beganne riſe rebell againſt count de loupae lord example neighbour like vnder colour certaine charge wherewith complained burdened ſtirre verie pernitious brought great trouble effuſion blood iourney pauiea battaile giuen pauie betwixt charles de lauoy gentleman country hainaut emperours lieutenant french king wherein ſaid king taken combat thence carried ſea spaine diuiſion betwixt luther zuinglius zuinglius agreed luther article supper ſaid word ieſus chriſt figure ſuch found infinit place ſcripture like luther denieth ſaith bodie ieſus chriſt within bread wine entreth mouth saxon follow luther swiſſes zuinglius long time hath sathan darke cloudes obſcured doctrine supper contention debate hee alſo ſeeketh take away men true taſte thereof ſedition peaſants remained almaine ſpred ſelfe alſo lorraine nigh sauernes duke anthonie accompanied brother claude de guiſe ſome french troupe iourney pauie fought ſlew great number keeping promiſed faith vnto sorboniſt doctor paris whileſt king draue france iames faber deſtaples partly vpon enuie partly vpon ſuſpition religion king aduertiſed hereof made cauſe ſtaied vntill returne frederic duke saxonie dyed iohn brother ſucceſſor caroloſtadius writ againſt luther vnto hee anſwered large pope clement whileſt king priſoner writ letter vnto parliament paris greeuouſly perſecute lutheran touching ſeditions peaſants multiplied diuers place see hiſtorie sleidan luther taketh nunne wife whereby receiueth many reproach aduerſaries hand ianuary peace made madril spaine betwixt king emperour vpon condition aboue bandie himſelfe againſt turke hereſie luther king ſeene two child hoſtages returned france emperour eſpowſed spaine iſabel daughter emanuel ſiſter iohn king portugall turke departed belgrade hauing paſſed danubie sauo hee drew ſtrait hungarie bad battaile vnto king lewis died fight wife mary emperours ſiſter ſaued ſelfe ſwift running iohn sepuſe vaiuoda de tranſiluania wartes betweene vaivoda ferdinand allyed turke againſt ferdinand appointed king hungaria vaſſall tenant whileſt debated right dint ſword fell damageable warre neighbour francis king fraunce returned spaine allyed himſelfe pope venetian defend italie ſea land againſt emperour recouer kingdome naples publiſhed writing whereby ſhewed reaſons emperour cauſed publiſhed contrary swiſſe infected anabaptiſts saint gaull one sect father mother others parent cut brother head ſaying hee beene ſo commaunded god reuelation ioachim ʋadian learned man conſull ſaid towne iuſtices incontinently cauſed head ſaid paracide anabaptiſt cut berne made knowne next biſhops diſputations touching reformation religion publiſh article taking rome bourbon willing paſſe emperour kingdome naples tooke way towards rome got aſſault bourbon ſtrooken bullet ſcaled wall left life towne pilled ſixt day may clement beſieged long time cardinalls caſtle saint angelo finally ſeuenth moneth hee deliuered raunſome 40000 ducat ſome birth phillip emperours ſonne yeare 1527 king france hauing made league king england ſent italie lord de landrece ſuccor pope tooke alexandria pauie ſeuenth ianuary berne held diſputation wherein zuinglius oecolampartius bucer capito blanrer holy ſcriptures ſurmounted vanquiſhed ſuch aduerſe partie finally confirmed authoritie magiſtrate theyr land ſaid article aboliſhed maſſe threw downe image aultars king england france demaunded emperour many thing heraulds king fraunce child offering ſiluer england firſt three hundred thouſand skutes borrowing fiue hundred thouſand intereſt becauſe accord made betwixt yeare 1522 bene violated broken finally three yeares penſion paction betwixt emperour bound pay ſay 133000 skutes yeare hee refuſed heraulds denounce warre strasbourge pope aduiſe euery man aſſembled tribe maſſe laide downe vntill papiſts ſhould ſhew holy ſcripture ſeruice agreeable vnto god may lie downe long enough contrary wholy oppoſite vnto supper ieſus chriſt sedition baſil betwixt burgeſſes certaine senator cauſe religion burgeſſes hauing taken armes caſt downe image temple cauſe senate agreed demaunded yea twelue senator fauoured papiſtrie ſhould deiected senate thenceforth queſtion fell ordain thing concerning common wealth councell 200 ſhould called therevnto haue aduiſe therin maſſe aboliſhed seignorie image publikely burned inſtruments idolatry vpon wedneſday papiſt call aſhwedneſday idolls burnt baſil lantrec dead andrew danre genoua reuolted french king began hearken vnto peace margarite emperours aunt loyſe king mother aſſembled cambray peace cambray dealt peace moneth auguſt ſort emperour left king bourgongne engendred male childe ſiſter king gaue deliuerance child emperour twentie hundred thouſand skutes debt england comprehended therein article againe added extirpate lutheran emperor returning gene arriuing auſbourge denounced vnto proteſtants ſhould let preaching ceaſe goe maſſe refuſed one ſhewing reaſon conſtraine vnleſſe cauſe debated 24 february ſwornethe emperours coronation namely ſhould life defend honour dignitie romane ſeate great pompe magnificence crowned emperour boulogne ellenor emperours ſiſter king ſpowſe came spaine france king two child frauncis henry bene foure yeares hoſtage father place pope clement emperor beſieged florentine becauſe ſet towne ſuch houſe medices ende ferrand de gonzague brought compoſition receiued prince alexander de medices vnto emperour promiſed baſtard daughter margarite time tiber rome ouerflowed bankes winde ſo beat back ſurges waues therof whole towne greatly terrified therewith deluge watersthe like greeuous tempeſt came alſo holland country adioyning ſea hauing burſt bank leuies tooke away met withall length flat country ferdinand emperours yonger brother fift ianuary cullen proclaimed king romanes eleuenth aprill following crowned aix notwithſtanding duke saxonie proteſted ſonne would agree vnto turke returned ſecond time againſt towne vienna auſtrich emperour ferdinand went againſt battaile forced retire eleuenth october zuinglius age fortie foure yeares younger luther foure yeares ſlaine battaile petit canton againſt zuric ende nouember oecolampadius age 49 yeares paſſed alſo life towne baſil mary widowe lewis king hungarie appointed emperour brother gouernment lowe country place margarite aunte lately deceaſed comete appeared almoſt whole moneth auguſt loyſe mother king fraunce ſiſter charles duke sauoy dyed yeare warre recommenced betwixt swiſſes namely zuric fiue canton end peace concluded towne munſter receiue goſpell christierne king denmarke baniſhed countrey ſpace tenne yearesthe king denmarke impriſoned hoping recouer kingdome taken ſea laid priſon ſonne emperour vncle entertained dyed age able imployed warlike affaire soliman emperour turkes came great armie belgrade thence drawing left hand beſieged towne caſtle giunte nicholas iurixe within made leaue ſiege iohn de leiden cutler hollander ſecretly harman staprede miniſter rotmans companion publikely beganne diſpearſe towne munſter ſeede anabaptiſme rotman reſiſted beginning cauſed senate driuen towne declared himſelfe anabaptiſt diſputation appointed towne houſe see hiſtorie anabap munſter would tremble ſuch iudgement god ſee ſuch lately profeſſed gospell lord fall ſo great wickednes george prince saxonie crueltie george duke saxonie goſpell baniſhed three ſcore ten bourgeſſes towne lipſic becauſe would communicate sacrament supper vnleſſe vnder kindes bread wine pope clement ſignified councell vnto duke saxonie ſhould plaiſance elſe boulongne mantua imperiall townes duke ſent embaſſadors towards proteſtants laſt iune anſwered writing woulde haue councell free wel couſin seignories country vpon condition within three yeares redeemed ſhould remaine hereditarie vnto kingdome france henry king england hauing put away daughter ferdinand king spaine ſaid henry brother wife tooke anne bullen wherevpon pope commaunded take againe ſaid katherine see sleidan pope clement counſell curtius phiſitianthe death pope clemēt hauing chaunged regiment maner liuing age others thinke poyſoned moneth nouember paris many placarts fixed vnto poſtes diuers place againſt maſſe article popiſh religion wherevpon exerciſed great crueltie horrible butchery againſt ſuch called lutheran paul 3 paul pope third name auncient man choſen 11 october created pope rome crowned third nouember raigned 15 yeares whereof handle hereafter moneth ianuary king france came paris bloodie proceſſion ordeined generall proceſſion idoll saint geneuiefue carried great pompe alſo made hee oration people againſt lutheran called ſolemne sacrifice appeaſe god anger hee cauſed ſixe poore chriſtians burned confeſſed name god ſundrie place towne cauſe hee ill beloued almaine moneth aprill emperour embarking barcelonne went affricke tooke towne thunis fort golete thunis golete hee made tributarie king muleaſſe barbaroſſe turkes lieutenant occupied kingdom eſcaped aſſembled certaine number veſſels argell emperour retired sicilie moneth iuly king england beheaded iohn fiſher biſhop rocheſter thomas moore chauncellor becauſe would agree edict ſtatute made aboliſhment pope authoritie challenged head engliſh church fiſher whileſt priſoner choſen cardinall nothing amended cauſe king ende moneth october francis sforce prince millaine deceaſed without heires ſixt december proteſtants aſſembled smalcalde guillaume de bellay lord de langeny embaſſador king fraunce came thither 19 december excuſed king execution hee made lutheran ſaying ſeditious people held farre religion proteſtants moreouer thought good hee great deſire ſend theologian learned men amaigne elſe woulde might ſende theyr learned diuines fraunce communicate together certaine point religion senate auſpurge receiued doctrine goſpell 24 iuly town munster beſieged might taken count dobersten captaine armie biſhop end moneth ianuary iohn de leiden head anabaptiſts coipperdolin chrechring companion tyed poſtes ſlaine munster head alone confeſſing fault ſomething repenting henry king england wife anne bullen faire daughter called elizabeth emperour entred prouence armie wanting victualls campe conſtrained retyre gene great number ſouldiers dyed amongſt others lieutenant anthonie de leue francis king france eldeſt ſonne dyed tournon vpon roſne age 18 yeares sebaſtian de moncucul italian drawne 4 horſes giuing poyſon ſaid perone beſieged henry count de naſſau adrian derouy count de reux aroſe great ſedition england againſt king bee plucked downe baniſhed pope authoritie emperour sea returned gene ouer spaine alexander de medices duke florence ſlaine lawrence kinſman promiſing enioying
