mortes languedoc entertained one charles egmond duke de gueldres deceaſed olde william duke cleues poſſeſſed countrey well dead man nobilitie countrey castelubro towne illyrica gulfe ambracia taken turke emperour venetian allied together touching pope paul amongſt great number act recite litle following world may know great ſanctitie papiſts maintaine voyce peter ſuccors vicar ieſus chriſt paul aſtrologian magician diuine amongſt moſt familiar one called denis seuila magician therefore afterward hee made cardinall one named gaurice portugall cecius marcell negromancians wicked villaines theſe hee enquire fortune himſelfe baſtards got red hatte maner hee ſiſter called iulia farneſe hee deliuered pope alexander hee might cardinall biſhop hostia finde meanes pay debt thoſe good pope commonly ſo inflamed whoredome make difficultie promiſe redde hat biſhopprickes ſuch bring ſiſters elſe horrible young bretheren violate many ſuch practiſes obtaine great rich fatte benifices agrippa ſaith ſhorter way come therevnto murderer poyſoned mother nephewe end ſucceſſion farneſes might fall vpon moreouer ſeeing ſiſters whoſe carnall company ſometime followed openly maners condition houſe farneſe ſhee loued company others hee poyſoned alſo beeing legate marke dancone time iulius ſecond hee moſt wickedly abuſed maide iſſued noble houſe towne hee counterfeited diſguiſed himſelfe feigning bee one gentleman legate houſe ſo vnder colour promiſe marrie deflowred ſhee knew truth hee ſhee legitimate wife whore leaſt canon lawe ſhee became almoſt wittes marriage came great porteenſeigne captaine buggerers sodomite peter lewis one nicholas de cheſme found one day adulterouſly abuſing wife laurea farneſe ſaide paul neece hee wounded ſo well dagger hee carried marke thereof life hee ſlewe poyſon boſuis sforza husband daughter constance hee often vſed whore ende hee might eaſe greater libertie enioy dotard tyrannouſly oppreſſed peruſe droue seignorie aſcanius columne iuſt prince deteſtable robber rouer tooke vſurped himſelfe towne camer hee driuen away lady thereof woman endowed rare ſingular religion prudence ſo much practiſes cardinalls hee exchaunged ſaid citie camer owne townes parme plaiſance end make ſonne lewis lord maiſter act afterward iuſt iudgement god cauſe death ſaid peter lewis often conſulted cardinalls hee might hinder nationall councell almaine commaunded embaſſadors ſhould enflame heart prince againſt king england anne de cleues ſiſter william duke cleues accorded marriage king england moneth maya comete appeared ayre comete almoſt ſame day deceaſed elizabeth emperours wife auguſt caſtelnouo illirica taken againe vpon emperor barbaroſſe great turkes lieftenantcaſtelnouo almoſt garriſon spaniard ſlaine citizen gaunt roſe vp againſt mary regent lowe contries emperour cauſe needfull haſte flaunders paſſed france spaine great receiuing entertainment king ſubiects emperor king ſent embaſſadors venetian ioyne making warre vpon turke without thing beeing mooued embaſſage incontinently ſent towards turke make peace ſay behinde counſelled herevnto french embaſſador gaunt puniſhed emperour many beheaded otherwiſe puniſhed taken liberty cauſed ſtrong forte builded bridle french king ſeeing himſelfe hope recouer millaine began contract duke cleues cōcerning marriage betwixt princeſſe nauarre vaiuoda iohn de ʋainoda king hungarie died leauing little child called stephen borne elizabeth daughter sigiſmond king polonia chabot phillip chabot admirall france condemned melnue vpon treaſon ſeuen hundreth thouſand scute fine baniſhed wood vincenne litle hee againe reſtored vnto good eſtates iouney remsbourgthe diſputation remsbourge began aprill betwixt proteſtants called catholickes phillip melancton bucer piſtorius theologian proteſtants ſide againſt eccius iulles pffug iohn gropper ſeed warre caeſar fregoſa antonie rincon french king ſent embaſſadors turke paſſed pan drawe towards venice taken imperialiſts put death marqueſſe alphonſus daual emperours lieftenant lombardie accuſed murder lord de langeay king diſpatcheth embaſſadors iourney reiusbourge complaine wicked act hee ſtayed lyon george dauſtriche baſtard ſonne emperour maximilian archbiſhop ʋalence paſſed fraunce spaine vnto emperour lowe country francis ſonne anthonie duke lorraine eſpowſed christierne widowe daughter christierne king denmarke diſpleaſed king france ferdinand beſieged bude towne hungarie queene dowairie ſhut vp litle ſonnebude falles turke turkes comming downe great number moneth iuly glad leaue ſiege turkes arriuing litle tooke towne pest diſcomfited great part ferdinand people whether ſaid dowairie would forced appropriate bude vnto vnder colour ſhee could defend againſt ferdinand litle king mother baniſhed tranſiluania emperour came lupues ſpeake popethe iourney argiere hinder turke ſide withdraw hungarie hee embarked himſelfe armie porte de venere paſſing iles corſeigne maior que minor que made ſaile argiere tooke land third october aroſe great horrible tempeſt ſea ſcattered diſpearſed great number ſayles ſo hauing loſt good part artillery almoſt furniture warre conſtrained retire spaine french vnderſtood loſſe tooke occaſion mooue warre principall lord auſtriche euen number 24 tenne city preſented requeſt vnto king ferdinand third december prague end according decree laſt iourney reiusbourge might reforme church ferdinand anſwered decree onely appertained vnto proteſtants therfore commaunded attend iſſue generall nationall councell almaine promiſed emperour ſaid reiusbourge beginning councell trent paul pope publiſhed councell trent firſt day nouember edict extreame rigour publiſhed paris againſt ſuch called lutheran namelyperſecution againſt faithfull bring vnto certaine deputed theologian ſuch thing ſpotted therewith stationer bookebinders ſhould bring within certaine time ſuſpected bookes prieſts alſo ſet downe certaine forme interrogating ſuch came confeſſion knew lutheran generall proceſſion made geneuiefue pariſians goddeſſe trotted ſtreetes great pompe french king ſent lord de longueuil duke cleues martin de roſſem leauie people attend occaſion begin enterpriſe moneth iuly following warre denounced emperour longueuil roſſem pilled ſpoiled brabant countrey wanted powder furniture artillery rochellthey rochel xantoinge mutined againſt king garriſon placed againſt cuſtome extreame tollages gernac ſent thither king whileſt king goeth vnto parpignan guillame poyet chauncellor fraunce iuſtice apprehended night time bed lead priſon foreſeeing tempeſt made himſelfe prieſt litle ſhun puniſhments knew due deſerts papall prieſthood ſerueth good cloake couer maner infection scot beginning december fought vnluckily againſt engliſh cauſe warre becauſe king scotland came yorke promiſed end controuerſie together limit country emperour made crowne ſonne phillip king spaine gaue marriage marie daughter iohn king pontugall sigiſmond ſonne sigiſmond king pologne tooke marriage elizabeth daughter ferdinand king romanes clement marot retiring geneua ſet french verſes 20 pſalmes dauid publiſhed 30 paris wherevpon perſecuted sorboniſts landrecythe emperor henry england ioyned themſelues make warre vpon french king tooke landrecy fortified itnice hauen towne nice taken caſtle beſieged prince anguien barbaroſſa conducted captaine poidin taken land armie sea tolon duke cleues chaſtiſed emperor forſooke alliance france princeſſe nauarre way againſt cardinall de ballay conduction vnto cleues ſtopped great ioy marriage broken trouble scotland ſuch demanded young queene might accorded vnto edward ſonne king henry king france ſo much pacified nobilitie drawe vnto himſelfe alliance ʋauldois people prouence put ſpoyle goſpellvauldois wherefore hiſtorie faithfully deſcribed large booke martyr haue ſet forth iourney carignan piemont nigh ciriſolles 〈…〉 ca •• g •• n emperialiſts vnder conduction alphonſus dauall diſcomfited prince anguien emperour taketh againe luxembourge compoſition taketh ligni caſtle dedier dedier rene prince aurange ſtricken bullet died great griefe emperour anthonie duke lorraine died ſo much agelorraine griefe ſee warre ſo nigh yea euen countrey francis ſonne ſucceeded married emperours neece king england laid ſiege bologne bologne end tooke compoſition emperor incamped vpon riuer marne count guillam de furstemberge taken certaine french horſmen ſounded watch emperor soiſſon made peace king france 24 september moneth march lewis palatin elector deceaſed frederic brother ſucceſſor henry de brunſwic ſworne enemie vertue making account marie ſiſter ʋlrich prince wittemberge wife giuing himſelfe whore one wiues damzells whome hee ſeuen child accuſed proteſtants full audience eſtates fift aprill end thing ſhould ſecret cauſed made image like whore certane apoſtate woman done cauſed bee buried great pompe magnificence made prieſts thereabouts ſay maſſes vigills seruice accuſtomed done papiſts buriall dead nothing anſwere remained confounded king france cauſed fort built vpon ſea banke nigh bullen hinder victualling towne holding armie thereabouts charles duke orleance king france ſonne ſhould haue bene ſonne lawe alliance emperour ninth day september beeing age 23 yeares taken away malladie held fewe dayes guillam de fuſtemberge priſoner paris payed beſt wholy followe lately cauſed diſputed paris theologian louaine writ 32 article ſame ſubiect paris peter bridly miniſter church straungers strasbourge ſecretly called vnto tornay ſuch deſirous truth oppreſſe miniſters word place ſeeing would yeare 1546 vnder colour ayre corrupted tranſported himſelf vnto boulongne end meane hee might better take away libertie chriſtians ſay opinion hinder reformation church antichriſt raiſed horrible ſtraunge warres againſt ſeruants god purſuing fire ſword impriſonments ſorts puniſhments yea ſpared cardinalls namely fulger contarien taſted ſauour word god biſhop pontus iohn baptiſt brother paulus vergerius biſhop iuſtinopoli chiefe amongſt tormentor nephewes cardinall farneſe octaua duke parma brother beyond meaſure glorying therein yeare lord ieſus chriſt 1546 vpon departure frō italie almaine make warre vpon proteſtants vaunted brauely fiercely would make ſuch effuſion lutheran bloud horſes ſhould ſwim therin meane good holy father paul tooke pleaſure daughter constance old maner ſay alſo old man ſtinking goate ſollicited whoredome niece honeſt maide leſſe laudable honeſtie chaſtitie excellent beautie pope baleus ſaitha number whore ſiluer promiſed satterday 7 auguſt yeare 1546 towne maligues ſuch ſort handled thunder lightning long time bene ſeene like thunderbolt fell vpon tower called saderpoort ſay gate canon powder 800 barels gunpowder flame augmented tempeſt firſt laid earth ſo embraced towne without abundance raine mingled thunder thought ſhould haue bene conſumed fire next morning sunday found ſo many dead body ſtinking haſt neceſſitie great ditch made burie cartfulls wounded found hundreth fiftie woman great child found ſtiffled opened childe receiued baptiſme damzel caſting ſelfe bed open windowe ſtreete called blochſtranſſem tempeſt ſo cut necke head hung remaining skinne ſad horrible ſpectacle corner ſtreet pallace bernard tauerner called croes beeing diſcended seller drawe beere ghueſts one company playing cardes houſe moment throwne earth gameſters ouerwhelmed wth cardes hand none houſe remained ſafe hoſt meanes vaulted caue seller diſcended three foure dayes accident many found caues seller dead hunger others ſtiffled others lay traunſes ſwounds feare incredible ſtench thunder man woman found carried away hanged betwixt braunches tree towne adorned exquiſite building altogether thereabouts remained whole found many hewen ſtones throwne tempeſt ſixe hundreth pace great damage place fell glaſſe windowes ſtreetes broken fall tyles cry perſons horrible fearefull thus lord ſometimes make men feele terrible fearfull power iune emperour ſent cardinall trent rome warre almaine conclude cōfederacie pope deliuered ſiluer captaines warre warre almaine ſide duke saxe lantgraue leuied people haſte emperor demanded cauſes warre anſwered onely meant againſt rebells culpable treaſon ſent embaſſadors swiſſes praying remaine ſtil auncient amity hee onely determined horſmen whoſe captaine octauius farneſe pope ſonne lawe count de bure leuied people lowe country paſſed phine moneth auguſt nigh mets september ioyned himſelfe emperour great troupe pope friend ioanuin aure cut peeces emperour laid cauſe vpon farneſes amongſt others vpon peter lewis duke plaiſance henry king england dyed end ianuariethe death henry 8 hauing inſtituted edward ſonne age nine venice iohn cuſe pope legate renounced truth goſpell hee knew fell diſpaire vehement great apprehenſion thereof got great malladie ſickneſſe wherein hee could way comforted whatſoeuer alleadged god promiſes mercie would ſtill anſwere nothing appertained vnto becauſe ſaid hee ſinned againſt holy ghoſt diſpaire finiſhed pitiouſly dayes great good example worthy earneſtly thought maximilian eldeſt day april goe england whither called thomas cranmer archbiſhop canterbury thus lord prouideth hath taken truth one place ſendeth doe worke king feſſe affricke feſſe affricke chaſed certaine zepziphe king neighbour low eſtate growne vnto greatneſſe implored helpe emperour auſpourge whilſt religion thus troubled almaine pope thought good make profit thereof therefore ſent legate almaine indult alliance king france whereof euery one greatly maruelled becauſe perſecuted religion fire blood zurie berne refuſed alliance sedition england partly chaunge religion partly common ground occupied gentleman priuate vſe great bloodſhead meane time king fraunce tooke certaine holdes bologne whereby put engliſh great diſtreſſe fault laid vpon duke somerſet therefore impriſoned london pope paul age cardinalls great number long time debated cōclaue ſay pope promiſed oath vnto ferneſes leaue parme octauius berneſe whileſt cardinalls conclaue chuſe pope iulius certaine letter came handes ſome written 26 ianuary houſhold ſeruant cardinall mantoue called cornelius oliue friend called hanniball contin certaine verſes made vulgar italian language wherein ſpeaking good affection towards deſire ſee vſeth ſo infamous diſhoneſt word hardly recite without ſhame bluſhing hereof came taunt ſuch ſaid ſignified ſome infamous diſhoneſt pope ſhould come conclaue whence ſuch proceeded read theſe letter ſaide well italie almaine neuer read villanous deteſtable hereby reader maiſt thou iudge ſpirit papiſts vaunt ſo much haue maſſes election pope 22 frebury iulius crowned pope cardinall cibo two day opened gilded gate golden key celebrated yeare iubile predeceſſor paul third ſo much deſire ſee becauſe auncient cuſtomethe pope litle cardinall new pope might giue red hat thought good made cardinall young boy called innocent ſometimes abuſed whē legate bologne notwithſtanding cardinalls approoued yea reſiſted moreouer hee receiued houſe number domeſtickes familiar brute went towne rome yea divulged certaine diffamitorie libells ganymede entertained iupiter although faire pope himſelfe diſſembled cuſtomably maner paſtime would account folly therein paulus vergerius hath left writing hiſtorie pope iulius ſaith hee determined make young youth called innocent cardinal came frō father mother baſe condition moſt wicked diſhoneſt conuerſation wherfore certain day made motiō preſence cardinalls man reſiſted certaine cardinalls ſaid freely pray finde young man deſerueth ſhould doo honour iulius anſwered pray found mee doo mee honour make mee pope without deſert aduance young man hee merit maſſe bin baniſhed strasbourge ſpace 21 yeares ſet vp againe three church firſt february great number child ran thither ſee ſo ſtraunge new thing prieſts affraied complained vnto emperour emperor king france one made publiſh country cruel edict againſt lutheran called ende may emperour phillip ſonne departed bruxelles iourney ausbourge come iourney auſpourge brought duke baxe captiue leauing lantgraue priſon malignes time pope iohn de caſe florentine archbiſhop beneuent legate ſeate territorie venice man made ſo magnificall profeſſion popiſh ſingleneſſe aſhamed make booke italian rime wherein praiſeth exalteth horrible deteſtable ſinne sodomitry yea euen name diuine worke affirmeth tooke great pleaſure therein knew kind palidiarzing whoredome booke imprinted venice one traian naun behold notable archbiſhops papall ſeate ſuch iudges doo pope maiſter diuel ſerue themſelues conſiſtories condemne heretikes ſuch teach write truth puritie catalogue bookes prohibited made whileſt legate comprehendeth therein ſuch make profeſſion pure euangelike doctrine francis spiera aboueſaid fearing tyrannie tormentor renied veritie ieſus chriſt dyed extreame diſpaire sleidan alſo make mention sodomitike booke aboue ſpoken would long rehearſe geſts deed iulius third concerning iubile time councell trent confirmation idol de laureto debate biſhop aremin steward peacock many ſuch like thing amongſt viand hee greatly delighted eate fleſh swine peacock phiſitian aduertiſed hee ſhould take heed eate ſwines fleſh becauſe contrary vnto gowt wherewith hee often tormented yet hee would abſtaine therefrom phiſitian ſecretly aduertiſed clarke kitchin porke fleſh ſhould ſerued none ſerued pope perceiuing demaunded steward diſh porke anſwered phiſitian appointed none ſhould ſerued cryed manner bring porke fleſh al di ſpetto di dio ſay deſpight god common ieaſt ordinarie amongſt rakehell raſcalls ruffian bawdes italie alſo many ſpeeches infamous diſhoneſt blasphemy vſed italie authoriſed pope word hauing one day ſeene peacocke dinner touched keepe ſaid cold peacocke ſupper ſpread table garden haue company ſat ſupper ſaw hot peacockes ſerued vpon table ſeeing colde peacocke hee commaunded kept exceedingly vexed diſgorged execrable blaſphemie againſt god certaine cardinal ſate table ſaid let holines ſo chollericke ſo ſmall matter wherevnto iulius anſwered god would bee ſo angry apple caſt firſt father adam paradice wherefore ſhould bee lawfull mee vicar angry peacocke ſeeing peacocke much valewe apple hee create cardinall peter betan biſhop fano order iacobins certaine cardinalls reſiſted amongſt thing alleadged infected hereſie lutheran vnto iulius anſwered although ſo ſhould wiſely done putting redde hat head purge euill ſo retaine one ſuch bond ſuffer flie v ioyne enemy haue almaine ʋergerius 10 september affrike towne affrike affrike taken taken emperours armie vnder conduction viceroy sicilie dracut lord towne withdrew towards turke maiſter warre began againe ſharpe betwixt emperour turke ſedition ausbourge becauſe certain spaniard moneth auguſt made mockes church sermon woman alſo ſaid towne mocked prieſt surplice walked towne hoſte emperour put wincheſter diſpoſſeſſed biſhopprick england put priſon becauſe would ſubmit himſelfe vnto king edict lawes touching religion bucerthe laſt february bucer dyed canterbury honourably buried great number epitaphes made learned men lamenting death councell trent deferred pope firſt may vntill firſt september wondersin saxonie diuers prodigious thing ſeene three sunnes three moones pale bleake blew red blood king france cauſed publiſhed cruell edict againſt lutheran confirming yea paſſing former edict left nothing behinde appertained extreame crueltie ſides papiſts aſſembled trent councell day likewiſe almaine reſorted elector eccleſiaſticall cardinall creſſentia preſident pope place emperour king ferdinand ſent thither alſo embaſſadors king france embaſſadour diſavowed councell generall reputing particular congregation profit ſome proteſtation held none without vouchſafing record le ſieur briſac tooke piedmont turin certaine number townes amongſt others cheri saint damian turk army hauing aſſayed fort malta ruſhed vpon tripoly affrické tooke emperour accuſed king fraunce bee authour loſſe edict publiſhed king paris whereby forbidden tranſport ſiluer kingdome rome becauſe warre betwixt king pope came writing emperor court whereby declared cauſe originall warre parma warre parma wherefore hee receiued plaiſance protection fact duke octauius condemned deteſted french contrary ſhewe alſo writing daunger wherein octauius parma iuſt cauſe king ſuccour wrongfully emperour taken towne plaiſance duke somerſet againe impriſoned october meanes duke northumberland vnto whome came gouernment realme eleuenth seſſion councell trent october confirmed locall preſence tranſubſtantiation euer inuented deification faire morſell bread george de martinuſe dalmatia monke tranſiluania commonly called monke man great authoritie hungarie made cardinal ſlaine 18 december houſe certaine italian vnder colour dealt turke ſuſpitiouſly although ſo wrought wife deceaſed vaiuoda ſhe gaue ouer gouernment tranſiluania king ferdinand nouember duke maurice agreed altogether magdebourge ende euils calamity entry great warre yea ill luck vnto emperour maurice hauing practiſed king prince ſtraungers determined himſelfe force deliuer lantgraue father lawe notwithſtanding hee deferred certaine time becauſe firſt thought good prooue loue duke somerſet vncle king edward beheaded london inſtance duke northumberland complaint almaine maurice writing dedicated vnto ſtates empire greatly complaineth diſcord religion amongſt item captiuitie lantgraue priſoner treaſon great diſhonour emperour albert brandebourge complaineth alſo miſerable ſeruitude almaine hauing expreſſed cauſes thereof declareth companion iudge eccleſiaſticall people chiefe authours aboueſaid euils maurice albert allyed ioyned themſelues together rotebourge ausbourge beſieged taken father councel trent diſcord imperialist againſt romaniſts vnderſtood prince marched right alpes gaine ſtraights incontinently left tooke feete take counſell ſhall diſſipated ſpeake word ſhall eſtabliſhed ſaith lord eſay 8 martin de roſſem conductor emperours armie lowe country pilleth burneth picardie campagne tooke aſtenay king henry france publiſhed writing cauſes ſaid voyage warre enterpriſed almaine namely withdraw prince priſon bridle emperours ambition remit countrey firſt libertiethe king himſelfe protector almaine ſendeth mets lorraine prouide victualls armie promiſed fauour amitie takē toul verdun townes empire hee drew right lorraine third may came sauernes strasbourge ſent victualls prince salerne ſome diſſention betweene viceroy naples withdrewe himſelfe emperours ſeruice turned directly vnto king france king henry armie entred lorraine conducted france prince country 10 aprill conſtable entred metz vnder colour amitie ſo laid hold towne king arriued certaine time conſtrained people take oath king comming againe france may burnt country luxembourge tooke againe aſtenay got alſo iouy danuil • iers sennois chaſed away garriſon spaniard helpe king france deſtroyed caſtle emperour built ſet themſelues libertie metz beſieged emperour 2 october albert agreeing king france eſtate company pay turned emperours ſide duke aumaile beeing come lorraine great company people aſſayling marqueſſe albert vanquiſhed wounded taken priſoner ſaid marqueſſe december emperor conſtrained euill weather remoue campe metz withdraw himſelfe lowe country third part armie dyed time great turke sultan solyman committed cruell act perſon soltan mustapha eldeſt ſonne solyman ſtrangleth mustapha eldeſt ſon slaue man hauing bene ſent mother firſt youth prouince amaſia bene giuen ſo well carefully nouriſhed acquired got yeares great eſtimation ſaid countrey father region mother beeing abſent solyman called slaue named roze endowed admirable beautie accompanied delicacy entiſements poſſibly woman foure ſonnes mahomet baiazeth solim grangier wenne one daughter married vnto baſſa rostan ſaid roze could ſo well play part soliman hee exceedingly rauiſhed helpe muchly high prieſt mahomet lawe vnder ſhadowe religion ſhee onely made free condition legitimate eſpowſed wife soliman vnto euer came beeing lifted vp ſuch honour ſeeing herſelfe entierly beloued fauoured ſhee greater care drawe empire vnto one child father deceaſe ſhee knowing ſingular vertues mustapha ſo contrary vnto long hee liued ſhee ſhould neuer haue reſt hee obtained loue people warre men eye vppon great hope excellent courage ſingular dexteritie therefore ſought ſhee make odious vnto soliman wherevnto ſonne lawe greatly aided becauſe gouerned affaire reaſon mustapha truſted ſo much loue fauour obtained men great liberalitie hardineſſe valiancie burnt ſuch luſt deſire raigne euery one feared affecting empire hee would aduance dayes soliman selim done father therefore ſhee incited soliman beſought teares lamentation take order prouide ſafetie although beginning ſhe profited little muſtapha diſcouered impoiſonments ambuſhes ſhe laid ordinarily yet left ſhe continue helpe iew renowmed enchantreſſe hauing giuen certaine drugges ſhee cauſed loue soliman towards roze redouble inſomuch ſhe aſſured ſelfe end purpoſes though long firſt finally many practiſes ſhe found meanes ſuborne mustapha gouernor cauſed write though falſly vnto soliman ſaid ſonne would marry daughter king perſia old man ſtirred yea tyred continuall complaint roze roſtan eaſily beleeued theſe newes aduertiſements wherfore yeare 1552 hee ſpred brute fame diſſent comming downe perſians siria ſent thither roſtan puiſſant armie vnder ſhadow goe meet enemy ſeaze vpon muſtapha bring priſoner conſtantinople expreſſe commaundement ſley hee could take otherwiſe mustapha aduertiſed knewe alſo perſians fielde met ſeuen thouſand moſt experienced souldiers made rostan returne without dooing thing soliman angred yeare following made ſuch brute perſians hauing leuied great army would haue gone againſt thē beeing arriued siria ſent ſon come camp mustapha knowing certainly alone would haue although praied ſollicited withdrawe ſome ſhunne furie father yet hee truſting innocencie thinking thing commendable worthie greatneſſe dye obeying father liuing incurre note infamie treaſon yea though hee might haue empire whole worlde thinking alſo without hauing made refuſall preſence hee might haue appeaſed father wrath aduentured goe thither beeing arriued solimans campe hee ſuddenly taken ſtrangled preſence ſame inſtant head baſſa prouince amaſia taken bodie crueltie aſſoone came eares grangier one foure brother hee manfully reiected gift ſpoyle father gaue greatly lamented death brother ſaying cruell traytorthe complaint grangier wen ouer muſtapha ſay father take thy ſelfe treaſures tapiſtries prouince mustapha gouerne thy pleaſure poſſible ſhould fall thy ſpirit infamous man without humanitie againſt right put death ſo valiant perſon neuer ſhalbe like houſe ottomās ha ha take good order thou ſhalt impudenly vaunt glory thou haſt done like ſtraight drew dagger ſtrooke ſo farre owne bodie fell downe dead vpon earth ſo ſoone father knew made maruellous mourning yet left ſeize vpon good cauſed tumult campe muſtapha nothing regard knew death ſuch ſort solyman great danger life conſtrained chaſe away rostan diſpoile honour dignity roſtan ſpoiled honour death came wel chriſtians whoſe great enemy muſtapha tooke great delight ſheading blood brought alſo ſuch great diſpleaſure vnto turkes therevpon followed amongſt prouerbe gietti soltan muſtaphat thought ended muſthapha thought would haue enlarged empire looked hand french tooke verceil countrey turin ſeeing could keepe ſpoyled pilled retyred edward 6 edward king england mortall bed moneth may northumberland cauſed one nouember yeare parliament england aſſembled preſence king phillip queene marie cardinall poole expounpounded legation exhorted holy ſeate pope ſhewing greatly bound god enlarged vpon diuine grace prouiding ſuch prince declared vnto holy father pope vſed towards benignitie clemency legate subtilties romane court deceit roman court greatly thanking receiued placed country nobilitie whereof bene long depriued therefore held himſelfe bound procure might reſtored eccleſiaſticall court deſire vile apoſtate truth calleth ſtinking court rome celeſtiall court thus ſpoken withdrew himſelfe end giue reſpet vnto lord parliamēt reſolue thervpon doo chauncellour england ſtraight tooke cardinalls wordes ſhewed cauſe thanke god raiſed vp ſuch prophet owne ſeed procure ſaluation reuerend legate inſomuch common accord concluded cōſent vnto vnion obedience romane church notable miſteriesthe thurſday following ordained agree vnto cardinall ſaide ſo vpon common accord preſented ſupplication wherein prayed king queenes maieſties head kingdome would pray pope legate might haue abſolute remiſſion ſinnes errours promiſing make voide ſuch lawes eſtabliſhed againſt authoritie romane ſeate whervnto would ſweare neuer contradict king ſent ſaid ſupplication legate day aſſembled parlament place king queene cardinall legate ſet chancelor roſe vp great reuerence high voice vttered reſolutiō principall poynts firſt religion reaſon whereof ſaid diſorder deſtruction almaine happened might remedied diſputations communication theologian beene begun ſecond helpe ſuccour afflicted eſtate warre ſecond name tuſcan nation called marcel ceruin ſucceeded borne place called monte pelicien territory florence cardinall title holy croſſe ieruſalem created pope common conſent cardinalls conclaue 9 day aprill 1555 day following receiued pontificall ornament church laterane would change name receiued baptiſme pope character enemie vnto truthbeing come vnto papacie enemie vnto goſpell pope may ſee euer youth ſome litle profited humane letter ſo kept ſchooles afterward paul third created cardinall alexander farneſius ſonne peter lewis baſtard ſonne hee gaue marcel schoolemaiſter certaine time cardinall alexander leauing ſtudie letter applyed himſelf altogether handle affaire wherein well alſo paul grandfather ſerued themſelues marcel secretary biſhoppricke nichastre vacant hee made biſhop church yet alwaies liued court rome neuer went church pope paul ſent legate aforeſaid cardinall farneſe towards emperour brother king ferdinand flaunders becauſe yet young gaue marcel conduction gouernor affaire legation amongſt thing queſtion ſetting army againſt turke emperor brother required inſtantly marcel ceruin puliſhed writing yet ſeene wherein ſaith much better make war vpon lutheran much worſe thē turkes pope paul made cardinal abſent marcel inquiſitor generall cauſed come againe towne vſed counſell thing great importance gaue tytle holy croſſe ieruſalem created generall inquiſitor againſt heretikes therein making companion vnto cardinall theatin cardinall de bourgues rudeſt cruelleſt euer legation ſent vnto councell trent pope paul made legate cardinalls pol de monte hee created cardinall de monte chiefe legate councel becauſe knowledge ciuil lawe pol poole ſecond ſeemed deſire church might reformed although appeared neuer ſtirred earneſt ceruin third hee pope moſt truſt therefore pope giuen expreſſe charge ſhuld ſuffer nothing done councell tended detriment romane ſeat ſhould driue ſuch enterpriſed ſuch like thing therfore one ſaid councel called iames nachiantes biſhop place called foſſa clodia ſaid could allow decree written tradition ought receiued obſerued like reuerence goſpell ceruin cauſed throwne councell alſo certaine iacobin called guillam de ʋenice ſaid councell conſtance aboue pope ceruin calling reprehended ſharply monke anſwered thing ſelfe yeelded witneſſe thereof becauſe councell depoſed pope therefore aboue ſo ſaid ceruin pope gaue place willingly well prooue bull ſealed leade ſtraight commaunded man goe councell time peter paul vergerius come mantua trent many time beene embaſſador almaine pope affaire becauſe men held ſuſpected ſome thing accord almaines although two legate namely pol de monte liked well conſent ſhould one councel alſo cardinall paciccus cardinall trent yet ceruin neuer ceaſed till ſaw deiected many biſhops vnderſtanding vergerius determined haue written vnto pope admoniſh ſuffer becauſe many would ſay councel freeierome vida cremona biſhops put backe hierome vida de cremona biſhop alba excellēt poet alreadie indighted letter well owne name others come vnto knowledge marcel ceruin hee ſeuerely aduertiſed vida wholy abſtaine ſending letter vnto pope thing euill example biſhops aſſembled councel ſhould write ſuch letter vnto pope though would impoſe lawe vpon hee ſaid ſo great fault man need take heed fall ſuſpition thereof vida vanquiſhed teaſons changed purpoſe ſending letter vnto pope vergerius willing withdrawe himſelfe councellthe cauſe wherefore vergerius put councel came towards ceruin demaunded article deiected councell company biſhops ceruin anſwered becauſe vnderſtand thou denieſt legend george chriſtopher true true ſaid ʋergerius haue doo yet denie opinion founded vpon pope paul third hath cōmanded thoſe legend ſhould taken breuiarie preface beginning booke ſaith hath commaunded ſuch ſhould taken true ceruin ſeeing himſelfe ſurpriſed could anſwere nothing men ought hold ſuch good men maner whatſoeuer ſeemed agree lutheran therefore wee withdrawe thee councell thought good recite ende might bee knowne alwaies ſome euill affected towards true doctrine ignorant holy letter ſtubborne maintaine defend ſuperſtitions yet man ſingular modeſtie life conuerſation reaſonable honeſt likewiſe endowed good prudence ſo great eſtimation ſo much verily looked hand euer hee came vnto popedome would correct many thing romane court thing would ſhunne diſſolutions ſuperfluities fell ſo death iulius third hauing bene choſen pope alreadie diſeaſed iaundies increasſed ſo vpon died 22 day election night firſt may brute ranne poiſoned ſo feawe dayes death would need crowned ſmall charge modeſtly cardinall farneſe part giuen voyce although bene great enmity betwixt hee becauſe hoped none would diligent bring end paul third determined doo namely ſhould beſt maintaine houſe farneſes end might bee depriued duchie parma plaiſance alſo cardinall farneſe ſo practiſed iulius third made promiſe hee would fauour comming vnto popedome ſaid hee willingly elect ſaid ceruin becauſe ſawe already ſore worne weakened diſeaſes ſo hope hee could liue long custome willingly chooſe pope ſuch hope liue long hercules de ferrare vbalde duke vrbin arriued rome ſalute pope marcel court theyr manner paul 4 name neapolitanepaul 4 called iohn peter caraphe choſen pope ſame yeare namely 1555 23 day may conſent cardinalls man ʋenice hypocriſie inuented new sect monkes called ieſuites sauiour ieſus ingendred ſuch popiſh idolater beeing made cardinall departed venice rome ſaid vnto monkes asked whither went whither go cannot come abuſing ſcripture prophaning lord word hee meant hereby left ſhut vp cloiſter pouertie miſerie went vnto rome come vnto high mightie eſtate dignitie wherevnto could come theatin hee pope confeſſed truthhe writ booke ſometimes vnto paul third touching reformation church become pope cared neither ieſus chriſt church booke confirmeth almoſt poynts vſe reprehend papiſts namely church ſo ruinated poperie church ieſus chriſt diuell ſaith pope heape vp doctor owne fancy deſires cardinalls biſhops cauſe name chriſt blaſphemed amongſt people vnder colour keyes gather great ſummes money wicked people prouided symoniacke marchandices greatly practiſed prelate burne ambition couetouſneſſe horrible ſinnes iniquity committed monaſteries towne rome full whoredomes many ſuch like enormious wicked thing committed rome theatin rehearſeth booke hee toucheth vice abuſes found common maner liuing without making mention contempt doctrine vſed tumult geneua thurſday 16 day may yeare hapned tumult geneua 10 clocke night conſpiracie ſome ſtirrers captaines certaine petit councell towne able beare ſo happie proſperitie goſpell determined chaſe away ſuch towne come france ſhun perſecutions night time ranne fro cryed falſe enſigne token french armes towne betrayed french men ſtirred houſes commotion bridled ſtayed certaine lord towne ſeditious people ſome amongſt executed others ſaued themſelues flight cauſe wherefore would haue driuen away french amongſt others becauſe lately many receiued burgeſſes meanes whereof faction weakened part ſtrengthned number new burgeſſes bene added therevnto french time raced many caſtles count montferrat might haue victual greater aſſurance enemie occupied vlpian victualled caſal bene brought great neceſſitie theſe part towne called vlpian great importance spaniard held revictualled comming duke albe gathered together great number peoplemariēbourg mariembourge alſo yeare beene taken lowe country emperour ſame time againe victualled french countrie griſons towne nigh italie called lucarne lucarnois demanded goſpell appertaineth vnto whole communaltie swiſſes citizen thereof required might permitted liue according vnto reformation goſpell becauſe superiours one religion vpon deliberation diuers opinion agreed vnto demaund others ſought hinder appeared towards ſome inteſtine ciuill diſſention yet end towne preuailed wiſhed ſhould remaine religion aunceſtors amongſt accorded therevnto might goe dwell otherwhere found great number forſooke naturall countrey withdrew vnto zurich receiued ioyfully much relieued pouertie great number veſſels laden kindes marchandize came sea spaine towards flaunders vpon coaſt normandie aſſailed force french eſpied combat amongſt horrible many ſhips one part burnt many ſunke many valiant man died wel ſword burning drowning french end carried away ſome number ſhips tooke diepe hauen whence departed happened moneth auguſt end moneth phillip auſtrich repaſſed england flaunders accompanied great number engliſh gentleman finde emperour father bruxels september george count de montbellard duke wittemberge vncle tooke wife barbe lantgraues daughter diſſention supper renewed thē breme hambourge diſſention lord supper preſence chriſts body continued ſpace thirtie whole yeares amongſt learned renewed againe time publiſhed certaine miniſters hambourge breme certaine litle bookes namely againſt caluin iohn alaſco caluin anſwered earneſt ſo alſo bullinger alaſco dedicating booke king polongne greatly complained without knowledge cauſe without diſputation amiable talke onely vpon certaine preiudice doctrine condemned maner papiſts lieu argument holy ſcripture proceed force commaundement marqueſſe marignan dying millaine cardinall trent ſent lombardie emperour king phillip bee gouernour naples duke albe conſtituted chriſtmas day pope according cuſtome created new cardinalls amongſt others iohn gropper archbiſhop cologne councellor alſo cardinall poole made deacon cardinall preſt ſay began ſay maſſe pope lawe deacon haue yet power beginning ianuarie happened great ſtormes tempeſts saxonie miſne boheme thunder lightning endaungered many place eſpecially church ſame moneth ʋitodur suetia litle towne within two league zurich appeared night one tower church ſparkling fire making ſuch noiſe burgeſſes ſides ran put come thither found flame yet twiſe appeared ſay 4 14 ſaid moneth certaine canton suetia ſollicited pope got rome whereas many maruelled king phillip receiued father gouernment flaunders 18 ianuary made ſolemne entry antwerpe moneth february henry duke brunſwic daunger haue loſt good shortly receiued people oath fidelitie made edict perſon ſhuld ſing maſſe exerciſe ceremony country mary queen englād ſhe could church good land might reſtored becauſe pope auguſt wife dead litle retired family great baſill yeare 1544 making himſelfe fugitiue owne countrey cauſe goſpell bought houſes towne caſtle nigh towne called binningen poſſeſſions great reuenew fell downe ſuddenly yet ſay nothing hapned vnto intollerable beare death one authoritie baſe almaine came towne baſill dauid george knew well litle litle hee ſhould diſcouered secretary diſciples maruellouſly aſtoniſhed death becauſe opinion ſhould neuer haue died although hope ſomething maintained ſaid reported would againe take life ſpace three yeares bring paſſe excellent thing hee held houſe ſtate almoſt royall gouernment houſe caſtle well ruled euery one eſtate office family labour ſo diſtributed need thing employ others owne gouernment common good ſtrictly obſerued three thing end might conceale ſo pernitious sect firſt none amongſt ſhould publiſh name dauid george secondly none ſhould reueale ſtate condition hee bene wherevpon many thought hee came ſome great nobilitie others ſome great marchant hauing many factor ſea land thirdly ſhould diſcouer one article doctrine baſill switzer neither ſhould ſeeke drawe doctrine ſumme accurſed doctrine whatſoeuer hitherto bene giuen god moyſes prophet ieſuſ chirſt himſelfe apoſtles diſciples imperfect vnprofitable make v obtaine true perfect felicitie onely giuen vſe hitherto doctrine might repreſſe men keepe vnder young men child ſo containe office religion dauid george perfect hath ſufficient efficacie ſtrength make happie receiueth true chriſt meſſias beloued father father taketh great pleaſure borne fleſh holy ſpirit long time without ſpeaking vnto leiſure inuent rymes againſt meane man durſt ſollicite ſpeake priſoners father ſhewed haue care childe hee ſtraight impriſoned fauourer hereſie perſon could haue acceſſe priſoner dungeon obſcure place neither might hee write beſides miſery horror priſon priſoners endured thouſand outrage menace blowes whip diuers greateſt iniuries imagined sometimes ſuffered eſcape infamy ſome high place ſhewed vnto people impriſonment proceſſes inditements goe forward courſe lawe ordinarily priſoner ſhall ſo kept vp tormented two three foure yeares thing done therein none inquiſitors officer executioner know newes one hath tortured beaten ſpace many moneths haue life muſt diuine geſſe accuſor accuſed diuine name accuſors accuſation firmely ſtrongly denying impoſed laid charge great proteſtations hartie affectioned ſeruant ſubiect popedome life ſo ſaued yet thereby ſet libertie hauing endured infinit pouerties miſerie call penance let goe yet ſuch ſort make france elizabeth eldeſt daughter dead king henry accorded vnto wife committed vnto king nauarre conuoy euen vnto frontier spaine embarked great number ſhips rich father heaped vp almain italy great quantitie rich tapiſtry flaunders approached port iames galicie ſo great tempeſt aroſe magnificall furniture rich gotten together ſo long time ſo great trauell nothing arriued ſafetie ſea made heire phillips country mirth endured long time ſhall ſeene hereafter eſtate france church many trouble yeare violent illegitimate domination houſe guiſe ruled king kingdome pleaſure recoyling prince great lord deſpiſing ſtates cōfuſions brought theſe new gouernours ſtirred great part nobilitie ioyne themſelues together get king hand ſuch people procure good order thing might return auncient eſtate married wolfgang count palatin de rhene barbara george count de montheliard chriſtine adolpe duke holſac two day erneſt duke brunſwick death duke brunſwick prince fearing god wiſe couragious conſtant flaunders began giue order paſſage army certaine bayliwickes yeelded duke sauoyabout ſame time emanuel philebert duke sauoy bernois yeeld certaine land conquered vpon dead duke charles father certaine conference betwixt yeelded three bailiwickes namely gez ternier chablais enuiron geneua certaine condition whereof chiefe ſaid bailiwicke▪ ſhould remain ſtate namely profeſſion publike exerciſe religion reformed certaine moneths duke put reall poſſeſſion ſaid bailiwickes duke alua commeth lowe country firſt exploytsabout beginning iuly duke alua departed italy good armie foote men spaniard piemontois entred sauoy made countenance ſtay geneua fearing receiue ſome ſhame entred le franche comte ioyned himſelfe certain new troupe conducted court de lodron ſtraight marched right vnto bruxelles brabant arriual publiſhed edict inquiſition eſtabliſhed bloodie councell cut offinfinit head confiſcated good ſorts people end moneth auguſt september ſent priſoners caſtle gaunt countes culembourge le fieur de brede •••• ▪ many lordes gentleman gueſts marchants ſigned aſſiſted preaching carried armes adiourned appeare perſon duke alua within ſixe week good noted moneth september diuine nature humane diuine nature inſeperably vnited one alone perſon humane place well diuine explication myſterie maintained perſonall vnion theſe two nature ieſus chriſt doo onely ſignifie together otherwiſe ieſus chriſt peter ſeruants god according eſſence efficacie property diuine nature really indeed diſperſed communicated humane nature ſo thereby hauing egall maieſtie power diuine ſaid diuine nature worketh doth nothing without although authoritie perſon ſerued increaſe dangerous errour yet wanted many learned men oppoſed themſelues betimes againſt errour prooued euen brencius himſelfe without either diſciples could anſwer pertinently therevnto ſuch opinion vbiquitie fleſh ieſus chriſt perſonall vnion two nature according definition brencius true two nature ieſus chriſt ſhould ſeperated euen according eſſence well ieſus chriſt peter faithfull chriſt ſhould god fleſh behold blaſphemie eſtabliſheth hereſie nestorius ſeperating two nature chriſt ſide confoundeth property thoſe two nature heretike eutiches notwithſtanding diſcouered brencius abſurdities blaſphemies riſing vpon opinion yet left maintaine hauing diſciple called iames andreas certaine roſe vp added error vnto error worſe brencius end life place humble himſelfe god ſo moleſting church making teſtament thundred againſt church approoued vbiquitie ſo farre audacious euen alone could vnto purpoſe reply argument certaine doctor liuely refuted condemne church france england scotland suetia others teſtament maintained diſciples time till inſtant hath cauſed great euils kindled fire cannot downe writing continued 28 may vntil 19 iune without fruite becauſe obſtinacie anabaptiſts elector ſent away ſafe forbidding maintain opiniōs teach country 25 may pope king spaine league againſt turke raining corne venetian made league againſt turke fourth day iune rayned great abundance turneprootes pea kinde corne goldtberge lemberge lauben soleſia whereof peiſants poore countrey people made bread nouriſhed great famine afflicted countrey ſide baſe saxonie litle towne called leubourge nie lunebourge hambourge two vſurers ſellers corne deſtroyed maruellous iudgement god one fell dead ſuddenly opened barne doore corne whereof alſo eaten carried away vermine corneſeller going drowne himſelf taken carried priſon hanged himſelfe night following ſame timerodes muſcouites muſcouites made courſes ſtrange forragings vppon frontier kingdome snede meaning enter conſtrained retire goe defend owne countrie tartarians put fire ſword firſt day auguſtfamagoſte yeelded famagoſte capitall towne ile cyprus hauing ſuſtained long ſiege diuers furious aſſaults yeelded compoſition mahomet baſſa place keepe promiſe cauſed ſlaine chriſtian captain ſouldiers came towards certaine day cauſed one mark anthony bragandin venetian gentleman gouernour famagoſte bee ſcorched broyled aliue ſo got whole ile selim whoſe ſucceſſors day peaceable poſſeſſors thereof ſtrange sunthe 29 september almoſt almaine sun ſeene colour bloud ſame day towne reuel chiefe towne liuonia ſucked ſpoyled muſcouites nauall battaile lepantethe ſeuenth october memorable nauall battaille gulfe lepante mediterrane sea betwixt army league turkes selim loſt 15 thouſand men moſt part veſſels chriſtians tooke great number priſoners victorie greatly abated pride turkes yet venetian certain time perceiuing eſtate affaire required peace ſought obtained selim conference dreſdethe tenth day october theologian miniſters electorſhip saxonie aſſembled dreſde prouide trouble alreadie come matter religion agreed publiſh confeſſion perſon incarnation ieſus chriſt maieſtie aſcention ſitting right hand god alſo supper lord theologian saxonie oppoſed themſelues writing imprinted againſt ſaid confeſſion wherevpon many debate followed duke nothfolke beheadeda coniuration againſt queene england miraculouſly diſcouered duke northfolke captaine coniuration arreſted condemned vpon letter executed death almaine greatly afflicted many place daungerous diſeaſes extreame famine snabie bauiere church france good quietneſſe becauſe good countenance king ſhewed vnto religion ſixt day ianuary riuer ʋistule paſſing duchie pruſe strange wonder pruſe nigh vnto thorne conuerted bloud ſpace three dayes great feare people hauing againe taken ordinary colour nine clocke night ſtraunge earthquake two cloudes rent let fal water ſo great force fortie houſes carried away furie riuer ſixe arch thornebridge ouerthrowne 300 perſons drowned fell alſo heauen ſtones ten pound waight wherewith many people ſlaine 22 ſame moneth towne inspruck troubled ſo terrible earthquake endured three dayes moſt part houſes pallace archduke auſtriche church printinghouſe went downe meanes wherof archduke conſtrained retire great parke nouriſhed diuers ſorts ſauage wilde beaſtes euery man iudging world ſhould haue ended munchen bauiere ausbourge part feare caſtle wirtzbourge burnt 29 moneth ſo ſuddenlyfire wirtzbourge biſhop leiſure carrie thing away ſhert loſt fire regiſters title paper winter hauing bene ſharpea ſharp winter moneth continued ianuarie februarie exceeding ſharpe extraordinarie moneth february duke alua thinking haue come vpper hand purpoſesexactions duke alua reſolutions flaunders laid vpon flemmings great exaction amongſt tenth penney perpetual notwithſtanding remonſtrances vnto impoſſibilitie thereof without aduiſe eſtates country could charge taxe yet reſolued put execution people eſpecially bruxelles ſought mean exempt themſelues abſent beholding ouerture thus made gathered company buſie spaniard ſoone firſt day aprill count de la marche ſieur de lumey arriuing ſecretly frō england ſurpriſed ile towne brielle holland ſtraight flusſhing notable hauen zeland emchuſe forſooke duke alua part remedie ſent count de boſſu army spaniard holland ninth ſame moneth ſacked roterdam ſlew great number burgeſſes count lodowick prince orange brother hauing obtained new army france certain lord religion king conſent ſupriſed monts hainaut 24 may ſhortly hee encloſed duke alua troupe houering thereabouts ſtopping paſſages valenciennes alſo take ſtraight againe recouered spaniardsappearance reſt france alſo ſeemed france ſhould haue bin peaceable long time reformed church ſhould diſquieted time come namely regard marriage concluded henry prince nauarre margarite king ſiſter alſo admirall ſeemed great credit court mean wherof moſt part men eſpecially religion imagined already goſpell without croſſe worldly chriſt death pope pius 5 election gregory 13pope pius fift died firſt day may 13 obſequies ended cardinalls elected pope boulognois doctor canon lawe called iaques boncompagne againſt purpoſe diuers competitor called himſelfe gregorie 13 entry gaue order warre againſt turkes confirmed decree councell trent made great ſonne two nephewes ratified promiſes marriage prince nauarre margarite france whereof predeceſſor made difficultie carefully readily prouided good aſſurance temporall greatneſſe death queene nauarrethe ninth day iune iane albert queene nauarre excellent princeſſe amongſt time daughter henry albert margarite valois ſiſter king francis firſt going paris giue order diuers thing requiſit honor prince ſonnes marriage fell ſuddenly ſicke died great griefe religion perſons loued reſt france princeſſe procured meanesthe ouerthrow duke de medina coeli 12 iune duke de medina coeli ſent spaine flaunders gouerne duke alua place ſhamefully ouerthrowne fluſhing loſt 12 hundreth spaniard 16 ſhips foure burnt preſence hee ſauing himſelfe flight bootie great almoſt ineſtimable 15 day alliance confirmed paris betwixt king france queene englandalliance ſent thither lord clinton admirall 16 prince orange publiſhed cauſes wherefore hee againe tooke armes againſt spaniard adherent lowe country 25 certaine gentleman friſe good troupe holding prince orange part ſeized vpō dordrec place holland ioyned themſelues ſide exerciſe religion ſet vp great deſpite duke alua spaniard three dayes afterthe prince orange iuſtified himſelfe emperour prince orange writ large vnto emperor ſhewing cauſes warre mean certain almain lord leuied reiter ſuccour duke alua sigiſmond auguſt king polongne death king polongne died firſt iuly without heiremales gaue occaſion vnto katherine de medices queene mother regent france ſend embaſſadors polongne end obtaine crowne henry duke antou ſecond ſonne liuing 19 iulywar ye lowe countrie emperour put prince orange baniſhment empire pronounced acquited priuiledges right good confiſcated continued ſtrong hand enter lowe country notwithſtanding prince purſued begun moneth iuly 7 8 thouſand french men marching ſuccours beſieged monts hainaut came defeated chieftaines taken monts ſtraighter kept prince paſſed rhene tooke ruremond 4 auguſt louaine yeelded maligues certain townes ſurpriſed drew towards monts ſuccor brother news pitious eſtate frāce brought ſuch change prince conſtrained cut way enter troupe retier himſelfe holland whether called eſtates countrey accompanied ſmall number people retrait ſo encouraged duke alua hauing nothing hinder 21 september made himſelfe maiſter monts compoſition kept promiſe count lodowick cauſing ſafely conducted vnto land empire maligues abandoned prince left place taken taken againe hand spaniard monts duke went towards malines firſt day october certaine burgeſſes cleargie met croſſes banner ſerued nothing much receiued prince towne gaue pillage ſpoile towne ſouldiers tooke pleaſure three day ſlew many men violated many woman maiden horrible murder frācewhileſt lowe countrie church ſobbed thus vnder ſuch tempeſts france thought ſhould haue enioyed ſome long reſt rudely beaten flatly ouerthrowne maruellous ſtraunge accident wee haue ſpoken death queene nauarre ſhe came paris marriage prince ſon prince afterward called king nauarre henry de bourbon couſin prince conde gaspar de coligni great admiral france le count de la rochefoucand marqueſſe de reinel many lord gentleman captaines alwaies borne armes againſt catholike romanes came court marriage king requeſt marriage hauing bin ſolemnized vpon monday 18 auguſt friday following admirall grieuouſly wounded blowe hargabuſh ſhot certaine window man ſufficiently knowne called maureuel waged murderer yea one moſt execrableſt manquellers world afterward iuſt iudgement god loſt ſame arme gaue deteſtable blowe sunday following admirall moſt traitorouſly ſlaine chamber caſt dead windowes vpon pauement knowne henry duke guiſe ruſhed vpon lord gentleman captaines ſlaine alſo ſome within caſtle de louuine others without done betimes morning day morning employed ſuch call catholicke romanes ſleying men woman religion many ſparing woman bigge childe litle child continued dayes following ſo great number becauſe murderer found ſley day wounding sunday king diſpatched letter expreſly vnto gouernours prouinces whereby aduertiſed diſorder hapned beſides knowledge great griefe practiſes enmity houſe guiſe determined take good order therefore meane time hee would edict pacification ſhould point maintained briefly imputed admiralls wounding death ſaid letter called couſin particular quarels houſes chastillon guiſe meer contrary thurſday 28 hee declared cauſed publiſhed maſſacre horrible murder beene done expreſſe commaundement preuent conſpiration admirall partaker wherof notwithſtanding neither councellors made appeare could produce profit although much prooued deſired many whileſt great litle thus hungring thirſting innocent bloud ſame sunday 24 auguſt certain prieſts art made great thorntree churchyard innocent flouriſh noone time day cryed myracle myracle encreated rage people againſt religion although prieſts meane filled well powches ſuch inuention making people beleeue catholicke romane religion began flouriſh againe fraunce yet deuiſe ſoone diſcouered tree remained deſtroyed euen flouriſhed ſome ſaid god ſhewed men eye innocencie ſuch ſlaine ſuch token hee aſſured church ſhould periſh perſecutors pretended ſhould floriſh vnder croſſe againſt hope men tree floriſhed extraordinarily moreouer certain weekes le sieurs de briquemald de caragues excellent men done great ſeruices crowne one armes affaire iuſtice hatred admirall religion hanged ſtrangled within paris preſence king himſelf mother brother maintained euen laſt ſigh innocency dead admiral religiō ſhewing ſingular cōſtancy death certaine yeares iuſtified edict henry third next king name declared honorable alſo mentioned maſſacre cōdemned diſavowed men cōtented themſelues thus haue imbrued towne paris blood like ſort religion handled meaux brie troy champagne rouen orleans le charite burges lyon romains dauphine thoulouſe bourdeaux ſo barbarous diſloyalties cruelty ſcarce poſteritie beleeue dayes paris ſlain thirty thouſand perſons olde yong quallities men woman child bookes print ſhewe euery day king nauarre prince conde conſtrained abiure religion parliament paris publiſhed diffamatorie arreſt iudgement againſt admirall whoſe bodie taken gibet ſo ſecretly buried enemy could finde many perſons forſooke religion ſome vpon infirmitie others vpon deſpight ſo ſo hard proofe diſcerned falſe true chriſtians rochell sancerre niſmes languedoc montaubon querci fewe townes kingdome diuers conſultations maintained themſelues kept exerciſe religion put author murthers confuſions new paine ſhall touched hereafter amongſt ſo many trouble commencement greater ſorrowesa new ſtarre new starre appeared heauen great day starre nigh starre caſſiopec figure lozenge beganne ninth day nouember night ſtirred place ſpace three weekes thought like starre appeared wiſe men came eaſt worſhip ieſus chriſt bethlehem ſtraight birth starre appeared ſeuen ſpace nine moneths thereabouts hereof many diſcourſes made diuers learned men concerning lowe countries▪ prince retrait aboue mentionedexploits warre holland zeland waight warre fell vpon holland zeland whither duke alua ſent captaine montdragon twentie enſignes wallons great aſtoniſhment euery one got ile suitbeuerland conſtrained prince troupe leuie ſiege towne called tergoes meane duke marched armie 21 nouember tooke ſpoyled zutphen towne holland feare others drawe yeeld ſooner without delay manner cruelty executed spaniard wallons towne frideric de toledo duke ſonne lieutenant marched zutphen narden litle towne wherof inhabitant yeelding themſelues 30 day nouember ſo cruelly handled againſt right reddition war amongſt people humanitie men might iudge ſacking ſpoyle roterdam onely motiue cauſe riſing townes vpon point returne vnder yoake taking towne army drew ſtraight harlem inhabitant whereof determined defend rather ſubmit ſelfe vnto mercy people without mercy indeed bore themſelues valiantly ſuſtained diuerſ aſſaultes aide certaine ſouldiers ſent prince kept good defence vntill 13 iuly yeare following yeare 1573 townes rochel sancerre cruelly handledsieges rochel sancerre aſſailed bearen catholick roman diuerſe iſſue rochel well garded defended newes alſo report duke anion ſhould king polongne cauſe rochel deliuered obtained peace yea remained priuiledges sancerre hauing beene troubled horrible grieuous famine ſpace certaine moneths receiued ſome fauourable dealing comming polonian embaſſadors came fraunce conduct away new king theſe thing ended moneth iuly confuſion catholicke romanes loſt twentie thouſand men rochel church began reſpire many tooke againe good courage redreſſe ſome portion ſo many ruines ſiege loſſe harlēwarre alſo kindled holland eſpecially ſiege harlem beſieged men woman executed maruellouſly duty able ſuccoured oppreſſed alſo famine finally yeelded themſelues 13 iuly diſcretion frederick de toledo drowned hanged beheaded two thouſand ſouldiers burgeſſes eſcaped death payment great ſumme money ſtraight disburſed moneth april fluſhing obtained memorable victory ouer army duke alua caſt ſea great number spaniard taking harlem frederic beſieged alemar towne nigh therevnto reſoluing himſelfe make goodly butchery burgeſſes could obtaine conſtrained leaue ſiege great loſſe prince ſide found meanes obtaine ſtrong caſtle rameken towne gertrudenberghe linchuſe ouercame nauall army count de boſſu tooke priſoner 12 day october whileſt leiden beſieged spaniard ſecond day september duke alua forſooke lowe country making iourney franche counte sauoy piemont embarke himſelfe gene ſo ſaile spaine carrying infinit bootie lowe country left great heate warre betwixt hand lewis requeſcens great commaunder caſtile man appearance ſoft condition leſſe fellonious cruell predeceſſor gouernment iohn de auſtriche made warre barbarie ende yeare got tune warre barbary builded ſtrong citadell betwixt tune goulette reſiſt turkes hee withdrew sicilie great commander meaning driue away prince orange incamped middelbourge zeland requeſcens ouerthrowne middlebourg yeelded armed puiſſant fleete 80 veſſels 24 ianuary 1574 made ſaile towards zeland army encountred prince army ſo much long combat commaunder commaunded looking ouer dike iudge blowes aſſurance ſawe spaniard ouerthrown wallons wherof ſome drowned others carried away priſoners almoſt veſſels loſt middelbourg wayed ſiege hope ſuccours turned diſpaire yeelded themſelues moneth beginning february warre waxed hotte barbary betwixt spaniard moore turkes 18 ſame moneth henry duke aniou henry de valois king polongne arriuing france polongne made entrie cracouia crowned three dayes accuſtomed ſolemnities time venetian beeing tyred warrepeace betwixt venetian turke entred accord selym whereat pope king spaine content fraunce entred new troublestroubles france tooke arm normandie poictou king great haſt retired himſelfe germaines paris time followed great chaunges france ſeeming queſtion religion eſtate thing notwithſtanding longer diſcourſe need ſet ſeeing • handled particular bookes depending vpon hiſtory time ouerthrow duke christopher count lodowick warre continued holland spaniard encamped leyden conſtrained leaue ſiege 23 day march goe meete duke chriſtopher ſon elector palatin county lodowick henry de naſſan brother came downe ſtrength winter towards maſtriche good number footman horſemen theſe lord aduertiſed spaniard came finde aduanced themſelues encountred field thornes called morkerheide lanſquenets cry ſiluer refuſed combat inſomuch lord vanquiſhed ſlaine three vpon fourth day april death camerarius ioachim camerarius learned man amongſt almaine inward familiar friend phillip melancton dyed leipſic beeing age 74 yeares 17 day aprill death coſme de medices 21 day died coſme de medices duke florence great duke thuſcane leauing ſonne vnto ſtate tytle great duke confirmed pope antwerpe pilled spaniardsthe great commaunder thinking haue gained ouerthrowe count lodowick cauſed generall pardon bee publiſhed towne antwerpe 23 aprill none came ſo war continued yet three day publication spaniſh ſouldiers kindling mutinie want pay entred towne antwerpe fauour caſtle conſtraining burgeſſes furniſh ſumme foure thouſand florents bring paſſe vſed great inſolencies conſtrained alſo gouernor wallon ſouldiers auoyd towne intent gorge themſelues eaſe alſo ſet farther ſhips guard hauen prince nauie hauing diſcouered theſe ship got quickly hold carried away commaunders view whileſt ſouldiers tooke paſtime ſacking antwerpe ſecond beſieging leidenthe spaniard prceiuing abſence leiden againe victualled returned beſiege ſecond day may held cloſer diuers place made fort number 22 vpon large deep dike moſt part invnited ſtrengthned 2 3 canon fire venice bruxelles eleuen day may great part markes pallace venice burned two day great number houſes venice notable loſſe many marchants happened much bruxels brabant 24 ſame month fire tooke hold certaine gunpowder tower ruine thereof greatly endamaged towne ſlew 15 perſons great warre france eſpecially poictou taking death montgommery normandie gabriel counte de montgommeri hauing fewe men ſuſtained ſiege diuers aſſaultes caſtle danfronc yeelded compoſition reſerued carried priſoner vnto paris long decree parliament head cut meane duke alencon king yongeſt brother king nauarre priſoners court church languiſhed vnder ſo many confuſions laſt day may charles ninth king france death charles 9 dyed age 34 yeares wood ʋincennes leauing kingdome much indebted maruellouſly full broyles henry ʋalois third ſonne henry ſecond born yeare 1551 21 september beeing pologne brother charles dyed vnderſtanding newes death departed ſecretly kingdome tooke poſſeſſion mother kept paſſed ʋenice ſo piedmont viſited margarite ducheſſe aunt dyed ſoone arriuing lyon beginning september hee cauſed certaine edict publiſhed againſt religion ſtood vpon gard ſeeing new prince threatned ſo openly litle comming henry montmorency marſhal de danuile gouernor languedoc entred cōference principal religion leaſt prouince nigh therevnto might come ruine deſtruction ciuill warres procure ſome reſt france prince conde retired almaine king deſcended languedoc hauing failed take liuron ſmal towne dauphine end yeare died charles cardinall lorraine one chiefe inſtruments trouble confuſions france leyden deliueredto come vnto affaire low country ſiege leiden hauing continued sommer appearance extreame confuſion beſieged third day october following refreſhed victualled proweſſe fewe ſouldiers conducted boiſot admirall holland beeing helped seafloud prince meanes pearcing certaine dike ſluces opening cauſed come farre euen nigh vnto towne spaniard fought litle ſeeing water began encloſe abandoned fort left ſiege retired away ſhamefully death selym selym emperour turkes dyed 15 december hee ended warre againſt walaques wherin loſt infinit number men tooke peace venetian ſonne ſucceſſor amurath comming cauſed fiue bretheren put death two wiues selym one great childe ſeeing death child threw ſelfe ground high windowe hauing thus prouided eſtate hee prepared make warre vpon polonians ſome called koſaques ſuccoured vayuoda watachia aftaires francethe 12 ianuary 1575 religion found meanes get argueſmortes ſtrong towne great importance languedoc eſpecially salt come thence greatly furniſheth prouinces ſame day marſhall danuile made league religion publike large declaration containing cauſes doings duke de montpenſier tooke fontenay poictou luſignen yeelded vpon compoſition notwithſtanding church prouince nigh vnto ſome ſort maintained themſelues euen middeſt armes duke ʋzes ſometimes affectioned vnto religion tooke armes againſt hee proſpered much therein church languedoc dauphine redreſſed themſelues king retyred auignon vnion politikes malcontent deſtroyed within wicked liues many thoſe politikes badly aduiſed king henry third ſacred reimes fifteenth day february eſpowſed ſoone louyſe daughter nicholas count de ʋandemont lorraine nothing court france paſtimes ſuch leſſe euil conceale profit deſcribe mean warre continued languedoc well aduantage religiō aſſiſted marſhall de danuille confederate vnto part many enclined ioyned themſelues daily moneth april negotiation parley made paris betwixt king councell deputy church politikes without concluſion contrary warre waxed hot dauphine languedoc loſſe ſides religion ſtronger ſince vpon point ſet downe preſent article done france yeare 1575 worthy note word end april duke dvzes beſieged bai litle towne vpon rhoſne got towne religion held two caſtles conſtrained forſake loſt many people reuenge himſelfe burnt part towne continued ſuch ſackings deſtructions became odious month may ſell tumult marſeillis certaine place prouince againſt gatherer farmer king demeaſnes chaſed away therevpon aroſe band politike malcontent called le raiſes ſhauen becauſe cauſed beard ſhauen ſome part knowne ſigne prouence religion held certaine place riez lourmarin siena others ſome ſoone taken hand 17 day iune le sieur de monbrun daulphenois gentleman wife valiant captaine warre ouerthrew le sieur de gordes gouernour daulphine ſaued himſelfe flight within gap left 22 company swiſſes field broken nine hundred cut peeces ſtraight frenlich colonell ſixteen captaines 18 enſignes carried away monbrun people great bootie armes eſpecially loſt part ſixe men le sieur de gordes gathered great force againe meeting field ouerthrew monbrun meaning leape ditch obtaine meet paſſage retrait horſe fell vnder whereby thigh broken ſo remained priſoner hauing loſt twentie two men thirtie eight taken priſoners happened ninth iuly ſoone decree parliament grenople monbrun head cut ſide duke ʋzes deſtroyed burnt flat countrey languedoc loſſe infinite corne le ſieur de lodignieres ordained chieftain troupe dauphine place monbrun gaue order affaire beginning auguſt tooke many place vpon theſe action ſixteenth day september francis duke alencon brother vnto king conueyed himſelfe ſecretly night court paris wherevpon came brute diſcourſes maruellous ſtraunge diuers two dayes retraite hee publiſhed writing cauſes thereof declaring hee meant procure good peace reformation france hee writ vnto prince lordes religion church marſhall danuile politikes vnto ſame end inſomuch one aſſured himſelfe ſoone ſee goodly thing remained verie fewe feared hid euill diſcourſes publiſhed doo ſhewe meane time prince conde tooke order almaine leuie army enter fraunce armes obtaine ſome reſt religion whole eſtate hee dealt fully duke caſſimere thing requiſite ſuch good king queene mother councell greatly troubled beene loſt retrait duke alenſon writing place calling ſay tag rag made leuies brought troupe field yet without exployt warre made flie report ſouldiers almaine sueuia yet none entred france fourth warre ſeruice vnto king meane demaunded ſiluer townes reſt hee bore himſelfe beene appearance warre mother meane time got towards duke alenſon ſome ſaid make peace betwixt two brother quiet kingdome meane king forbad nobilitie come nigh duke alenſon hee ſent alſo certaine troupe hinder onely comming certaine almaines le sieurs de thore de cleruant ledde ouerthrowne duke guiſe cleruant taken priſoner certaine others tenth october soone truce made betwixt queene mother duke alenſon ſixe moneths wherewith one miſcontented king accorded whileſt prince conde leuied people suifferland armie almaine whereof captaine duke caſſimere marched compoſed ten thouſand horſemen ſixe thouſand suiſſers two thouſande lanſquenets three thouſand french men wallons ſixe great battering peeces ſixteene field peeces 22 december prince conde publiſhed writing cauſes wherefore hee brought armie france diuers place whereof meane courſes taking townes notable happes chaunges reſerued vnto generall hiſtorie time briefe confuſion extreame throughout kingdome ſo much almoſt blinded church became deſolate ſuch feared god ſome iudgement foreſee nothing new calamity thus fewe word eſtate france yeare 1575 eſtate lowe countriesthe eſtate alſo low country followeth moneth february aduiſe king spaine emperour ſent brabant towards commaunder thence towards prince orange eſtates holland count schuartembourg cōſider meanes peace ſaid count tooke ſo much paine therein hoſtages ſent prince ſuerties hollander becauſe aſſembly made brede brabant counte remained becauſe prince hollander perſiſted exerciſe religion commaunder vnwilling conſent therevnto ſaid negotiation came effect incontinently towne caſtle de bure appertaining prince ſonne beſieged spaniard yeelded cowardiſe gouernour moneth auguſt following towne onde water beſieged spaniard meanes wherof prince tranſported himſelf gonde cauſe dike cut wherof spaniard aduertiſed furiouſly beat towne breach made gaue two aſſaults receiued liuely repulſes ſo returned third time becomming maiſters thereof ſlew ſouldiers burgeſſes burnt moſt part towne amongſt thoſe ſouldiers two company scot beeing able ſtand vpon breach becauſe canon violence aſſailants retyred towne nigh great church fought ſpace certaine houres couragiouſly dyed weapon hand neuer would yeeld themſelues foure dayes spaniard beſieged towne called schoonhouē prince quickly ſent thither le sieur de la garde colonell french company holland ſo wiſely behaued himſelfe capitulation licenced go armes iewels ſaued meane commander practiſed ſo certain hollander drew ſome part ſo great aſtoniſhment paſſed army ſtraites iles anne phillip lanat bunenlant got aſſault fortreſſe bommene twentie eight september incontinently beſieged ziriczeo one principalleſt townes zeland king france ſommoned required eſtates poland appeare towne stecziſe king poland loſt kingdome 12 day may performing cauſed publiſhed falne kingdome time adiudged interreigne caſe death publiſhed 15 day iuly following hauing attained age 76 yeares dyed 17 september rodolphe eldeſt ſoone emperour maximilian rodolphe crowned king hungarie boheme roman hauing beene yeare crowned king hungarie crowned king boheme great alenſon wrote vnto parliament paris cauſes wherefore army almanes entered france mightily threatned enemy ment aſtoniſh pariſians ende eaſily emptie purſes meane time ſent meſſages vppon meſſages ſo confuſed mingled together maruell yet preſent thing ſo wrinckled knottedtogether bee impoſſible regard men bee vntied looſed men warre greatly outrayed therefore ʋuerettes common accorde leagued themſelues notwithſtāding diuerſitie religion hold prouince peace againſt ſuch would enter armes duke alenſon ſeeing nigh almaine armie demaunded ſiluer church languedoc ſucked horſleaches ſo hee obtained nothing aided king brother vpon theſe ſtirres deputy church aſſembled paris vnder ſafe conduct aduiſe vpon meanes pacification ſide duke alenſon ioyned himſelfe vnto armie caſſimere prince leaue kingdome confuſion euer appeared yeare following yet notwithſtanding church redreſſed encreaſed diuers place maugre rage deuices sathan whileſt king called eſtates blois made entry 18 day importance called crimpen holland whereby hee warranted suindree place thereabouts ſiege ziriczee commander died peſtilence bruxelles 5 day march gouernment lowe country king remitted hand councell aduertiſed prouided ſo well theyr aſſurance spaniard found gate ſhut wherat ſo deſpited without reſiſtance ende iuly entring aloſt towne ſituate betwixt gaunt malines bruxelles vſed inhabitant place warre began prince conde roſe vp arm ſwore leaue vnder whoſe proteſtation placed deo victricibus armis vntil brought realme former ſplendor dignity reaſons perſwaded peace king got vpper hand thoſe frō eſtates changed religion bookes publiſhed accuſed inconſtancie periurie therein proteſt wil faithful maintainer defender catholick romane faith true liegeman king would conſerue priuiledges theſe hauing cauſed diſimbarke lodge oeicas neare mouth tagus hee went one day view hauing ſome conference stukely hee perſwaded promiſe goe affrike catholicke king becauſe would ſhewe himſelfe partie would contradict pope ſo farre newes could come vnto gaue impreſſe remained ſeruice 24 iune beeing midſommer daythe 2 voyage sebaſtian army affrike sebastian hauing proſperous winde whole army ſet ſaile great pleaſure contentment young vnskilfull guided ſome ſiniſter ſtarre diuine permiſſion would puniſh people went affricke dangerous although glorious enterpriſe leaning realme emptied money naked nobilitie without heires hand ill affected gouernours moſt fierce bloudie battaile portugalls moore three king diedthe death sebaſtian king sebaſtian 4 auguſt battailes ioyned fought ſo valiantly thoſe ſaw valour wondred although ſlew three horſes vnder without whit daunting yet neuer wearie change ſtrike ſuccour part army greateſt daunger many nobilitie remained yet horsback ſeeing army rout ſought king part ſaue standard carried marke knowe taken bearer ſlaine deceiued ſome like vnto edward de moneſes carried followed one inſtead ſo king remained mā loſt ſome moſt truſtie ſeruants one renegado laboured ſaue hauing vaine ſought flie aduiſed yeeled armes would mean agree vnto one amongſt thē holding vpon point foote white napkin ſigne peace went towards moore embaſſador reſt yeeld either barbarous wilfull tooke meſſenger priſoner charged reſt fewe number wearied without courage ſlaine ſay grew controuerſie amongſt king owne perſon occaſion ſlew ſent afterward ſeeke body notable example inconſtancie world carried naked vpon ſaddle pomell royall tent moluc letting fall ground carefully viewed nobilitie preſent publike certificate keeping alcazarquiuer ieronimo conestaggio mulei moluc ſeeing men firſt flie although ſicke vnto death mounted horſe choller going towards ranne away ſtay encourage ſhot chriſtians drawing neare made ſhewe match himſelfe foremoſt fauourites came entreating hazard himſelfe perſiſting reſolution ſtay grew choller laying hold ſword diſperſe time ſeazed deadly fit apoplexie ſwowned fell horſe taken downe hee laid littermolucs death putting idleneſſe made curious note diuerſitie theſe prince death loſt one battaile within ſpace ſixe houres one died naturall death ſecond ſword third drowned hamet proclaimed king hamet proclaimed king moore hee cauſed body mulei mahamet found cauſing fleied filled skinne ſtraw carried triumph end take moore hope conceiued monſieurs voyage flaunders monſieurs king france brother example archduke mathias went flaunders make worke king spaine made goodly entrie euill retreit inſtitution order ye holy ghoſt henry third yeare example lois eleuenth vnite great perſons concord inuiolable amitie embaſſage although beningly receiued prince came yet new diſputations trouble ariſing france death alanſon danger encreaſed chytreus georgius ernestus laſt prince henneberge died preſent yeare idem diuers exployts lowe country iſſue whereof fell misfortune wherefore feeling himſelfe ſicke retyred dunkerke towards fraunce hee fell ſo ſtraunge iudgement euen phiſitians beganne doubt flixe blood accompanied company gentleman good calling ten ſailes ſorts ſhipping iourney tooke ſucceſſe ſhips inforced ſome occaſion miſchance made preſent returne excepted brother w r captaine tooke courſe weſt
