iourney loſt life yeare alſo wr encouraged report men goodnes ſoilesw raleigh fertillitie country diſcouered laſt yeare paſt maieſtie called virginia furniſhed 8 ſailes ſorts ſet ſeasr greenfeeld appointing richard greenfeeld lieutenant enioyning either tarry himſelfe leaue ſome gentleman good worth competent number ſouldiers country virginia begin engliſh colonie ſailed certain number league ſea force violence fowle weather ſeperated one ſo srg ſingled fleete alone arriued iland hispaniola weſt indie midſt iune following moneth may bruges recouered prince parma recouered towne bruges next gaunt chiefeſt citie flaunders matter forepaſſed forgotten vpon condition would reſtore catholicke romane religion become true leigemen king spaine gaunt likewiſe townes taken spaniard paſſage prouiſiō ſtopped vp alſo conſtrained famine entered counſell either deliuering towne elſe ſome reconciliatiō prince parma offered ſame cōditions bruges senator addicted romane religion citizen thought good imbrace imbyſa conſull ſixe yeares cauſe pacification broken expelling pope agent neceſſitie thus conſtraining yeelded therevnto pope daily vrged embaſſador emperour rodolphe refuſall new calender calender might receiued vſed throughout germanie although emperour commaunded kept obſerued kingdome bohemia auſtria hereditary poſſeſſions yet prince saxonie others conſtantly refuſed ſo following counſell augusta biſhoppes moſt part amongſt thoſe ernestus coloine elector biſhop monaſterie began allow dioceſſes senate augusta ſaid allowing calender intended nothing againſt quiet religion policie ſake might exerciſe vſuall marchandiſe ſubiects thoſe neighbour prince biſhops receiued manner confuſion iudgements market publike place citie riſen difference calender might auoyded decree obtained publiſhed augusta miniſters goſpel wrote senator would obey decree politicall affaire church celebration feaſts exerciſes religion would meanes obey pope therefore 24 day may denounced auditorie feaſt aſcentiō chriſt next day 28 may celebrated biſhops finiſhed one moneth senate taking ill part cauſed superintendent carryed citie citizen knowing thereof ran firſt vnarmed weapon gate citie tooke paſtor cart tumult increaſing miniſters goſpell intreatie senate diſſwaded citizen ſedition appeaſed ſome ſhould choſen senate patrician marchants common ſhould determine controuerſie theſe wittenberge senate ʋlme ioyned embaſſadors 4 day iune according gregorian calender 14 doo ſo arbitrate matter al fault remitted throghout whole citie ſhould follow new calender ſhould kept ſonne faedor ſo call theodore chiefe nobilitie whoſe preſence godly exhortation committed whole empire ioyned foure wiſeſt counſellors ſhould haue care empire hee perſwaded warned would abſtaine ieruſalem anger ſo great towards patriarke hee cauſed bound chaines ſhamefully carried citie thence ſent rhodes one cauſe anger towards vnderſtood receiued pope new calender greece chriſtian church ſecond name king spaine pretending ſend inuincible fleete conqueſt england made choyce aduice prioreſſe monaſterie anunciada whoſe name mary viſitation moſt worthy holineſſe bleſſe standard royall ſhee vſing diuers ceremony deliuerie thereof duke medina sidonia appointed chiefe generall ſhee pronounce openly good ſucceſſe victorie duke ſaying hee ſhould returne victorious prince ſtandard carried proceſſion dan franciſco de gordoua spaniard talleſt gentleman could bee founde hee beeing horſebacke ende might bee better ſeene ſolemnizing whereof ſuch number people aſſembled diuers periſhed thrōg preſent archduke albertus cardinall gouernour kingdome portugall pope nuncio archbiſhop head inquiſitor diuers noble prelate gentleman ſolemnization dured ſo long albertus fainted faſting holie nunne comfort cauſed meſſe broath owne diet bee brought preſented hee accepted moſt willingly comming hand ſo holy nunne next yeare holineſſe falſe myracles great diſſimulations found ſhee condemned puniſhed ſame cyp val spaniſh nauiethe nauie king spaine three whole yeares furniſhing 125 great ſhippes 20000 choyſe ſouldiers spaine italie 10000 ſouldiers 2000 peeces ordinance hauen artabrians chiefe generall nauie alphonſus pereſius duke medina sidonia admirall ſea iohannes marſinus recaldeus cantabria hey hoiſted ſailes ſcarce ſight spaniſh coaſta tempeſt diuideth tempeſt ſuddenly riſing diuided ſcattered contrary windes driuen ſame neighbouring hauens aſturia biſcay king hee vnderſtood whole nauy met together coronis commaunded forthwith ſhould goe england ioyning battaile alcazar 1578 xeques ſent spaine brought vp vnder king phillip laſt yeare hauing degree perſwaded become chriſtian baptiſed kinſman noble moſt famous monaſtery laurence vowed euer continue true chriſtians genebrardus 16 ianuary caſſimere duke palatine great ſorrow diſcomfort church geneua departed life ladiſlaus king hungarie boheme died age 18 yeares yeare amurathes emperour turkes prepared warre againſt chriſtians cauſe truce taken yet kept betweene emperour turke great quietneſſe ſubiects meane ſeaſon peace concluded betweene turke perſian wherefore many turkiſh baſſ • e perſwaded emperour make war vpon chriſtian ſo forthwith diſpatched puiſſant army confines hungary emperour rodolphe although hee opinion amurath would deny truce broken notwithſtanding knowing turkes cuſtome reſtore thoſe city taken maketh power reſiſt force g belg william lantgraue heſſe moſt wiſe vertuous learned prince 70 yeares age departed world william duke brunſwicke ſonne ernestus prince moſt ſincere religion dyed likewiſe leauing behind ſeuen ſonnes dorithie daughter chriſtian third king denmarke chytraeus time deceaſed likewiſe iohan 3 king suetia father sigiſmond 3 king poland leaguers promiſed great thing eſtates paris partaker spaine held moſt certaine troth duke parma would returne yet third time puiſſant force doo ſome notable exployt thereby couer ſhame two former voyage ſo aſſure k france king phillip princeſſe daughterthe death duke parma death cut thred life together enterpriſes 2 december 1592 bodie carried parma buried without great ſolemnitie litle chappell cappuchins epitaphe alexandr farneſius belgis diuictis francis obſidione leuatis vt humili hoc loco cadauer eius reponeretur manaauit 3 nonas decem 1592 et vt ſecum mariae eius coniugis optimae oſſa iungerentur genebr senate people rome cauſed ſtatue made ſet vp capitoll g belg much conference commings going letter anſwers frō deputie ſide ſupplications thoſe deſired ſuch ſort king ſince withdrew himſelfe court france 15 yeares made open profeſſion reformed religion cōtrary aduice miniſters went ſee heare maſſe ſung cathedrall church denis 25 sunday iuly receiued archbiſhop bourges prelate certaine peculiar ceremony peculiar receiuing incontinently publiſhed throughout realme diuers cenſures well catholicke nobilitie alſo thoſe religiō wherof one followed example preacher belonging league publike priuately truce diſcourſes paris place maſſe ſung king deceit pope ſhould recatholize lawfull people riſe againſt officer appertained sorboniſts iudge whether pope ought receiue king peraduenture hee ſhould doo neuertheleſſe hee might held hereticke one excommunicate lawfull particular man kill ſhould ſay vnited catholicke romane church chytraeus pariſians townes held league deſired king spaines daughter might marryed duke guiſe ſo crowned king queene france erneſtus duke pomerian prince endued ſingular vertues moſt bountiful church vniuerſities departed life leauing ſucceſſor philippus iulius age ſeuen yeares committed cuſtody protection bogiſlaus chytraeus poland marriage sigiſmond 3 king thereofthe end yeare 1592 anne auſtrich daughter charles archduke ſolemnized idem belgia maurice count naſſau ſonne william prince orange gouernour holland tooke mount gertrude towne well fortified bordering confines brabant holland three moneths beſieged force famine conſtrained yeeld although petrus ernestus count mansfeeld death duke parma king spaine committed gouernment lowe country labour vaine force raiſe ſiege diſſention religionat aquiſgrane diſſention religion raiſed great tumult reformed religion worſt turke ſpoyled deliuered many townes hungarie croalia comming force gomorra moſt valiantly reſiſted preſecuted time chriſtians perſians alſo vpon ſome cauſe vnkowne truce broken inuaded two hundred thouſand men made great hauocke ſparing none turkes ouerthrowneafter chriſtians notable victorie ouer turkes hungarie kill fight put flight fiue thouſand turkes guiſe charles guiſe duke de maine vnder colour reſtoring catholick religiō france confederate pope king spaine againſt henry 4 k france nauarre therefore euery prouince kingdome elected certaine embaſſadors holde parliament paris determine ſet downe catholike king pope clement eight ſent phillip cardinall plaiſans king spaine embaſſadors time king france againe excommunicated afterward duke guiſe ſonne ſlaine henry 3 age 25 yeares nominated elected king certaine confederate senat parliament paris admitting one ſhould king vnleſſe blood royall proclaimed neither would guiſe beare citie thereof chytraeus vpon king france declared barefooted candle hand went temple saint denis confeſſed archbiſhop bourges king fraunce conuerted abſolued hereſie ſolemne maſſe remoued preacher late profeſſed religion court riga liuonia king commiſſariesa motion recalling ieſuites riga amongſt affaire eſtate vrged reſtoring religiō ſame eſtate determined king stephen church likewiſe ieſuites ſhould againe admitted temple iames mary magdalen yeare incenſed citizen expulſed theſe meanes senate people riga ſhould hold church within citie ſuburbes good profit reuenewes belonging senate citizen refuſing entertaine ieſuites moſt vnquiet turbulent ſpirits brand diſcord ſedition alſo better part deſirous keepe continue citie one onely religion confeſſion augusta ſhould altogether obey king authoritie preſent neceſſitie time fate thinking better ſecular authoritie king stephen ſet downe admitted againe cittie ieſuits matter left ſuſpence put ouer k parliament realme ieſuits importunate vpon king k yeare following ſent one iohannes oſtrouius citie inſtructed king commandement demaunded thoſe ſpoyled eiected ſeditious communaltie might put poſſeſſion church whoſe oration forthwith anſwered name citie senate dauid hilcheuius theyr aduocate 26 auguſt peter barrier alias bar peter barrier borne orleans priſoner melena confeſſed ſeduced capuchin friar lyon curat vicar certaine pariſh paris alſo ieſuite cloſely follow king murder two edged knife found confeſſed two prieſts nominated alſo come frō lyon ſame intent ſet himſelfe forwardeſt execution therof ende hee might get greateſt honour thereby hee executed time duke nemours within lyon whence would ſtirre goe eſtates league although pope giuen commaundement chiefe captaines thought meet friend ſeruants deſired goe vouchſafed ſo much ſend vnto knowing leaguers caſt eye altogether vpon guiſe de maine brother mother ſide croſt purpoſes would worke meanes death certaine bold friar lyon perceiuing well young prince pretended bring ſome new matter paſſe within league whereby might leaſt haue ſome great hand gouernment aduice two three councellors complices compaſſed lyon many fortreſſes held ſide toiſſai vienne montbriſon chaſtillon de dombres place quilian forſaking bought great ſumme mony hand lord iulian gouernour thereof done lyon incloſed well water land lyonnois withſtand neither prodigallities councellors men warre forraged plaine country receiuing guerdon reuolt king obedience end acknowledging themſelues roſe vp againſt nemours aſſiſted preſēce counſell archbiſhop ſent de maine 18 decemb tooke hold nemours ſeene three time death doore committing cloſe priſon hee continued certain moneths laſt eſcaping cunning meanes ſpoyled ſuccours chaſed fortreſſesthe death nemours went dyed farre france litle towne called aueci ſcituate sauoy country geneuois ſolemne funeralls henry 3 late king france performed cathedrall church denis henry 4 king nauarre publikely proclaimed king meane ſeaſon pope legat embaſſador spaine vrged election guiſe paris curſed k nauarre ſ oft fallen thoſe biſhops archbiſhop bourges bin reconciled church abſolued likewiſe rome agent miniſters k spaine ſollicited pope would confirne excommunication pronounced legate paris would admit embaſſadors hypocriticall king vowed embaſſadors came one gate would goe 26 nouember duke neuers came rome ſent k france abſolution pope entertained kindneſſe litle hee diſmiſſed denying ſimply abſolution k deferring vntill ſawe manifeſt ſignes penitence chytaeus k france deliberated aſſemble mante certaine chiefe noble realme take counſell diuers matter time needfull deputy reformed church preſent ende nouember king cauſed called together 12 day moneth following hauing giuen audience heard great ſorrowe made vpon infinite cōtradictions decree complaint wrong done vnto prouinces▪ hee anſwered change religiō way changed affection frō would redreſſe griefes make peace concord among ſubiects hee receiued bill complaint haue pervſed theſe affaire driuen ſuch length diſtance many yeares hath buried captaines league hauing plunged realme new miſeries thoſe religion almoſt part kingdome continued grieuous vnder croſſe sigiſmond k poland perſwaded embrace religion ſeruice god comprehended wordsigiſ k poland confeſſiō auguſta flouriſhed ye later time goſtauus former day iohn 3 king poland receiued state land councell vpſalem yeare 1593 ſolemne teſtification confirmation defence ſame religion hee voluntarily offered oath remaineth vpon record brunſwic vtricus duke magapolis inuited 9 april ferdinādo e darbie deceaſed latham h crowned k france henry 4 king france nauarre great ſolemnitie crowned king chartres laſt yeare ſent pope neuers abſolution pope clement eight anſwered hee ſtood need three fold benefite apoſtolicke sea firſt abſolution court conſcience ſecondly lower court conſcience publike excommunication thirdly court rehabilitation ſay kingdome reaſon hereſies hee held vnfit paetrus mathaeus mathias archduke auſtria mathias archduke auſtria emperour brother choſen generall force againſt turke went vienna idem ſame time pope promiſed ſend emperour 5000 footemen 500 horſemen leuying ſixe tent gathered cleargie throughout italie amounted 600000 crownes paetrus mathaeus expedition againſt turkethe prince likewiſe italy ſent aide caeſar euery one able great hetruria 70000 genoua 40000 duke ferrara 50000 luca 20000 parma 25000 crownes duke mantua ʋrbin offered owne perſons force againſt mightie enemie chriſtendome emperour constantinople ionſonius noteat time many vncertaine rumour ſpread abroad throughout ye turkiſh kingdomes happie ſucceſſe chriſtians like haue theſe warres beglerbegus greece whether know euent hee deſired traine turkiſh youth martiall affaire gathered together 600 ſome eleuen ſome twelue vpwards age theſe hee armed little ſtaues brought open fielde hee diuided two battailes hee commaunded one called chriſtians turkes one fight crie ieſus hala hala hee willed fight couragiouſly promiſed rewardes hardieſt ſignall giuen army ranne together fought ſo eagerly many ſides ſo beaten carried away halfe dead called name ieſus got victorie put enemy flight driuing citie beglerbegus tooke euill ſigne many greatly feared chriſtians would bee victor henry king france hauing newly recouered camerake towne picardie hee entered great pompe balignius gouernour ſame entertained senator citizen armed knee deliuered keyes citie firſt cleargie men ſweare senator noble citizen would euer become faithfull obedient god king chriſtian catholicke church erneſtus archduke auſtria offered peace eſtates holland vnited prouinces letter embaſſadors proteſting therein loue belgia deſire common tranquillitie thereof litle certaine priuie murderer elder nemours ſuborned count barlymount commandement court ſaid kill count maurice naſſau priſoner count hage state holland confedarates thinking well dealt withall ſet downe writing large certaine conference dealing spaniard concerning peace late yeares tending fraudulent deceitfull ende beſides complained spaniard way ſeeke quietnes ſubiects belgia chriſtians might lordes tyrannize ouer liſt chytraeus lopesdoctor lope spaniard phiſitian practiſed england towards queene inſtigation earle fuentes countryman promiſe 50000 crownes haue poyſoned maieſtie god thanked attempting thereof apprehended companion aſſociates treaſon emanuel lois stephen de ferera hanged drawne quartered aforeſaid earle dealt one emanuel andrad kill king fraunce odious ſmell poyſoned roſe worthie noted eſtates holland vnited prouinces ſommer ſet forth 4 ſhippes well appointed munition victuall skilfull generalls captaines towards north eaſt leauing vpon right hand norwege moſchouia tartaria ſo might paſſe sinae kingdome china indian iles moloccus hauing paſt beyonde condora obdora region continent new iland sembla wigatz paſſing ſtraites narrow ſea 5000 mile lōg one breadth came oby frontier tartaria narrow ſea called ſea naſſau one ilands gaue name holland euchuſa reſt name commaunded returne ſommer ſo next yeare determined goe ſame voyage better appointed hoped turne traffique spice eaſterne marchandiſe spaniard ſo enriched way northerne ſea lowe country prouinces europe chytraeus turkes ouerthrownethis ſommer turkes notable ouerthrow chriſtians spaniard deſirous continue fire diſſention france inſtantly ſollicited duke de mercaeur one chiefe league vſurper part duchy britaine alwayes continue warre ſiſter loyſe ʋandemont king henry third widow ſhe might make peace certaine trouble happening meane time brake done spaniard maiſters blauet fortreſſe almoſt inuincible builded ſommer yeare 1594 ſtrong fort neare vnto croyſil ſtop entrance port brest would haue bin better made right againſt ſide hauen hinder came marſhall aument syr iohn norris generall engliſh men ſent ſupply ſea vnder conduct captaine furbuſher ſoone became maiſters quinpercouincin towne caſtle morley soone aſſailed spaniard new fort ſlew foure hundred ſouldiers kept without loſſe owne men among captaine frobiſher king ſide deliberating make warre owne realme againſt spaniard agreed ſtates holland confederate begin duchie luxenbourge marſhall bouillon married one daughter deceaſed prince orange e philip naſſau aſſaied enter moneth october found paſſages ſhut vp earle charles mansfeeld making head againſt eſpecially troupe holland king ſide ſought ouerrunne frontier picardie gaue eſtates artois hainaut vnderſtand fauoured ſo little ſuffer spaniſh force moleſt cambray country adioyning hee ſhould make warre vpon incontinent p math 27 day december king returning picardie paris readie booted ſpurd within chamber louure hauing couſins prince conde earle soiſſans earle paul 30 40 lord gentleman court came alſo lord ragne mountigni yet takē leaue maieſtiethe king fraunce wounded euen receiuing farwell yong ſtripling named iohn caſtil 18 yeares age draper ſonne paris got chamber amongſt preace drew neare vnto king almoſt perceiued bodie ſuddenly would haue ſtabd bodie knife reaſon maieſtie readie take vp lordes theyr knee ſtooping hee ſtrooke face vpper iaw right ſide therewithall cutting one teeth wherevpon hee apprehended captaine garde king commanded hee throwne knife ground let goe ſaying freely forgaue afterwards vnderſtanding scholler ieſuites hee ſayd muſt need ieſuites ſhould confounded mouth villaine brought vnto biſhops priſon freely declared circumſtance trayterous intent perſwaded thereto maiſter ieſuite ſaid lawfull kill hee excommunicate church hee obeyed taken king vntill ſuch time allowed pope executed ieſuites claremount fellow brought vp throughout whole realme france commaunded within three dayes depart colledges 15 dayes leaue realme chytraeus death amurath beginning yeare amurathes third emperour turkes ſonne selim 48 yeare age ended life empire much blaſphemie impatience mahomet third beeing thirtie yeares age ſucceeded hee performed father funeralls hee cauſed eighteene brother borne diuers concubine bee ſtrangeled moſt honourably buried father ſame monument ſuffered 27 ſiſters liue teragliuun might bee borne hee comaunded tenne father wiues throwne sea hauing richly furniſhed owne mother ſent dwell farre countrie genebrardus mahomet thirteenth emperour othoman mahomet ferdinand archduke auſtria ſonne ferdinand emperor brother maximilian ſecond departed life one twentieth february likewiſe dyed ernestus brother ſonne archduke austria gouernor prouinces lowe country 42 yeares age idem deputy court ſent ſearch cleremount colledge belonged ieſuites hauing ſeized vpon many paper found among certain written bookes made ieſuite prieſt named iohn guiguard ſince generall pardon giuen king paris written theſe bookes many vile matter well againſt h 3 againſt h 4 liuing containing nothing traitorous practiſes ieſuite ſent auouched meanes whereof found guiltie therefore executed k france proclaimed open warres againſt spaine war proclaimed againſt spaine spaniſh army ouerthrowne marſhall bouillon duchie luxembourge king fauour obtained vpon receiued grace wrought yeelding vp soiſſon pierfont place king duke aumale duke aumale onely remained among chiefe leaguers lawe proſecuted againſt parliament paris found guiltie treaſon higheſt degree ſo image likenes made drawne peeces foure horſes good land confiſcate king moſt famous poet orator italy torguatus taſſus died yeare rome garriſons peronne amiens place held king began againe ianuary former courſes againſt enemy countrie ſtill killing ſleying certaine spaniard wallons marſeill brought king ſubiection george lantgraue heſſe ſonne phillip vertuous wiſe religious prince departed world leauing ſonne lodowicke ſucceed albert archduke auſtria archduke auſtria gouernour lowe country entered bruxelles great pompe accompanied duke fere aumale philippus wilihelmus prince orange ſonne comming great hope peace arriuall made mention peace foreſawe would none graunted chytreus beginning march cardinal gaue ſuch order beſieged within towne fere ſuccoured ſome munition firſt exployt againſt france beginning aprill ſo diſpoſe armie time moſt mightie ſo pollitikely ſecretlyhe winneth callais fewe dayes hee beſieged aſſailed plaine force wonne towne caſtle calais ſpight king force reſiſtance beſieged dyed taking heereof great number nobilitie france cardinall following new wonne victorie fere yeeldeth beſieged ſtrong towne ardres beginning may became maiſter thereof 23 ſame moneth ſeuen day fere yeelded king vpon compoſition chytraeus emperour appointed alphonſus duke ferrara generall againſt turkes thirtie yeares time maximilian ſecond father rodolphus waged warre againſt owne charge hee beeing laſt duke houſe hauing iſſue three wiues deſirous leaue certaine ſucceſſor hee departed therefore deſired pope cardinall est might heire end offered great ſumme gold pope ſtifly denying expedition hungary intermitted duke ferrara chytraeus christian fourthking denmarke ſonne fredericke ſecond age twentie yeares crowned king engliſh nauie spaine moneth iune queene england ſent fleete 16 ſailes well appointed munition vittaile vnder conduct robert earle eſſex spaine proſperous gale hauing paſſed bound france portugall 20 iune arriued neare gades lighted vpon 12 apoſtles king spaine phillip carried 900 ſouldiers 62 peeces ordinance 57 marchants ſhips bound eaſterne indie theſe ſtraits fought valiantly happily ſet phillip fire reſt conueying themſelues deepe earle came land part company came neare citie gouernours knight citie number 400 came ſeeing engliſh ſo well appointed drew backe citie ſuch courage men following ſome got citie ſome aſſult got vpon walles recouered market place although much troubled citizen theyr houſes houſe top ſame euening greateſt part got caſtle lower part citie ſpoiled vpper part ranſomed 12000 ducatsthe fleet india burned indian fleet offered great ſtore gold duke medine would let redeemed therefore ſet fire loſſe 12 million crownes engliſh nauie auguſt following returned england chytraeus spaniard ſeeke reuenge croſſedthe spaniard greatly incenſed daring enterpriſe engliſh owne free gaue great ſumme money king whereby make new ſhips leuie new force againſt moneth october fleete looſed mouth tagus corouis hauen spaine towards fartheſt north territory gallicia ptolomey calleth harbour artabry people promontory artabrum portugall nauie came neare coaſts gallicia night ranne vpon rockes 30 spaniſh ſhips periſhed reſt went forward corouis attempted nothing elſe winter emperour appointed arnold baron echwartzenberge belgia marſhall field hungarie againſt turke place ferrara pope clement 8 would graunt adopted heire ſhould ſucceed anne q poland widow stephen ſiſter sigiſmond augustus died yeare 70 yeares agethe death anne q poland leauing great ſtore treaſure behind ſhee gaue ſiſters catherine child q suetia sigiſmond 3 king anne ſiſter laſt aprill deceaſed syr iohn puckering knight lord keeper great seale died dead palſie buried weſtminſter pruſſia prouince kingdome poland chiefeſt biſhops armed king decree againſt true church goſpell remooued many preacher pariſhes countrie vpon iohn baptiſts day tooke poſſeſſion chiefe church citie turon like done meua stargardia beſidesthe church troubled earneſtly deſired church mary neare market place might deliuered monaſteries briget therein religion might bee freely exerciſed cauſes belonging conſiſtorie referred officialls citie iudged iacobus fabritius gouernor colledgeiacobus fatricius peremptorily cited subcouia allowed preached maintained publikely doctrine caluin inferred againſt expreſſe priuiledges citie conſtitutions commiſſaries decree senate concerning religion senate excuſing ſaid citizen bound appeare citie biſhops ſent commiſſaries citie officialls ſhould proceed againſt king himſelfe likewiſe commanded senate ſhould deliuer vp church biſhop subcouia within certaine day ſhould agree agria neare neighbour poland newly taken turkes court buſied counſell auoyd new danger dantiſcanes quiet till eaſter yeare following eſtate vnited prouinces belgia geldria zutphen holland westfrizeland zeland ʋtricht friſeland groine c q england k france entered league defence themſelues offence enemie k spaine none theſe could make peace without conſent alſo agreed betweene king france vnited state belgia king scotland denmarke ſhould vnited ſocietie league 22 iuly right honourable h cary baron hunſdon lord chamberlaine queene deceaſed sommerſet houſe strandſtreet honourably buried weſtminſter ſecond iune emperour rodolphe cauſed prince elector others dominion embaſſadors thoſe abſent come pallace biſhop ratisbone appeared next morning accompanied church thence court euery one according calling taken place philippus ludouicus ſtood vp made oration name emperour rodolphus caeſar wherein ſhewed emperour turkes sultan amurathes broken truce made yeare 1591 haly baſſa boſua forraged diuers frontier ſpoiled waſted crotia fertile region tyropolia leading away many chriſtians captiues baſſa beeing thereof explained turke therefore bountifully rewarded ſet greater place authoritie ſiege caſtle ziſekna driuen flie receiued death iuſt reward trecherie making turke incenſed hee made warre vpon chriſtians ſent beglerbegus creece beſieged aforeſaid caſtle ziſeckna forced yeeld time alſo ſent diuers choiſeſt baſſaes inuade hungarie tooke two city ʋesprian palotta beſides hee impriſoned emperours embaſſadour orator conſtantinople caeſars requeſt therefore greater defence might made againſt turkiſh power chriſtian prince empire would conioyne reſiſting great enemie chriſt chriſtendome forthwith agreed vnto seſſion great diſſention aroſe amongſt proteſtant prince reaſon elector palatine ſo ſtrictly preciſely keepe confeſſion augusta reſt ſay duke william fredericke adminiſtrator electorſhip saxonie adminiſtration charge elector minoritie recalled brought opinion flaccus illiricus iacobus andreas approoued aforeſaid elector thoſe withſtood oppoſed themſelues againſt either vniuerſities schooles place whatſoeuer hee cruelly perſecuted baniſhed caluinists zuinglians ſo lipſia place vnder pretext colour execution againſt caluinists much ſpoile hurt done many theſe beeing let priſon receiued elector palatine cauſe proteſtants saxonie would ſeperate themſelues seſſion common petition propoſitions held count palatine greater part deſirous peace conſent thereto obiected prince palatine hee contrary religion father hee made orderly modeſt confeſſion faith religion maner haue anyway digreſſed religion worthy father profeſſed whileſt liued beleeued martin iames chriſt ſame beliefe ſame ground principle faith conſtantly hold euer intend father condemned errours arrius nestorius eutychius anabaptiſts ſo ſonne onely condemne ſoule deteſt abhorre errours sacrament two fold ſome make idolls sacrament worſhip reuerence ſignes thing ſigned obſeruing conſidering ſignification sacrament ſome vnderſtand naked ſimple ſignes father deteſted ſo ſonne come nearer father reiected caluaniſme zuinglaniſme ſo ſonne ſo true vbiquitaries flactians faine ſay truth omnipotencie whole preſence chriſt ſhould bee denied vpon earth errour happier father know true right religion vnder name caluine bee defiled ſcandalled certaine ſeditious ambitious perſons germanie father knowne liued longer two mightie elector saxonie augustus ſonne chriſtian vnderſtand seſſion great conſultation compoſition peace lowe country yeare italian made great tumult brabant reaſon ſo much eſteemed ſince duke parmaes death spaniard preferred pay daily italian regarded cauſe left king campe tooke towne sidien brabant fortified ſpace pay ſent wherfore made great hauocke throughout brabant euen gate bruxelles complaint made hereof gouernour archduke erneſtus hee faine ſend certaine company spaniard authoritie bring order make obedient driue countrey incenſed italian spaniard draue certaine hold graue maurice fearing leaſt enemy ſhould become friend went italian politikely praiſed dauntleſſe ſpirits extolled worthy act great victory got vnder famous leader duke parma spaniard offered ſuch iniurie diſgrace like bee borne therefore behoued looke ſafetie better way ſerue vnder king fraunce long might bee well payed italian mooued perſwaſion laſt nouember wrote king fraunce humbly deſiring would receiue charge defence beeing number 1023 footemen 200 hoſemen king commended determining theſe buſineſſe state holland archduke ernestus died bruxells ſome ſay melancholy hee might marrie infant spaine name houſe auſtriche againſt turkes owne againſt confederate better ſucceſſe onely deſpiſed enemie spaniard hee receiued letter long time king amongſt whoſe councell hee many enemy hee died age 42 modeſt ſober prince citie strigon ister bene three fiftie yeares vnder tyrannie turkiſh emperour valour induſtrie count charles manſfield deliuered chriſtians victorie hee ſawe died ſiege thereof lingring diſeaſe prince chriſtopher mountdragon spaniard gouernour caſtle antwerpe captaine garriſons dyed antwerpe eſtates holland vnited prouinces might eſtabliſh make ſtrong commonwealth already inſtituted begunan edict againſt ieſuits publiſhed new edict againſt thoſe raſhly go prouinces city aduerſe faction ſhould come alſo againſt ieſuites againſt ſuch vniuerſities ſubiect king spaine againſt thoſe preferred promotion vnder oath mainteinance romane religion decreed fauourers adherent pernitious bloudie ſect ieſuites ſhould excluded confederate prouinces meanes ſhould againe remitted likewiſe enacted none ſame sect whether borne ſame prouinces stranger time come theſe vnited prouinces either sea land vpon paine bee taken enemie ſo preſently executed although caſe come teſtimoniall letter furthermore within ſpace two moneths depart theſe prouinces returne againe preſent warres vnleſſe ſpace go gouernour magiſtrate ſatisfie euery point renounce oath fealtie k spaine beſides ſubiects beware publiſhing edict doo frequent ſchoole ieſuites belgia academy determined none inhabiting prouinces ſhould ſtudie vniuerſities ſubiect king spaine willing alſo within ſixe moneths edict publiſhed ſhould depart thoſe vniuerſities againſt thoſe haue ſworne maintaine vphold romiſh religion otherſome promoted dignity puniſhment ſet downe heereafter ſhould haue dignity officies publike miniſteries confederate prouinces whoſoeuer ſixe moneths next comming ſhall preferred vnder oath defending romiſh error ſuperſtitions haue alreadie got promotion ſixe moneths ſhall get admitted office ſhalbe thereof authoritie giuen doo appeare ſatisfie edict ſhall execute office thoſe doo obey ſhall preſently depart country doo firſt moneth ſhall bee fined diſcretion ſecond time penaltie ſhall bee doubled ende three moneths ſhall bee found ſtay within confederate prouinces ſhall bee baniſhed euer 24 day auguſt cardinall came antwerpe hee receiued great pompe next moneth following engliſh nauie certaine ſhippes hollander zelanders returned spaine richly laden hungarie chriſtians recouered againſt turke citie hattawan except ſome fewe put ſword 20 day september turkes laid ſiege agria way lieth open tranſiluania bohemia morauia sileſia faire word promiſes deſired yeeld gouernours citie reaſon continuall battailes could poſſibly longer hold ſet fire citie got caſtle turkes entered marched towards agria emperour turkes firſt encounter light skirmiges maine battaile ioyned chriſtians got better part hauing ſlaine certaine thouſands turkes put reſt flight maiſters tent whileſt greedily entended ſpoile enemie recouered ſcattered troupe vpon ſudden killed number chriſtians tent reſt beeing daunted vnexpected ouerthrowe betooke themſelues flight ſo amazed chriſtian hoſte augustine excellent doctor church notwithſtanding alwaies ſo cleare deſired amongſt latines time alſo brought forth great perſons yet men alſo yet ſeene greeke doctor leſſe pure latines eſpecially
